review.title: Beautiful hotel, helpful staff
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is beautiful, with a gorgeous view of the bay. They offer a great (free!) breakfast and happy hour. The staff was very helpful, explained the public transportation system and made great recommendations.

review.title: Hotel was nicely kept, clean, service was good.
review.reviewText: It was a very nice hotel, beautiful, clean, we enjoyed ourselves in San Francisco

review.title: Nice hotel outside of San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Only stayed one night but had a great experience! Free shuttle to the nearby shopping area and a separate complimentary shuttle to airport. The lobby is lovely and I wish the pool and gym were in an altogether separate area but once again, convient for families to watch their kids from lobby.

review.title: Embassy Suites has gone downhill.
review.reviewText: Room was shabby. No air con. Plumbing was ludicrous. Shower drain & sink drain was not working, had to shower with my feet in dirty water. Breakfast buffet food served COLD! Filthy silverware & plates to go with it. Shame. Never coming back again.

photos.caption: This was the relaxing foyer area

review.title: Very comfortable and relaxing
review.reviewText: Our family of 5 enjoyed our stay here, it was nice to be just outside of San Fran as the city can get a bit crazy. This hotel was right on the waterfront near the airport but had very quiet soundproof rooms. It was spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was fantastic. I recommend you take advantage of the free Hilton Homours card then you get free Wifi. This hotel was more expensive than all the others we stayed in but it was economical for the area, San Fran is expensive. The only thing that bothered us was having to pay for parking, it was $22 a day, no where else we stayed did this.

review.title: Labor Day weekend with family!
review.reviewText: We gave it 4 stars because I did not like the service I received from the omelet station staff.  The female chef was rude and unapologetic.  I understand that it gets busy, but she didn't handled the orders properly.  She purposely gave my eggs away to another person behind me, even though I told her those were my eggs.  She made me wait longer for my order.  The person that received my eggs apologized but the female chef didn't even offer an apology.    I stayed three nights and each morning, I observed her constantly skipping over people, messing up orders.  This is a direct reflection on the hotel, so I deducted one star. This would have been a perfect 5 star stay if that chef wasn't so rude.  Even when our room had a drainage issue, I wasn't as upset.  My drain issues were attended to quickly.  Other hotel staffs were pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: The waterfront view was beautiful.  Nice indoor pool.  We love the breakfast!
review.negativeRemarks: Extend the pool time for children.  When we're out all day, it's nice to know that I can still go swimming with our kids afterward.
review.locationRemarks: Away from the hustle and bustle of the SF city, yet close to lots of eateries.  There's a nice trail by the water for a morning jog or a stroll.

review.title: Nice hotel with great running trail on beach.
review.reviewText: Excellent breakfast and good view of SFO airport planes taking off and landing.

review.title: Anniversary
review.reviewText: My stay was good.  The only problem kids having a party so the pool was full and a lot of running and jumping in the hall.
Pretty hotel, awesome views. Comp breakfast is has a large variety of food.

Great hotel
We loved it and will be happy to come back. The breakfast was amazing.

review.title: good location near airport
review.reviewText: no food choices for lunch and dinner and expensive
review.negativeRemarks: parking, restaurants, check in.
review.locationRemarks: airport close

review.title: Hotel dining
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. The happy hour from530-730pm was pretty special. The breakfast was amazing. It was hard to find a place to sit for breakfast so we ate in our room. Our room was only given two towels and no hand towels but the housekeeping gave us more. Overall the staff was very friendly and security was enforced at the pool no drinks and no food.

review.title: great hotel, well located for the airport.
review.reviewText: wonderful facilities, good pool, gym and Jacuzzi and well located next to the Bay and overlooking the airport so it made our last day in San Francisco relaxing and stress-free.
review.positiveRemarks: the leisure facilities and the location
review.negativeRemarks: a coffee bar in Reception
review.locationRemarks: overlooking the Bay with walks outside, and plenty of leisure facilities and a small shop inside the Hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel on waterfront and airport
review.reviewText: Always live staying at Embassy! The breakfast is great! The location is convenient. Wonderful guest services. Clean room
I would recommend this hotel very nice and clean. Free breakfast and it was good not your typical breakfast buffet.

review.title: Great last minute booking
review.reviewText: Even though construction going on, we had a great one night stay at this hotel. Room was very clean, bed was so quiet and comfy. My kids easily could sleep one on the floor and one on the sofa bed. We love the location water front, we had a nice walk along the beach in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Jacuzzi was so small. They need at least two in this hotel.

review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel great view terrific staff wonderful breakfast
Great location and accommodations.  Awesome breakfast

Please make sure you double check the location when staying here as there are two Embassy Suites by the Airport and we accidentally went first to the wrong one. 
The overall was a good experience and very convenient to the airport for our return home. The indoor pool did not appear to be heated but the kids swam nonetheless. We also found a pair of someone else's tweezers on the floor in the bedroom when we checked in thanks to my two year old which made me a bit concerned for the cleanliness.  The rooms were otherwise clean and comfortable. We would stay here again.

review.title: Nice Hotel with great breakfast buffer!
review.reviewText: Only 30 min from downtown San Francisco.  This hotel is really family friendly and offers great accomodations and breakfast buffet!

photos.caption: View to the center/right from our room
View from the center/left from our room

review.title: Beautiful bay views!!!
review.reviewText: Carolina was excellent !!  We'd had a long drive in from Lake Tahoe and she was very sweet and accommodating. We would DEFINITLY stay here again if ever in the area.

review.title: Beautiful trail along the beach.
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, nice hotel. Delicious breakfast options.

review.title: Decent in SF
review.reviewText: Hotel is a bit dated but still with nice deco, generous breakfast and happy hour and a heated indoor pool. For a two night stay it was well worth it although it is about half an hour to get to downtown.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Closer to the airport, easy to access the freeway and city.

review.title: Gorgeous bay view with friendly staff
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the gorgeous bay view out our window and the stunning nightly sunsets. The hot breakfast was great and all the staff very friendly and helpful. The only downside was that our room was on the 9th floor and never really cooled down enough. The staff brought a fan, which helped.
Nice hotel with easy parking. We had breakfast included it was a great option. Evening happy hour was nice too.

review.title: Some good, some bad
review.reviewText: Upon check-in, there were only towels for one person, in a five-person suite (2 double beds and 1 pull-out sofa); Morning breakfast couldn't accommodate us most days, because there weren't enough tables; Staff seemed very confused and un-coordinated over the made-to-order breakfasts, so always very long lines waiting; Breakfast was advertised until 10:30am, which is also when the front desk said it ended, but by 9:30 every day, everything was being put away
review.positiveRemarks: Airy hotel, good pool, clean rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Staff needs to remember that they're in the service business. Half the staff ignored us rather than greeted or helped us with issues
review.locationRemarks: Difficult to get to because of area construction; probably is temporary

review.title: Hotel is very dated
review.reviewText: The property is OK for a one night stay which we had. Overall the place was dated. Also even though the views are nice it can be very noisy with the proximity to the runway during the airports hours of operation.

review.title: not fun to stay here
review.reviewText: Beds are incredibly small for two adults, poll and hot tub very disappointing. Breakfast and managers reception each night were great!!! Dogs barking all day in night in the room next to us was horrible. Staff did nothing but give us free parking. Balcony doors were very hard to open or close. Air conditioning did not work!!! We had to sleep with the balcony door open, otherwise our room was 76 degrees and humid!!! I would not stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Free breakfast was great. Made to order omelette my family loved. Rest of the food was cold and portion sizes were small
review.negativeRemarks: Do not allow dogs left in rooms all day and night to bark and cry!!! Fix the air conditioning and the balcony doors
review.locationRemarks: Not much to do nearby, but close to airport. You will hear noise from planes all hours.

review.title: Very nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Free shuttle service provided from the airport. Hotel staff were all very pleasant and efficient.  Our room was very well appointed.  The restaurant within the hotel was great.  There is a lovely walking/cycling track along the shore with easy access from the hotel - great for walking off the effects of a long-haul flight.

review.title: nice views
review.reviewText:
We've stayed here before it was renovated because of the location. It is nicely decorated and comfortable EXCEPT the air conditioning system is awful! It was 73.4 degrees after I turned on the a/c and the only reason it cooled down was because we had to open the sliding window to get a cool breeze into the room. We had to sleep with it open all night as we were sweating! Another hotel patron asked my husband in the hotel if our room was too warm, too, and he told her we had to open the sliding window. 
As usual, the happy hour was nice as well as the breakfast. The one thing we were disappointed in was that they are now charging $22 a night to park in their parking lot ($12 if you are a Hilton Honors member) and increased the cost of a night at the hotel. I don't know if it was hiked because of the remodel cost or the NBA Finals beginning; we might reconsider staying there again for that same price.

review.title: Overnight while enroute to another destination
review.reviewText:
Room was comfortable & quiet on the 7th floor.
Only significant problem was getting a working hair dryer.  It took 3 calls/contacts to get a satisfactory response.
Also, attempts to contact housekeeping or the front desk were frustrating, because no one was answering the phone.
Breakfast was nice, but not extraordinary
review.positiveRemarks: Location to SFO and free shuttle

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Great breakfast. Refrigerator didn't work. It was replaced. Had to ask everyday for towels as only 3 were left daily for 4 people.  No air vents in bedroom.
It's a beautiful hotel loved the breakfast loved the pool the views the location and the staff

review.title: Nice area clean hotel over priced
review.reviewText:
Besides the rude workers during breakfast the stay was good.  It's as if you were limited on food.  The ladies behind the omelette station asked the people ahead of my boyfriend if they wanted egg white instead and they didn't ask him so when it was his turn he asked for egg white and they refused to make him what he wanted.  The lady serving the food rolled her eyes at me when I asked for one bacon and one sausage.  She just handed me the plate when my order wasn't complete yet and I felt embarrassed so I just walked away.  When we were done eating and heading to the elevators, I noticed there was a young girl that asked for something else and the same lady made up an excuse not to give her more.  I didn't know you were limited to the complimentary breakfast.  Sliding door was a pain to open.  It was clean and comfortable but parking is over priced.  

Went to pick up our dinner order in the restaurant and although the male waiter was super nice and helpful, the female waitress with the red hair had a staring problem looking me up and down.  

I'll never stay here again.  Front desk told me breakfast was served at 6 am and when we got downstairs they said it was changed to 7 am and so we didn't even get Sunday breakfast cause we had to leave at 6:15 for the airport.

review.title: Very nice hotel, close to everything.
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, staff very friendly especially Sean at the front desk. if you need to know anything about San Francisco and to get directions just ask Sean, he will tell you everything you need to know. The only take back is the hotel does not offer a shuttle to downtown, we took the Bart instead and what a nightmare that was, unlike New York Subway, signs are not clear and we had no idea where we going. We had to switch 3 trains to get from downtown to the Airport (never again). The breakfast and the reception at the hotel were excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide a shuttle to downdown.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, close to the airport. Many places to eat and shopping places

review.title: The view is wonderful
review.reviewText: It was nice to wake up to the view of the bay. The hotel is very nice.  The staff is just great. The mattresses were too hard for my taste. I was very uncomfortable sleeping but the rest of the stay was so nice it did not matter. Quick access to freeway made daily excursions easy too.
review.negativeRemarks: Mattresses are hard.
review.locationRemarks: It's an airport hotel so not much around to walk to. Had to drive.

review.reviewText: Close to airport. Shuttle to airport. Could catch the Bart at airport. Was clean. Staff was friendly and very accommodating. Breakfast was very good. A pleasure.

review.title: Love the location, and breakfast is good!
review.reviewText: We love this hotel. The view of the airport is great. We love the free breakfast. And it's a short drive to the city.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with wonderful amenities
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful 2 day stay here. The made to order breakfast was outstanding with something for everyone. There was a party on Saturday night that made the atrium quite noisy but once we shut our room door we could not hear the music. We were not disturbed by other guests at all in fact once in our room heard virtually nothing from outside. Spectacular view of the bay and airport. Close to restaurants and a convenient drive into San Francisco. The only down side was that we were with a group all staying on different floors and we could not access any floor other than our own from the elevator in the evening. They do have an outstanding public space though and so we utilized that instead!  Wonderful experience comfortable beds, great breakfast, would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Fantastic space, great breakfast
review.reviewText: Comfy bed, excellent food and great and friendly staff

review.title: Great view and comfortable surroundings.
review.reviewText: We have a party of 6 in a suite with the great view of airport and lake.  Room is very comfortable for 6. We are very happy with the suite with free beeakfast.

review.title: The best hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stay at this hotel at least a dozen times a year and it is consistently wonderful.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast, the afternoon drinks and snack, the beautiful view, the rooms and great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Sometimes the line for made to order breakfast is extremely long.
review.locationRemarks: Beautiful location, so close to the airport and not too far from the city

review.reviewText: We stayed overnight.  The pool and gym facilities were clean, and so was the room.  Beds were comfy and breakfast was good.  Wish they offered more snacks during the afternoon reception but the free drinks were a plus.  Overall, it was a comfortable stay and we will definitely be back.

review.title: Nice place, but a few quirks
review.reviewText:
We liked staying here as a family with kids. The staff was polite and friendly. The rooms were fine. The atrium was cool. 

There were a few weird things, but no huge deal-breakers. First, the bathroom door didn't lock. There weren't towel racks, which was inconvenient. They gave tickets for the free breakfast, but they were never required or asked for. Housekeeping started early (around 8am), and if you missed out on the first rounds, they didn't return unless you specifically asked them to. Parking was $22/day, which is a bit high. Neighboring airport parking lots charged $10/day. 

Overall, a nice place. We'd probably stay there again if we needed to. Id look for other places first, but this place isn't bad.

review.title: Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: The hotel had a welcoming feeling due to the staff were all very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast is convenient especially if you are with small children. We enjoyed the evening cocktail hour especially because it was nice to have a drink after being out day.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Food was great. Staff helpful. Clean and the location was great for walking on paved trail. Shuttle to and from airport and shuttle to nearby burlingame. Would recommend highly.

review.title: Great Experience!
review.reviewText: We were there for a quick overnight trip.  The kids loved the indoor pool, although it was a bit crowded.  The free drinks and free breakfast more than made up for it!

review.title: Hilton Class carries on
review.reviewText: Good stay, the building and sliding doors have been here a long time but you are treated well and the hotel is well kept.
Close airport with no plane noise.     Beautiful view of bay.   Hotel staff was excellent at check in.   Parking was a little limited.

review.title: Impolite Front Desk Hotel Staff
review.reviewText:
Upon arrival, the front desk staff show a aggressive look & talk very loud. Being very Rude.
No welcome note given & keep stating there is an additional parking charges pertaining to my hotel booking, especially my booking comes with free car parking facility. 

The front desk didn't even provide what are the benefit the hotel provide.
review.negativeRemarks:
Hire the right front desk staff.
Key to Hotel management success
review.locationRemarks: Good nearby restaurant

review.reviewText: Good family hotel. Enjoyed pool and made to order breakfast.

review.title: Overnight stay
review.reviewText: We had a nice over night stay and staff were helpful and professional. Kids enjoyed the indoor pool. Felt like we were at a resort and kids wanted to stay over one more night. Good breakfast was another highlight of our stay. We had a nice cozy room. This will be the hotel that I will be checking into every time we are visiting San Francisco
We loved the breakfast and happy hour!  The staff was always so friendly and helpful!  The pool area was also nice & clean, as was our room.  We had a great vacation staying here!
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport, but not a lot of restaurants within walking distance.

review.reviewText: Good location, spacious room, clean, excellent breakfast.

review.title: great location for airport
review.reviewText:
We had a great stay at this hotel, enjoyed the spa and pool and free (full) breakfast - also the free happy hour!
Nice area to walk around and great views of the water.  Shuttle to and from airport is nice to have too.
review.positiveRemarks:
location, location, location
pool and spa
happy hour in the atrium
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast might work better as a buffet set up in the middle of the atrium
review.locationRemarks: airport location is perfect

review.title: Great location, great staff
review.reviewText: Arrived late, check in was efficient. Staff was very helpful directing me to restaurants in the area that were open 24/7.
review.positiveRemarks: Great breakfast, close to the airport. No hassle check in. Located on the waterfront walkway.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything that I needed was provided.
review.locationRemarks: Had no time to sightsee. Walked along the water front. That was enjoyable.

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: Clean and nice hotel right besides the bay, beautiful view! Nice staffs!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I always stay at embassy suites when I have the chance because of the breakfast and nice amenities of some embassy suites. I am very particular with the cleanliness of the room that I get. With my recent stay, I am not happy with the cleanliness of the room, I saw strands of hair on the bathroom floor and the carpet under the bed was dirty with food scraps ( I think, I'm not sure but it was pretty dirty).

review.title: Great hotel for family's
review.reviewText: Came to town for a wedding other family members did as well, and we had a great time visiting at the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast, happy hour, beautiful inside and out, friendly and helpful staff.
review.locationRemarks: Went to a wedding

review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was nice next to the bay and airport. Had a good time and the breakfast was really good!
Great hotel. Love staying here with my Family. Kid friendly and the rooms are great!

review.title: One night only... Super Bowl 50
review.reviewText:
Check in was slow, seemed a bit disinterested... It was after midnight...

Room was comfortable and clean...

Breakfast was hot, full, & free... Breakfast staff were very hard working and accommodating.

review.title: Beautiful hotel.. friendly staff.. awesome! !
review.reviewText: Everything was great !! Beautiful room and hotel.. outside grounds were incredible. Love having the living room space in room for hanging out with guests.. refrigerator and bar ..microwave .  Only  complaint is that they may need to staff extra help in dining area during breakfast. Poor lady was working so hard to keep up. . Clearly more help was needed to accommodate a full dining area. But the food was awesome.. I will always look for deals to stay at a Embassy Suites when possible.

review.title: Great location and great hotel!
review.reviewText: From the minute I walked into the hotel to the minute I checked out, I absolutely loved this hotel!!! Great location, beautiful room and the hotel overall was just amazing! I will definitely be coming again!

review.title: good location near airport
review.reviewText: as we had travelled from Japan and needed to be at airport in morning we requested a wake up call.  Never got it.  Just about missed the shuttle to get us to airport in time,.
review.negativeRemarks: following through on request for wake up call.
review.locationRemarks: good walking path beside harbour.

review.title: Great package
review.reviewText: Food was great. Clean. Room temp was too hot.  Bed was comfortable. Appreciated having space to spread out.
review.negativeRemarks: Ability to regulate room temp
review.locationRemarks: We stayed there to be close to airport

review.title: Needs to be cleaner..
review.reviewText: Stayed one night with a family on a layover. Resteraunt was good and complimentary breakfast the next morning was also very good. The room on the other hand had itineraries from previous visitors left along side the bed along with empty chocolate boxes. Behind the sofa and chairs also were littered with candy wrappers and filth. Overall experience was good food and a dirty room. Probably pass next time through.

review.title: convenient and nice
review.reviewText: we had to stay for a volleyball tourney and it was close to all the bay area and a clean and comfortable room
review.positiveRemarks: we had to leave before they started serving breakfast in the mornings so they packed us a box to take - very nice

review.title: Great for the whole family!
review.reviewText: We were searching an overnight stay for all 5 of us, 3 adults and 2 children.  We found the best set up at the Embassy Suites with 2 double beds, a pull out bed, and we ordered a portable crib for our 2 year old.  The staff were very kind and helpful.  We loved the happy hour free drinks and snacks, the delicious meals at Tap and Tavern, we got the best nights sleep in our comfy beds that night, and the free breakfast in the morning was perfect for us to collect to rush off to the airport at 6a.  The room is lovely and spacious, great for a family!
review.positiveRemarks: The free drinks and snacks at happy hour was such a bonus!  The food at Tap and Tavern was AMAZING.  Staff was attentive and helpful.  Breakfast, yum!
review.locationRemarks: Convenient free shuttle service, short ride, too and from the airport.

review.title: Very family friendly.
review.reviewText: Lots of hustle and bustle, great breakfast and suite size is perfect when you have young kids.
Surprisingly wonderful hotel, great location.  Nice restaurant on site and five minute walk to beautiful restaurant.

review.title: Nice and quiet hotel.
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful, I don't remember her name but when I told her that I'm a HHONORS member but I forgot my password to get the wifi, she just ask my Hhonors account number, right away I got the wifi. Thanks to the woman at the front desk.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the beach and a good breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the SF Airport, BART Station, can walk and jog outside and there's a place nearby to eat like lobster sandwich.

review.title: Nice hotel - waterfront on the bay
review.reviewText: Check in was a bit frustrating as they did not have our room available due to supposed unforeseens.  They made good on it with free parking and free wifi and gift certificates but only after we inquired about what they were going to do for us.  We had to move rooms mid week.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service staff at front desk.  Cleanliness in parking areas, building entrances, and common areas.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Love the suites!
review.reviewText: We have stayed at Embassy Suites for years...in the early years because we had 4 kids and one regular hotel room wouldn't work.  As the years went by and the kids left home we have stayed with ES because of the convenience and roominess of the Suites, plus you just can't beat their breakfasts and happy hours!

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText:
Complimentary shuttle to SFO every 20 minutes but charging for parking. initially called 22$ but then reduced it to 10$ per night.
Pool nice and warm and reasonably clean. Kids loved it. Kids allowed till 10pm.
2 hrs happy hour every day, free drinks and snacks. Don't expect 1st class for free, that you can buy at the bar, which is well sorted and tended by the way (3 out of 6 classic malts ain't bad, 6 would be better).
Breakfast repetetive with long lineups (for pretty good omelettes) at times. Cleaning staff for breakfast tables during breakfast understaffed and in turn unable to keep up. Not enough tables for that amount of people, same with highchaires.
Great experience nice hotel overlooking San Francisco airport

review.title: Nice hotel in the vicinity of SFO
review.reviewText: Very good experience. Room were quite comfortable for a family of five. Beds were quite good. I really liked that there was no charge for the use of their parking space, which is quite rare in SF.

review.title: Great for family
review.reviewText:
With kids, having a pool made a great difference( well we booked this hotel for that).
Water was cold for adult.. But kids didn't care. Front desk staff is nice but other staff doesn't greet you much. But it's ok for 3.5 star. They weren't rude either.

Pro: inhouse pool, two separate rooms with tv so kids and adult can watch something different, great sea view, free order to cook breakfast

Con: windows were so dirty you couldn't see the view! They charge 50 usd for pet(too much!), they charge 22usd for parking (the hotel is in middle of nowhere they shouldn't charge anything). 

Overall, it is 3.5 star hotel but considering the room rate we paid, we give 4 star. They had extra charges but they gave a discount (to more standard price), so I would keep 4star.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the window! And scrap(or at least lower) the hidden charges
review.locationRemarks: Nothing much in walking distance but few restaurants in 5mins with a car.

review.reviewText: Nice Hotel. Very comfortable. If you are looking for something close to downtown then this is not for you.

review.title: Large room. Great breakfast
review.reviewText: Good place for stop over but would not mind staying for a vacation.

review.title: Nice hotel with large rooms and God common areas
review.reviewText: We staid one night. Very convenient to get the free shuttle.
Clean and comfortable. Did it like the $22.00 a night parking fee was surprise to us at check in.

review.title: Family friendly hotel near San Francisco.
review.reviewText: It was a holiday weekend so it was busy at the breakfast buffet,  more sitting areas needed.

review.title: Great Location and Relaxing stay
review.reviewText:
I had booked this hotel for my mother and she completely loved the experience!. 

She was going to reach in the early hours of the morning and I was really worried about early check-in. However, the hotel staff was very supportive and understood our need. I was specially impressed that they took care of her by allotting a room closer to the lift so that she wouldn't have to walk much.  

This hotel also offers a free shuttle from the airport which is an added advantage. 
The brilliant location, both in terms of distance and serenity of the waterfront makes this hotel a great package deal!

review.title: No second guessing
review.reviewText: Shuttle service is on time, with courteous driver. Reception desk welcoming attitude. Atmosphere in the htel, inside and outsde is comfortable and inviting. Room is looks and smells good, clean, roomy for two persons. Quiet at night. THE BREAKFAST IS EXCELLENT.
review.negativeRemarks: don't disturb what works.
review.locationRemarks: location is terrific, lots of amenities.

review.title: Frigid. Artic like temperatures throughout propert
review.reviewText: Reception staff trained to fabricate story about hotel's central heating and a/c - will offer a shoe box size space heater   Bring thermals and down jacket. And, be prompt to pay daily parking fee.

review.title: Love their breakfast, main reason why we stayed.
review.reviewText: Ladies at concierge were very nice and courteous. My key didn't work on the second day and one of the ladies came with a new key rather than ask me to come down.

review.title: The staff was excellent.
review.reviewText: The exterior grounds had slot of trash from our arrival until our departure. The thermostat did not work in our room. Very quiet hotel. Excellent food.

review.title: Nice view of S.F. Bay
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel and room with view of the SF Bay.  We could watch the planes come in for a landing from our hotel window; no noticeable noise from the jets.  The front office staff were very accommodating.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby is very lovely with lush vegetation and a bridge over a koi pond.
review.negativeRemarks: The day after Thanksgiving they were understaffed and ran out of breakfast items so we had to wait 45 minutes in line.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Burlingame which is a lovely town with lots of first rate restaurants and shops.

review.title: Magnificent place to stay when in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: What a fabulous place to rest: beautiful, clean, very spacious, gorgeous indoor pool area, yummy daily healthy snacks and delightful free alcohol and made to order complementary breakfast. I can't say enough nice things about this place. Gorgeous setting/scenery on waterfront, only  a 10 minute (free) shuttle ride from airport too. So happy to have stayed here the night before returning home. HIGHLY recommend staying here! Very impressive!
review.negativeRemarks: Staff was good but not overly engaging or friendly. perhaps that comes from the busy environment.
review.locationRemarks: Beautiful setting. I hear it is only a 30 minute public transit ride to main areas in SF. We really enjoyed the indoor pool and jacuzzi.

review.reviewText: Old hotel. Great ocean view - filthy windows. Dishonest check in staff.

review.title: Convenient to Bay area activities
review.reviewText: We have stayed in Embassy Suites from Chicago, Houston, NY, LA etc.so we are familiar with the set up. I appreciated that the breakfast serving time was long enough so that you did not have to rush downstairs at 7:30 to get food. The servers were all very helpful and nice too. The rooms were clean and spacious as expected.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to our activities in Burlingame, Hillsborough, and San Francisco. We also love having the door close between the living area and bedroom!
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice to have some towel racks in the bathroom. There were none! We ended up hanging towels on the shower rod etc but nothing dries out.
review.locationRemarks: Close to all Bay area activities since it is right off 101.

review.title: it was okay
review.reviewText: The room was okay and the front staff. Although it never stated that there was a parking fee and the wifi never worked. I stayed there so I can get some work and get some rest and I could not connect to the internet. I called the it person who was very pleasant, but I had to stay in certain areas of the room to connect. I got frustrated and just checked out early. I was kind of disappointed, because I paid for the wifi also.
review.negativeRemarks: if they are going to charge for parking they should enclosed it and also they need to get a better wifi service.

review.title: Cleaned and nice room. The view was so nice
review.reviewText: so easy to check-in. The people from the deck were very nice
review.positiveRemarks: The place was nice especially the indoor garden.
review.locationRemarks: very close to the airport and to everything

review.title: What more could you want?
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Nice clean room, comfortable beds, friendly staff, great free breakfast and evening reception.
review.positiveRemarks: I enjoyed the suite. The two separate rooms allowed for both together time and privacy. Good location, nice beds, clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Not sure.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport but quiet. Walking trail along side the hotel.

review.title: Spacious quiet and clean room
review.reviewText: I had a good night's sleep, after a long trip.  The shuttle service was on time.
review.locationRemarks: only stayed for one night.

review.title: I would go back to this hotel for future travel
review.reviewText:
Overall experience is barely average:
- Air conditioning is not working, Since weather was cold at nigh the room was cold for the kids and since the air conditioning can't be controlled from the room they brought me a small heater which barely helped.
- Breakfast experience was bad, since you need to queue everywhere. I guess since they wanted to control how much scrambled eggs or sausages each customer can get, they put an employee on each table, so in stead of self service you need to wait for the guy to fill your plate which made it extremely slow and took us forever to finish breakfast.
- Car parking is not secured, Two cars had their side window broken in my 3 day stay at this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: View on the bay from the room.
review.negativeRemarks:
- Make air conditioning controllable from room
- Make the breakfast self service so reduce queues and wait time
- More security at the parking
review.locationRemarks: Fairly close driving distance to San Francisco downtown and other attraction including piers / Golden bridge

review.reviewText: Well.worth the price. Would stay again. Actually extended our stay fpr 3 more nights

review.title: Decent hotel on the bay.
review.reviewText: Right off the 101 freeway and easy to get anywhere from the airport to the city. Breakfast in the atrium is varied and tasty, but go early if you don't want to stand for 10 minutes or more in the omelette line. Truly, the only issues we had are that parking costs (seriously! self park in a standard parking lot is $10 a night) and there is NO insulation between rooms, so Friday night I didn't get much sleep while the neighbors were partying. The alarm clocks have an MP3 plug, so I rocked my masking/relaxation sounds so I didn't hear the neighbors rocking their music and conversation past 4am (they weren't very loud, but every bit of it came through the wall). Hot water in the bathroom.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, view, price, breakfast, hot water, pool available, koi ponds.
review.negativeRemarks: Insulation would be nice, but since almost no hotels have that, hope to not be next to partners when you travel with your kids.
review.locationRemarks: It's near the airport and Coyote Point and also really near the 101 freeway. I'd say the CalTrain is a loooong walk from the hotel for kids.

review.title: Nice family hotel
review.reviewText: Great family hotel, rude night front desk personnel.

review.title: Great Place to stay
review.reviewText: Located 20 minutes south of Fishermans wharf very nice clean and quiet. Beautiful ocean / bay view friendly staff and nicely decorated suites.

review.title: I always stay  at ES
review.reviewText: Happy hour bud bud light 2015 no one drinks bud!La Jolla offers blue moon. Stale chips no vega tables.   I would pay extra for a better selection cheese fruit, 0

review.title: very nice hotel very close to airport.
review.reviewText: It was just a really nice space to  be in for our stay.  good breakfast, wonderful roomy room. a working, untempermental shower, very clean.
review.positiveRemarks: It was just a really nice space to  be in for our stay.  good breakfast, wonderful roomy room. a working, untempermental shower, very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: tavern in hotel:  service wasn't very prompt.  server was very friendly, but we had to seek her out repeatedly.

review.title: What is up with the security? Normally nice...
review.reviewText: We love this hotel, have been there several times.  The employees are very nice.  This time there was lots of security folks - rent a cops - milling about - not the nicest folks. Treating one like a criminal to want to swim?  Really?
review.negativeRemarks: Teach the security rental cops some manners please, we are the guest, not someone that needs to be screened for pool entry or to move about the hotel.

review.reviewText:
Great stay, friendly staff at check in
Great view of Ocean

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText:
Great stay with awesome customer service.
You would definitely get your value for your buck .

review.title: a bit worn/dated and too much money  to self park
review.reviewText:
The room was good for the three of us, but the breakfast area was dated and in need of  some revamping.  The thing that annoyed me was that I paid close to $300 for one night and then they tagged on a mandatory $22
a night to park my own car in an open parking lot (not even a parking garage)....this seemed excessive!  I am a Hilton Honors member  and that did not take away the parking charge  either.
review.positiveRemarks: proximity to the airport and Burlingame
review.negativeRemarks: update  tile and décor in the restaurant

review.title: Personal stay near SFO to watch airplanes.
review.reviewText: We grew up in the area and wanted to stay near the airport. We were in Sonoma the day before and stayed one more night at the Embassy. The rooms were very nice and spacious. We enjoyed a nearby dinner and returned for the managers service. Enjoying a glass of wine with my wife. The breakfast was wonderful. The night we stayed, there was a private event downstairs (a wedding reception). Around 7:30 PM, the band started and the music became so loud that the hotel was mildly shaking and guests were complaining. Our room was no exception. I mean the music was so loud, we could not carry on a conversation in our room. We walked outside hoping the noise level would subside but it did not. My wife was unable to sleep until the music stopped at 11:00 PM. I enjoy the happiness of a wedding party but management should have put a noise level restriction that was reasonable. We (and many other) guests were angry that the music was too loud - too long and not addressed.
review.positiveRemarks: The atmosphere - the size of the rooms - the managers special and the breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room had no towel bars. We were using towels and then hanging them over the shower curtain, bathroom vanity and toilet.
review.locationRemarks: The airport and the many restaurants along Old Bayshore.

review.title: Short trip with grandkids
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful!  Our grandkids loved the appetizers in the evening, the pool and the great breakfast.  Our room was very spacious and very clean and it was so nice to have the extra space.  We overlooked the water which was beautiful!  We will definitely be back!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Great location by the airport.  We came from Fisherman's Wharf to spend the night before we left for home the next day.

review.title: Vacation getaway to the West Coast!!!
review.reviewText:
Stayed at the Embassy Suites Waterfront property in Burlingame, CA.
Quite Area, nice walk-path adjacent to hotel. Scenery inside is top-5. Great cook to order breakfast, rooms are high quality, spacious, fridge and microwave, very helpful. Great views, from the waterfront.

I should have known when I was asked to sign the "No Partying" agreement at check in. Sure enough, one night during our stay we had what sounded like the entire population of a local community college in the room next to us. I had to call the front desk four times until they finally took care of it.

Had to do a load of laundry. Paid $0.75 into the detergent dispenser on the 3rd floor -- nothing. Went up to the 8th floor (where the same detergent costs $1.00 ?!?!?!) and had the same result. They had no extras at the front desk, so all they could to was reimburse me the $1.75. I then went to the grift shop and paid $3.99 for a box of the same detergent.

The one positive here was the staff: They were helpful, courteous and eager to please. Kudos to them!

Too bad their hotel is a shambles.
Had a late check in... staff were very courteous. .. breakfast was good... rooms were very good...

review.title: Beautiful view
review.reviewText: When I arrived at hotel I had to wait to check in being on the older side meaning 65+ they could not make arrangements to help out with check in an hour or so before I was willing to pay extra even. Also the room that I booked and the room I got were not the same.the pool was lovely after all the commotion of other guests I was finally able to step in about 10:30..the beds are so comfortable and the breakfast was hands down wonderful.The staff was very friendly and helpful however trying to find a staff memeber was like where is waldo.

review.title: A real 4 star
review.reviewText: It's everything that I expected for the money that I paid for

review.title: So so. No Wifi, People in the desk, Medum rare
review.reviewText: We did the very important write request in the Expedia  request section about the bay view , when we arrived to the hotel on the desk They said , NOPE  !!!!  We don't have any Room with view available and we have to pay MORE than the  We alrrady Booked with Expedia, THAT SUCKS, forget the pool is just a tiny things for kids and so crowded for little fellas !!!!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Very nice staff. The room is verycomfortable and clean!
The beach beside the hotel is very beautiful!
It's very convenient to airport by hotel shuttle.
The breakfast is very delicious.
The staff very patient and kind to guest.
I'll book this hotel next time!

review.title: Clean. Close to the airport
review.reviewText: A++. Would stay there again. Breakfast was delicious

review.title: Nice hotel by the ocean
review.reviewText: We satisfied with our stay . Nice view and quiet place to relax
Room was big and family like to there. Many travelers in the hetel and morning time too busy serve to them. If can do hetel...more table will be ok...

photos.caption: View from trail in front on hotel

review.title: Nice hotel close to bay!!! Good free breakfast!!!
review.reviewText: Awesome vacation...hotel staff were nice and accommodating...waitress in hotel restaurant was very informative on things to do in SF.....Thanks Amy!!!!

review.title: Great breakfast, friendly cooking staff
review.reviewText: Our next door neighbor was drunk and knocked on our door at 2am along to others as well. It was scary as security took a long time to respond.

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: Great room for a family of five. Nice and updated hotel lobby and restaurant garden. The only thing missing in the bathroom are hooks or hangers for towels or clothes.

review.title: Close to San Francisco airport
review.reviewText: Room was very dirty, I can't understand why another  $50 was taken out of my account without my consent. Beware booking through Expedia. The price shown is dollars, but when taken out of the account it's £ sterling, it ends up costing about  $25 more.
I would  stay  at  this hotel  again. Bice location  near the airport.

review.title: Satisfactory stay, but nothing extraordinary
review.reviewText: The hotel was pleasant and satisfactory. while the staff was very friendly, the hotel really needs to invest in a concierge. Although the staff tried to help with our various questions, they really were not sure. Even when I asked about how far the walking  / running trail was that was located in front of the hotel, they really couldn't help. The complimentary breakfast was not worth the 30 minute wait for an omelette. Our fridge was not working and was over heating when we arrived to the room and we had to ask for extra towels each night we stayed. Although the staff responded very quickly, these were some of the things I feel we should not have to ask about.

review.title: Very nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Large and clean suite. Beautiful atrium, hot breakfast, and friendly staff, plus swimming pool and fitness room.  Nice view to the ocean and the airport.
Nice clean hotel.  Good facilities. Large rooms. Good for families.
review.positiveRemarks: Good standard. Nice and clean rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Good location to SFO, but not good location for San Francisco. Very expensive to take a taxi to San Francisco, and difficult with public transport

review.title: Lovelove this hotel! except that one staff in DR
review.reviewText: Been here all the time esp when a family came down from a trip, i always booked a room from this hotel, last time stay on 25th of Jul we booked a king suite room but the lady give us a queen bed room its ok, then when we have breakfast there is this one staff that is filling the bread near the pool who accidentally hit my mom and never say sorry instead she looked at my mom real bad like its our fault, my mom is just sitting their on the side waiting for a table bec its real packed then that happened, thats too bad that this staff can work in this beautiful hotel, and a Filipino staff in the front desk is always a plus!!! they are great!!
Over all nice place will return kid friendly Staff was nice

review.title: Nice view
review.reviewText: This is really 4 star hotel with nice view and great comfort for vacation mood .. get room with view ,, its worth it ..good evening free reception of drinks n snacks .. nice b'fast .. love this place ..only drawback is they dont have free wifi and free parking ..
review.negativeRemarks: too much charge for parking and wifi

review.title: Dirty
review.reviewText: This is a party hotel not recommended for family.
Hotel was very nice, but does not have upscale restaurant as part of the hotel. In the past this hotel had a very nice restaurant with great food.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a upscale restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants and path by the bay

review.title: Decent hotel located near lots of sights
review.reviewText:
We spend 4 days in the bay area to visit family and stayed at this hotel. The rooms/suites are large and clean. The ambiance is fantastic - kids loved the windows in the elevators to see out of as we went up/down.

Cell phone coverage and WiFi coverage is bad here - at least in our room. Seriously, we're in the middle of what's the technology hub of the nation and WiFi is slow beyond believe and only worked in the "living room". In the "bedroom" it disconnected. The cell phone signal was the opposite, barely worked in the "bedroom" near the Window and no coverage in the "living room". I felt like I was in the 3rd world with regards to Phone/Internet communication.
review.negativeRemarks:
Cell phone/WiFi signal
Breakfast too early weekdays - ends 9am sharp ... better not sleep in - may be OK for business folks but on vacation, really?
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is close to San Francisco so there's too much to do to list here. We went to the city, beach, Silicon Valley, etc.

review.title: Great Waterfront location Full Suite Hotel
review.reviewText: 5 minutes from San Francisco airport this all suite hotel offers full cooked to order breakfasts, evening cocktails for no added charge.  Suites can overlook the water with views of the city.  There is ample parking and Wi-Fi. Ask ahead if they can include them at no charge...they did for me.  Clean rooms, separate bedroom, easily sleeps 4.  Great spot to use to travel .  They have a 5 minute shuttle to Bart to get downtown, and if you have a car 1 minute from Cal 101 highway. We went to wine county, Carmel & Monterey very easily. Super value.
review.positiveRemarks: breakfast, room size, ease to highway and BART
review.negativeRemarks: speed of hotel internet
review.locationRemarks: BART to city, close to highway to go to wine country  Muir Woods, Monterey

review.title: Good for kids
review.reviewText: Nice hotel kids friendly and pet good breakfast, sofa bed not comfortable,the small shower

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: My family had fun, breakfast buffet is good. Room is spacious and clean.

review.title: Nice hotel right outside the city
review.reviewText: Nice spacious room with view. Free drinks and snacks during happy hour. Great breakfast selection

This is an amazing place to stay!  The breakfast is very good.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  We only stayed at this hotel because we flew in late and it was close to the airport.  We liked it so well, we stayed another night!

review.title: A great location and beautiful property.
review.reviewText: Good breakfast, big and beautiful location. Room was nice. Great stay.
Great hotel. Second time to stay here. Highly recommend.

review.title: Nice setting but accommodations were disappointing
review.reviewText: For being an airport property, the location is lovely. It's right on the water and there is a great view of the bay.  My room had a number of problems. The TV in the bedroom didn't work, the hair dryer was sticky and disgusting and the room consistently felt damp despite the A/C running.  I was able to get the bedroom TV fixed but wifi in the bedroom area would not stay connected which forced me to only be able to work in the "living room" area.  For the price, I was disappointed in the accommodations.
review.negativeRemarks: See comments above.
review.locationRemarks: Very limited restaurant selection in the area.

review.reviewText: Thank you for everything it was hard finding accommodations for the six of us on a short notice. The kids loved this place didn't want to leave!!!
Great price. Comfortable room and best breakfast.
Great location for 1 day in/out business trip. Spacious room with extremely attentive staff.

review.title: Great Hotel and Location, Restaurant Terrible...
review.reviewText:
We chose this hotel due to its location near the airport and its on the bay with the bay trail right out the door. Perfect for us to beat our jet lag, the pool is nice, the "free" drinks at night are nice and its a pretty good spread with the breakfast too. All good stuff here.
But, the restaurant is terrible, ate dinner there, not cheap and bad all round. Go elsewhere to pay for food.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant

review.title: Family Friendly
review.reviewText: This hotel was an excellent choice. We needed a suite with the double beds and sofa bed. It was large independent areas with two separate TVs. The microwave mini fridge were convenient as well. We enjoyed breakfast, it had so much variety, buffet style and the omelets were so freshly made. The evening complimentary cocktails and chips brought out a lot of the guest and it was defiently a lively ambience. The bay trail was excellent for walks, runs, taking in the views and exploring. As a family who spent their day exploring SF coming back to this hotel was a peaceful pleceant way to start and end our days. Also the staff were friendly and our request were provided with genuine hospitable assistance.
review.positiveRemarks: All the amenities even if we did have to pay for parking. If felt safe the surrounding area.
review.negativeRemarks: The whole wristband thing was annoying considering it was not even enforced.
review.locationRemarks: We really like the views and the bay trail. The pondsin the hotel and pool. I think we spent most of our day in the more turist parts of SF.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, Terrible Staff
review.reviewText: The ladies at the front desk are extremely rude. When I asked how much we were paying total, the woman failed to tell us about the incidental fee which was going to be 200$. She was going to charge that money to my account without telling me. The servers at the Tap and Tavern do not care about your experience at the hotel and it is so obvious. After a long day of walking around the city, we came back to our hotel at 11pm and were extremely hungry. We sat down, the waitress took our drink order, came back 5 minutes later, took out dinner order, came back 5 minutes later to only tell us that they couldn't make good because the grills were turned off already which she failed to inform us when we sat down. They even refused to make us salads. The breakfast and the decor of the hotel was amazing. Our room was great but the patios they have are in-accessible. (They lock after opening a few inches) The free hotel shuttle from the hotel to the airport and back, are extremely in reliable. We were waiting for over an hour at the airport for our shuttle back and so were a bunch of other people and when I called the hotel they said it would be 15 to 20 mins and it didn't show up until about 30 minutes after I hung up. This happened time after time while we were staying there. The elevators sometimes didn't work and would keep opening their doors while we were trying to get to our floor. The customer service here will definitely have us going somewhere else in the future.

review.title: Great hotel, close to the bay.
review.reviewText: Hotel was very comfortable and pleasing for 2 adults, 4 children. Embassy was very accommodating and did everything to ensure our comfort. The only downside, the front desk ladies didn't know much about the city and what the city had to offer for travelers. Outside of that, the hotel was clean and provided a very nice breakfast in the morning hours that was not very limiting for any late wakers.
review.positiveRemarks: The great breakfast in the morning, cleanliness, comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: When 6 people are listed on the hotel reservation, putting the equivalent amount of towels in the room would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: In San Francisco for a family trip, the local Fisherman's Wharf, tourist traps and roaming around were all great!

review.reviewText: The room was large enough for my family of five to enjoy comfortably. The staff was very patient even when the hotel was booked to capacity. The best part was the view though. My kids loved watching the planes fly in and it still wasn't that loud for being so close to the airport.

review.title: Loved the Bay View
review.reviewText:
I would definitely stay here again. We loved everything about it. It made me want to extend my vacation time but unfortunately I had to return back to work. :) 

The breakfast and happy hour were absolutely fantastic. The staff was extremely nice and friendly. My family has made a point to stay here every time we return back to the Bay Area.

Kuddos to the Embassy Suites for making our mini vacay a memorable experience!!!

review.title: Fine for Airport Stay
review.reviewText: Good for a quick stay by the airport. Parking very expensive, breakfast is nothing great, but adequate for something quick.

review.title: Poor temperature control
review.reviewText: We stayed one night.  Room was clean.  Room was not stocked with shampoo that I didn't notice until getting into the shower, so too late to call for some.  The temperature control did not work.  The thermostat said 50 degrees but it was very hot and would not cool down.  We opened the windows to cool it down for an hour before falling asleep.  We checked in around 9 pm and were leaving early the next morning so it wasn't worth the hassle of asking for a room change.  If we were going to stay more than just that night we would have had to have a room change.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast buffet was very good with a lot of selection.
review.negativeRemarks: Checking to make sure rooms are ready and functional before assigning guests to them
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport and offered a complimentary shuttle to and from the airport which was very nice

review.title: Great hotel with a great view
review.reviewText: I loved everything about the hotel. The lobby area is beautiful!  The complimentary breakfast and complimentary drinks are great!   My only complaint would be about the WiFi service.  Most hotels offer that for free as part of the hotel reservation.  When the WiFi was purchased it did not work. The charges were taken off. So I would like to thank the front desk staff for that. Overall a wonderful experience.

We were arriving as a late check in and it was very quick and easy. The front desk gentleman was very polite and was very efficient. We did not have time for dinner due to travel constraints and he mentioned that the on site restaurant was open until 11pm. We were able to enjoy a nice dinner, reasonably priced and tasty. We will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Very clean, but
review.reviewText:
The beds was comfy and the room was clean
.
The bathrooms are terribly small and be careful the bath tubs are super slippery. 

I stayed for 4 nights on business and 2 of those days my shower was luke warm. :-(, that's not a great way to start your day.

The have no mini bar but they do have a fridge and a microwave.

Lastly, The internet is unbelievably pitiful, it is almost dial up speed. Don't expect to be able to work online
review.negativeRemarks:
Size of bathrooms

HOT WATER would be greatly appreciated

Working Real HIGH Speed Internet !!!!!!!!

review.title: GREAT HOTEL, PLEASANT STAFF
review.reviewText: EASY ACCESS TO AIRPORT, SPACIOUS SUITE, GREAT BREAKFAST, BEAUTIFUL DESIGN AND DECOR OF ATRIUM. MY FIRST CHOICE OF HOTELS.

review.title: Used to be a quite, comfortable location!
review.reviewText: Now that the dining room has been converted into a rental F&B facility, the noise from the event, including amplified voices and music bounces right into the rooms.  I could hear the words of the songs, it was so loud.  After sharing my disappointment with the front office manager, there was nothing but an apology and the notification that the music stops at 11 p.m.  It appears if you have kids who you let roam free in the halls, eat up all the snacks on the premium level, and the craziness at morning breakfasts, this is your place.  It is a shame because the suite setup is perfect.  It was a luxury to have a little balcony for fresh air.  The doors are now locked and can only open 3 inches.  If they turn the dining room back into a real dining room, with good food selections, I (and I'm sure many others) will return.
review.negativeRemarks: Turn the dining room back into a dining room.  Offer a "true" H H level exclusive to those only who pay the premium price, away from the rest.
review.locationRemarks: Walk/job along bayside to local outdoors areas.

review.title: Nice view of water
review.reviewText: My stay was very Comfortable and relaxing. Pretty view of water and the sound of airplanes. Staff were very helpful and friendly. I will definitely stay again sometime soon.

review.title: hotel for a weekend in SF
review.reviewText: Excellent service and ambiance. Great for a weekend in SF if you don't want to pay parking and have free breakfast. This one save you time and money.

review.title: $26 a day for parking is very expensive
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel with the exception of the $26 a day parking fee.

review.title: Definitely a top notch hotel.
review.reviewText: I stayed here 2 consecutive weekends in a row on separate occasions. The first weekend I stayed I was not charged for parking, nor told I would be. The next weekend I stayed, upon checking out at the front desk a woman told me I'd be charged 2 nights of parking at a $22 a night rate. I explained that it was not disclosed the week prior to, nor upon checking in. She said she could waive only one, which was ok I guess. Just thought you might want to make that clear for future reference. Overall, still a very good hotel.

review.title: Awesome Hotel, extremely beautiful!
review.reviewText: Hands down this was the best overall Hotel I've had the privilege of staying at. Can't wait to visit again!

review.title: Nice hotel very close by to the airport
review.reviewText: We decided to stay at the hotel near the airport because of the time we flew in- very late. They were out of 2 queen beds which I reserved while back but gave us 2 rooms right next to each other at the same price which we were very pleased. Very nice room with ref and microwave. Awesome breakfast which was included in a very nice atmosphere. Also nice view of the bay- our first view of CA! We were willing to travel 14 miles to SF from the hotel for 2 days. One of the best hotels I've stayed in on my road trip from SF to SD.

review.title: Good location, small for families, ok breakfast
review.reviewText: All in all, adequate place for a one night stay. Checking was fast. We booked for 6 people. The suite had two double beds and a sofa bed. Not sure how a family of 6 can comfortably sleep after a long flight. Queen beds would have been nice. breakfast was ok. Overly crowded with a long line. Staff was nice and accommodating.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location was great. We took walks in the morning right by the bay. During our stay we visited Stanford, San Francisco, UC Berkeley and Facebook inc and it was in between all of those places. If you got up early the breakfast line wasn't too bad. We used the exercise room. The pool was alittle crowded  and smelled alittle.

review.title: would stay there again.
review.reviewText:
Great, nice, helpful staff. All but for the lady that served drinks during social hour on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday. NO PERSONALITY. And kind of like hated being there. The lady on Friday night was MUCH better.
Rooms nice a roomy. Perfect for 4, Love the view. Shuttle to airport is nice. Good food
review.negativeRemarks: The fan was loud and the sinks took a while to drain.
review.locationRemarks: Location away from city. LOVE THAT. The wharf Is a 30 min. Drive. A car is very helpful. Just plan to pay to park. We spent $80 in park in 4 days.

review.reviewText: Got late to check in, they didn't have the room available so we have to  wait about 30 mins but then they gave us two rooms instead.  Rooms were nice.  Breakfast had long lines and nothing much available.

I have stayed in this hotel before and that's why I stayed again. This time I'm not happy at all. Staff dont seem happy and not friendlier looking. Got to my room and the TV was not working. Attempted to use the phone and wasn't working either. The breakfast process was a joke. The line had to stop moving because they had to keep getting plates in the kitchen. Then they were running out of food and people were in line waiting. It was ridiculous. I attempted to checkout using express checkout but that too did not work . I'm very disappointed during my stay.

review.title: Good choice for airport hotel
review.reviewText: Airport shuttle is great feature. Less than 10 minute trip. Staff at hotel super helpful and friendly. Found it odd that they charge $26 to park in an open lot. That's a bit ridiculous.

review.title: Nice views
review.reviewText: I loved the bay view and the rooms are very clean, the breakfas has a large variety and staff os friendly

review.title: Convenient access to airport and BART station
review.reviewText: Accessible to BART station which takes you into San Francisco.  Great walking paths.  Rooms have great view and relaxing after day in the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great. Clean. No bed bugs.  Guest laundry service.  Evening snacks and drinks.  Fabulous custom breakfasts.

review.title: Wonderful except for the wifi
review.reviewText: The location next to the bay, close to airport, good size suites with working and eating areas, all superb, but the wifi service was terrible.
review.positiveRemarks: Views of the bay, size of the suite, close to airport and office
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi was the worst I've ever experienced.  Breakfast facilities could have been a little better, with a bigger selection of options and more staff
review.locationRemarks: Very close to airport, right on the bay with great views and walks

review.title: Spring 2015
review.reviewText:
Wonderful location with waterfront walks, views of the bay.  The planes landing added character and didn't impede our sleep at all.

The pool looked great and I was disappointed that we did not have a chance to enjoy it as we were just passing through (stayed one night).

Breakfast was excellent!

review.title: Perfect place to stay with a family
review.reviewText: We have a 3 month and a 3 year old. This hotel was great to stay at.  The staff was friendly. The pool was clean. The room was spacious.  I highly recommend this facility.  Oh, and the breakfast... wonderful!

review.title: Convenient and comfortable
review.reviewText: Nice bar with good wine and beer selections, but pricy. Selection at nearby Kincaid's Restaurant better and cheaper. Loved the walking trails !  Fitness center us literally in a greenhouse, outrageously warm. Despite that, service was great. Breakfast ( omelets cooked to order) was fantastic.

review.title: Hotel close to San Mateo Event Center
review.reviewText: I had a horrible experience as my room (822) was next to the ice machine. Could not get sleep as the ice machine was directly across from our room! Guests had access to it 24/7, so  of course you will get people getting ice between midnight-6am while I'm trying to get sleep! Stayed on a Saturday so breakfast buffet ends at 10:30am...got there at 9:50am and nothing was left!!! Tables were dirty and I spent $220/night there! Truly disappointed!

review.title: Nice hotel but not for me....
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. But the hotel only had fan turned on in the AC unit. The room felt hot and stuffy. Also you can feel every plain land or depart from the room. Didn't sleep all night. I don't think I will stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to airport and a short drive to college visit at Stanford University.  Made-to-order breakfast was excellent.  Hotel staff were helpful with directions for sightseeing in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was convenient to Stanford University as well as sightseeing in San Fransicso

review.title: Fun little trip with my daughter
review.reviewText: From the second you walk in you feel like your in vacation. The rooms are spacious and have everything you need. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We loved the pool (heated) and the hot tub. On the weekend the kids need wristbands (not sure why). The hotel is sort of shaped like an 0. outside are all the rooms and inside are lots of seating possibilities. A beautiful pond with fish, a waterfall and tons of trees and green. So beautiful and relaxing. The afternoon reception was a added plus. On Thursday they ha corn chips, chex mix, and veggies with salsa and sauce. On Friday no veggies. The breakfast is medium but enough to fill you up. Overall tons of fun
review.positiveRemarks: The ambiente, everything made sense. It was wonderful
review.negativeRemarks: Not so much chlorine in the pool
review.locationRemarks: The airport shuttle was wonderful. We loved the SF Bay. We walked along and it was a little mini vacation to us.

review.reviewText: The location is great for watching airplanes land at SFO! Despite the proximity to the airport, all rooms are very quiet (the bay appears to absorb the jet sounds quite well), and there is a nice jogging/walking path by the hotel and the shoreline. The breakfast is also quite convenient (but it would be worth asking the omelet makers to cook the eggs well - the omelet rings they use don't seem to serve much purpose as the hot plate is kept at a seemingly low temperature). The pool is warm, and the front desk staff are friendly. If you have a disabled parking permit, the parking is free!

review.title: He said, She said
review.reviewText: Awful experience.  We arrived on Valentine's Day with an Expedia-confirmed late check in.  The hotel claimed we, via Expedia, reserved a king sized one bed room.  We were a party of two parents, two kids.  One king sized bed was ridiculous.  Then, they blamed Expedia whom I called and they said they were not to blame for the "error" and it was in writing on our request confirmation. We said we could live with the king room for one night if they gave us a cot or extra mattress.  They promised they would.  We called that night at 11pm to see where the extra cot was.  The manager claimed it was in a taxi on its way.  What?!  We never got it.  We didn't sleep well on the couch.  They gave us dinner vouchers.  The next day, we had to call to see where our new room was.  It wasn't ready.  They lost our booster seats that we had mailed.  They sent us fruit.  They moved our room to the one we had reserved but didn't defeather it as we had asked.  They just didn't care about making it right.  The fitness room had only one working treadmill.  The pool was nice but there were no clean towels.  We have stayed at many other Embassy Suites and this one was worse than any of the others.
review.positiveRemarks: The atrium and complimentary breakfast were lovely.  The in-room cleaning service was excellent. The view of the city and water were pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service is seriously lacking at this establishment.  At some point, we just gave up on the managers, Jennifer and Zach.
review.locationRemarks: The location is very convenient to the airport, San Francisco and the Bay Area.  You will probably need a car but there was a shuttle to the airport.

review.title: Chef Fong was rude!
review.reviewText: Free breakfast! So chef Fong was rude! He got upset when I grabbed my plate for him to serve me. Ok so I wasn't thinking when I approached buffet table (hot breakfast). Instead of gently and kindly saying he was suppose to grab plate and serve as I go he got mad and his voice was just full of anger!

review.title: Cold Room

A lovely room, very clean and nice.  However, the room was cold and their was no way to turn up the heat.
It was raining outside which made it seem even colder.  I talked to front desk, but nothing changed.

review.negativeRemarks: Heat that can be turned on.

review.title: Location very close to airport; very nice staff...
review.reviewText: My only complaint with this hotel is the fact that they have an HVAC heating and cooling system. So, the hotel decides whether you have heat, or whether you have air conditioning in your room. It was stuffy in our room, hard to sleep at night due to it being too hot. Tried turning the thermostat down to 65 and the fan on high at all times, did not do any good. Air conditioning was just not available. Our stay was during Halloween weekend, and it was not cold enough outside, for the hotel to have already switched to heat. Pillows were not that great either... Staff was very very friendly and nice. Hotel was in great condition, spotless clean , and pretty lobby. Housekeeping did an excellent job!

review.title: Decent suites, close to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The suite was close to the San Francisco Airport.  Easy access to the highways and in a safe area. The suites were kept clean during our stay. However, It was disappointing that we had to pay $14.00 a day to use the internet. There was also a daily charge for parking, which was just an open parking lot in the back. I did not read about these additional charges when booking the room. But the MOST disappointing thing was that they did not allow us to have heat during our stay!!  When we complained to the front desk, we were told the thermostats were set to cool season?  What? It is the end of October.  In addition, the maids would leave the sliding glass door open after cleaning the room every morning.  The only thing staff could do was give us a space heater, which made me nervous to use, but we were freezing!

review.title: What you see on Expedia is not what you get...
review.reviewText:
I booked through Expedia and the description of the room sold me, " Deluxe room w/ bay view" , well needless to say we got a room with a view of a parking lot. When I checked in I asked the nice man if my room was overlooking the water, and he said it was not because those rooms are actually cost like $300 , I was a little insulted by this.

 I told him that on the website it clearly states a bay front room (not all rooms are facing the water). Believe me I understand the entire hotel is directly facing the water but some rooms have better views than other and my room should of been one of them. 

When I got up to my room and noticed my parking lot view room and called downstairs and explained that I had booked a "bay view" room, the front desk said that Expedia has the wrong room description, and for the price I paid I was in the correct room. Despite the unsettling room issue upon check-in, the hotel is beautiful! It feels like a little piece of Hawaii in the Bay area. My morning walk was perfect after my complimentary breakfast, and the grounds are nicely kept. Overall, my experience was nice but next time I think I'll book my room directly with the hotel to avoid confusion. However, the hotel should take a little responsibility and not blame it on Expedia.
review.positiveRemarks: The grounds are immaculate! Large hotel with room for guests to roam around and not feel bunched up. The tropical feel inside is wonderful.
review.negativeRemarks: The pool had tons of chlorine in it, although not a huge issue because I washed it off it was still relatively strong for such a small pool.

review.reviewText: Comfortable. One night with loud band for a wedding until 11pm.

Not enough parking spaces available considering the number of rooms.  by 11pm, we had to circle around several times to look for parking, only to end up squeezing in between two trucks.  Bathroom has no fan - there's a vent but no way to turn it on.  This leads to a very stuffy bathroom after a shower.  AC/heater has a weird rule about temperature.  According to the HVAC label, the heater won't turn on unless temperature is at 65deg first.  it was 66 deg, so only the "fan" turned on, which just blew room temperature air.  We just turned it off and slept cold.  Pillow covers on two of the pillows weren't as white as the others, so it made it look dingier.  It's probably still clean, but definitely doesn't help to not look as clean... especially to sleep on.

review.title: timing is everything...
review.reviewText:
The entire package was great. Nice people, accommodations were good, buffet was very good. The only thing is that we got a room on the second floor and our stay started on Friday. So Friday and Saturday there were parties in the halls right under us. Needless to say, the music was pounding for a while. So there’s the timing… had we started on a Sunday, or any other day of the week, no music and the sleep would have been much quieter.
The AC unit leaked the first night and got the carpet between rooms very wet. I was told these rooms had been very recently renovated. Later that day I was told the unit had been fixed. The second morning we noticed it was leaking again.
I requested a change in rooms, to a higher floor and I was told they were going to try their best. Fortunately, we got a room on the 8th floor and no more music and no more water leaking from the AC unit.
Overall, we enjoyed the stay. The rooms were clean, and the entire facility looked nice. I would recommend this hotel with no problems at all. Every once in a while, you encounter issues in your travels, but if the staff seems to care and they try to take care of your concerns, that’s worth the try.
I liked it, my kids did too and they saw that the staff was very nice too and they were very professionals.
review.positiveRemarks: it looked clean... right next to the water and the staff was very professional and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Make sure the music does not bother the folks on the second floor, right above the halls. Soundproof???

review.title: Not cheap, but worth it.
review.reviewText: For the convenience to the air port, free breakfast, free cocktails, clean room, spaciousness, it was worth it.
review.negativeRemarks: Make sure it doesn't start to look old.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location to the air port with shuttle service.

review.title: Great view, good breakfast, friendly staff
review.reviewText: Love the view from our room-lagoon & the bay. Front desk staff Elizabeth was superb, she put in a rush order to clean up our room so she could check us in early.
