When we extended another night, we had to be transferred to another room because it was scheduled for renovation that day. She made our transfer process very smoothly. We'll definitely come back. The only thing that kept me from giving it a 5-star rating is the fact that it is under renovation. A little dusty but noise level is ok

Nice hotel, nice room, nice indoor pool, and great breakfast.
The only downside is that 2 out of 5 elevators were out of service.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator service.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco and Santa Cruz, each about an hour from the hotel.

review.title: A short drive to SFO
review.reviewText: We wanted an easy drive to the SFO airport for an early flight, so we chose Embassy Suites because of the location. The room was spacious, the beds were comfortable, the evening reception near the lobby was very nice with free snacks and drinks. There is a complimentary " made to order" breakfast offered, but with Memorial day holiday, the cooks were late and I had to leave so I enjoyed the tasty fruit and pastries instead. They have a timely free shuttle for convenience, & that was perfect! It's an attractive hotel right on the shore with view of the SFO airport. I would stay there again.
Everything was OK without the construction noise early in the morning.

review.title: great airport location right on the water
review.reviewText: we spent 3 nights and really enjoyed it. the facility was under remodel while we stayed so it should be very nice soon

review.title: Will not go back again
review.reviewText: rude and apathetic front desk person, especially considering that this guy is the assistant manager by name of Justin. Hotel is undergoing renovation for months already and seems for months to come. They put us in a renovated room but in the section that is right above their swimming pool/Jacuzzi area. This whole side of the hotel is extremely noisy because of the ventilation pump from the swimming pool area. Eventhough we were on the fifth floor there was a contant annoying noise. Justin suggested to give us another room on the opposite side of the hotel on the second floor that was not renovated and a looked and smelt like an old dump!
review.negativeRemarks: get a new management!!
review.locationRemarks: Fortunately there are plenty of decent hotels in the vicinity of this hotel.

review.title: Best hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: From free cocktails when arriving to the free full breakfast buffet the next morning, this is a super nice hotel. Rooms are perfect.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to the airport
review.reviewText: Spent the night before an early morning flight. Like Embassy Suites for size of room, atrium, manager's cocktail party, and free breakfast (although we left before the meal service began -- did get a cup of coffee and noted that pastries were already out at 5:45 AM)
review.positiveRemarks: Like Embassy Suites for size of room, atrium, manager's cocktail party, and free breakfast, although we left before the meal service began.
review.locationRemarks: Short shuttle ride from airport. Overlooks San Francisco Bay

review.reviewText: front desk staff left a lot to be desired maid service not good had to call front desk to get fresh bath linines

review.title: Receptionist was hard to get a hold of
review.reviewText: The bathroom lock was broken and the room phone was broken. When I used my cell phone to call to inform them, I got hung up on the first time then the phone kept ringing and ringing the second time. The front receptionist is hard to get a hold of. They did inform us that they were undergoing construction. Maybe that is the reason why whey are so busy and unavailable. Overall, the room was nice and we got a view as we requested. I did not realize that there would be a parking fee. For the price, I'm surprised parking and internet was not included; however, they did decide to waive the fee for the wifi for our room.
review.positiveRemarks: The view in our room and free breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: More parking space. We parked so far and yet we had to pay.
review.locationRemarks: It's close to the airport.

review.reviewText: Nice breakfast, waterfront view is beautiful, friendly staff

review.title: sf airport
review.reviewText:
very good, nice space in room, staff very friendly
very convenient to airport

review.title: Break from stress.
review.reviewText: Awesome view nice location, good breakfast very comfortable room. I will come back again.

review.title: Decent hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: The room wasn't exactly as pictured in the photos. The gentleman that checked us in waived the parking fee which was very nice. We ran the next morning and there's a great running path on the bay. Very close to the airport and easy to get to the Burlingame area. Breakfast the next morning was very good. Weight room is a little small and there were several guest using it but it worked.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport. Breakfast was very good
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms were a little dated.
review.locationRemarks: Airport & Burlingame shopping. Burlingame had a wonderful farmer's market!

review.title: Good Value for the Family
review.reviewText: Loved the location of the Hotel. Good value for the family. The one thing that stood out for me that prevents me from giving a higher rating is that each room doesn't have it's own temperature setting. The Hotel has a central heating and cooling system. Our room for 6 people was very warm and we could not adjust the temperature setting. We ended up opening the windows so we could sleep at night.
review.positiveRemarks: Very scenic location. Great walking trails. Greate Lobby decor.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotels needs to modernize heating and cooling system.
review.locationRemarks: Close proximity to San Francisco and airport.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Updated and friendly staff. They recognized I was a hilton honors member and didn't charge me for parking since I checked in at 12 am and was leaving the next day.

review.title: Sean is the best front desk person ever
review.reviewText: Welcomed with open arms as soon as we walked in the door. We arrived @1130 am to make sure we found the place ect. we asked what time check in was....Sean, our front desk clerk stated 3pm....ok . As we were walking away to check out the gorgeous lobby and atrium, he called my name ..."we have a room ready now Mr. ##$%^&". We checked in and were in our room by 11:45. Fantastic!!
review.negativeRemarks: They had some construction in the hotel...but not a concern.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco has endless things to do.

review.title: Horrible experience
review.reviewText: our keys never worked. We had to call on 2 separate days to get new keys and spent too much time standing in the hallway waiting for the staff. We stayed 3 nights and had to get 3 sets of keys. Housekeeping NEVER left us towels. LIKE NONE!! the front desk staff was rude and unhelpful. We were charged for a phone call that was never made, the check out on the TV was broken.
review.negativeRemarks: fix whatever key problem you are having and find a front desk staff who is helpful.
review.locationRemarks: This is about 20 minutes from San Francisco and has local restaurants that are nice.

review.title: Beautiful view of the water
review.reviewText: Nice hotel... but why do they charge $21 dollars to park in the parking lot.

review.title: Reasonably priced hotel, not too far from San Fran
review.reviewText:
We traveled with our three children ages 5-8. The hotel was perfect for our needs with the separate living area. We received one of the refurbished rooms, but it still felt dated.

Pros: Beautiful walkway right outside the hotel on the waterfront. Kids loved running around outside and it was perfect for a morning jog. You could watch the airplanes landing from SFO across the bay. Free breakfast with various options. Indoor pool. Twenty minute drive to San Francisco. Free airport shuttle to hotel.

Cons: The (small) hotel pool seemed close to capacity most evenings. The kids didn't seem to mind, though. I do not recommend the on-site restaurant. Service took forever. If you come in late on a flight from SFO, just grab a quick bite at the airport.

If you are traveling with kids, they'll love the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: We rented a car from Advantage, which was significantly less expensive than other rental car companies. It's a 10-15 minute walk along waterfront.

review.title: Family San Francisco Trip
review.reviewText:
It's a nice close to airport. It took about 20 minutes to get to piers. Hotel caters a little more toward business travel rather than family.
Breakfast is good.

review.title: Great Breakfast!
review.reviewText: You might want to wait a few months (from end of March 2014) until the hotel completes its renovation work. The hotel is dusty from the renovation work, and you have to share the elevators with the construction workers. Breakfast was great, and I appreciated the front staff giving me a free Internet code! The free drinks at night were also great. We had a nice lunch in the same hotel restaurant. I look forward to staying in the hotel again after it completes its renovations.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast, Happy Hour, Airport Shuttle Bus
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms should have a safe.
review.locationRemarks: The food at Kincaid Restaurant near the hotel is excellent.

review.title: Unacceptable
review.reviewText:
Door to room would not lock. Because of this we were late for my daughters wedding rehearsal.
Party in next room. Called front desk At 12:30 am and again at 1:00. They did not resolve problem. Terrible night!!!!!
The breakfast was lousy!! Did not eat there on the second day.

review.title: Close to Airport. Stuck in the '70s.
review.reviewText:
We have stayed at a lot of airport hotels and recognize quality often lags convenience. Even with that expectation, we found our stay underwhelming if not disappointing.

Upon arrival, we requested, and management accomodated, a change of rooms because the HVAC fan was both noisy and dirty.

The second room was better, although we found out the AC was seasonally shut down. As the weather was warm, the room was uncomfortably hot. Opening the sliding doors gave us a breeze but also a blast of airport noise.

There were only limited elevators in service and no internal stairs, so lobby access was time consuming.

All that, plus a $300+ rate, delivered disappointment.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText:
For some reason we were put in a 'handicapped' room when neither of us have disabilities. We made it work. Other than that the room was comfy. Staff friendly and helpful. Convenient and dependable airport shuttle. Breakfast was awesome!!
Overall thought it was Great!
review.locationRemarks: Only thing is that it is quite a ways from the tourist attractions; Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 so pickup for tours that we had boo

review.title: Just like family!
review.reviewText:
This is the second time I have stayed at the Embassy. Everybody is so nice. I want to say that Sean from the reception area was so helpfull. he remembered our family from the last time we stayed there. I also want to thank Liliana from banquet and their rest of the staff. They really know how to treat their customers. because of the friendly staff, I will continue to stay at the Embassy. I will recommend all my friends and family.
Thank you Embassy Suites!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: The only place that was near the hotel was a diner.

review.title: Loved seeing the airplanes fly in.
review.reviewText: Came with my family. We all really enjoyed ourselves here. The place is huge and the elevators are awesome. Just wish our balcony to see the ocean was bigger than it really is. But overall great time and experience. :-)

review.title: Great amenities
review.reviewText: Can't beat breakfast and the managers reception save a lot of money by having a light lunch with the food

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Was ok, not a bad experience
I will recommend for all my friends
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel receptionist was so rude, didn't even say hi or welcome, and didn't explain any extra charge, like the one for car parking or internet usage.

review.title: airport hotel, great location for our needs.
review.reviewText: The embassy suite chain is excellent, and we use it whenever possible. Unfortunately, the restaurant was a disappointment. The food was not up to standards.
review.positiveRemarks: We like the Embassy Suites design of two rooms with spacious accommodations.
review.negativeRemarks: As above, the restaurant could be improved. The menu is limited and the preparation was not up to standard.
review.locationRemarks: This is an airport Embassy Suite and worked very well for our needs.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: nice hotel but they had turned off the heat and the room was very cold for sleeping 59º.

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport and Bart station.
Too expensive for what you get
review.reviewText: I would describe our overall experience with this hotel as disappointing. We constantly had to ask for more towels for our family of five. The bathroom was not cleaned during our entire five night stay. The morning buffet was cold. Charging $20 a day to park in an open air parking lot is absolutely ridiculous, as is charging for wifi (cell reception was atrocious). I am a HiltonHHonors member and will never stay at this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: Practically everything.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport.

review.title: Good Choice...
review.reviewText: Nice view and delicious breakfast buffet

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to the airport, the car rental establishment and to many of the parks and attractions in San Fransisco. The staff was excellent! Helpful in many ways, including guiding us to kid friendly restaurants. Complimentary breakfast was superb. We also had a complimentary cocktail & snack evening.
review.negativeRemarks: This would be perfect, except there was some renovations going on. There was a paint smell and you could hear construction noises....not at night.

review.reviewText: Beautiful surroundings, walking distance to a couple of parks, one just on the other side of the parking lot. Watching the planes land. Excellent breakfast . Only bad side was the temperature to the room. It's a havoc system, always ran hot and stuffy. Had to leave hotel window open all night, and even the door to the room for air.

review.title: beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: great service, breakfast was wonderful, but only until 9 am, would be nice if it was until 10.
review.positiveRemarks: other than breakfast hours, this hotel is great
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast hours should be at least until 10
review.locationRemarks: wonderful location, we had a beautiful waterfront view

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: Very clean. Great breakfast and nice to have a 2nd tv for the kids

review.title: Great airport location
review.reviewText: excellent
review.positiveRemarks: location and cleanliness, staff, rroom size, everything was great!
review.locationRemarks: shuttle to airport was perfect!!

review.title: nice location
review.reviewText:
Huge problem: freezing cold water in the pool, jacuzzi was NOT WORKING!
Big disappointment!
review.negativeRemarks: Huge problem: freezing cold water in the pool, jacuzzi was NOT WORKING! Big disappointment!
review.locationRemarks: lots of restaurants, waterfront overlooking airport with airplanes taking off and landing

review.title: Was expecting better. Probably won't return.
review.reviewText:
Hotel room was in shoddy condition. Sagging ceiling in bathroom. Mold and mildew in several places in the bedroom.

All the rooms face a central atrium. Therefore, to get to the rooms there are exposed walkways on each floor. The railings are not very high - I worried about our 6 year old daughter every time we left or returned to our room.

On the plus side, the included breakfasts were good. However, the free early evening drinks/snacks were pitiful.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel room was in shoddy condition. Sagging ceiling in bathroom. Mold and mildew in several places in the bedroom.

review.title: Location was great next to the Bay
review.reviewText: Stayed 5 nights noticed on day 2 that room was very hottt!!! Even though was 55-58 degrees outside inside was just unbearable. Called complained said air would rite correctly and apologized. Came back to place later in evening same thing occurred, so I decided to get another room thinking was because I had 5 people in room on why it was so hot. My new room was great no issues room i was in was still hot. Furthermore the tub seal was no good very bad caulking job was water on carpet on opposite side of wall. The cold water faucet was loose as kept turning and the spout water came out of just spun. Could see where counter was broken and someone tried to cover it up with caulking. It looked awe full. This is my 3rd time staying at this hotel over past 6 years never had this experience before.

review.title: Very good breakfast and close to airport
review.reviewText: Rooms were comfortable for 3 people and the breakfast was excellent!

review.title: very good big hotel, very nice building
review.reviewText: great rooms, parking is easy and nice walk near the water. Breakfast was over crouded andmissing items before end time.

review.title: This place is on its way.
review.reviewText: still working the kinks out of the pool mechanicals but everything else is great. The lobby is beautiful but I didn't see any koi fish. Happy hour was a bonus!

review.title: Rude staff
review.reviewText: Front desk staff was nice but the people especially who was working in the breakfast buffet area my god she's rude. she's not supposed to work in costomer service.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy to find and close to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: Talk to her or give her a corrective action

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText: Truly enjoyed staying at the Embassy Suites. The room was large and we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, parking, and movies. Will definitely come back!

review.title: Nice hotel with some flaws
review.reviewText:
I came in and my name was not registered. First time ever in Expedia. 30 minutes later I got a nice room with no safe. I don;t remember when lately hotel with such level had no safe.
The cleaner cleaned some open things that she should not clean maybe my mistake but I doubt if 2/3 bottle of wine should be cleaned.
The staff showed empathy but yet not the level you expect for such hotel.
Breakfast was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: reservation process, staff should find solution more than empathy
review.locationRemarks: Direct view to the run ways of SFO amaizing

review.title: Needs updating
review.reviewText:
Workout facility worked but was really small and old. The temperature was hot in the evening and cold in the morning. For the price paid, the facility was not worth the money.

The hot water in the shower was either extremely hot or cool. Could not get the water to mix where it was pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the WSAA event, the room was adequate.

review.title: I think it was all for the best, our first hotel .
review.reviewText: our first hotel pick lost our reservations so exspedia set us up in another hotel Ebassy Suites which turned out for the better for us,everything turned out for the better.
review.negativeRemarks: One of the remotes for a t.v. did not work, we also spent time in other hotels and they all had free WiFi

review.title: enjoyed the air traffic
review.reviewText: Jeorge at the restaurant was absolutely the best server!!

review.title: This hotel is above the rating score
review.reviewText: We spent only one night but we were very pleased with the room, the morning breakfast and the service. Did not have time to use the facilities, but will be back for a longer stay.

review.title: Very nice room, as always at an Embassy Suites.
review.reviewText: We stayed there two nights. The shuttles to SFO and BART are definitely worth the stay. Upon check-in we were greeted by a very helpful woman who gave us maps of the area, BART schedules, etc. The only downside and why I didn't give 5 stars was that our dinner experience at the onsite restaurant was subpar. It was not very crowed at 7:30 at night, but the waitress seemed extremely frazzled and forgot to bring us our food. Eventually the manager came out with our food and asked her why it hadn't been delivered yet. When it was delivered, the food wasn't great either. I had a cobb salad it was was bitter and limp. The food in the mornings is always great at Embassy Suites, no complaints there.
review.positiveRemarks: Shuttles to SFO and BART - extremely helpful. Breakfast is always nice. Very nice clean room.
review.negativeRemarks: The food at the restaurant. Also, hire additional waitstaff at the restaurant if 1 waitress isn't enough.
review.locationRemarks: Burlingame seemed to have plenty to do downtown, but we took the shuttle to BART and played in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Embassy Suites ; --- Lame---
review.reviewText:
The breakfast staff are bitter mean angry people. Except for the front desk, no employees will or can speak English. Building is dated and pool, spa, sauna, gym are broken, the main fountain center piece of the internal space is broken, place is noisy. The bar smell like puke - nasty. Not impressed with the facilities in general.

Nice views of the bay, bay walking trails right outside.
review.positiveRemarks: The Room was ok, dated. Location near the bay and bay walking trails.
review.negativeRemarks: i

review.title: Great location with walking path close to airport.
review.reviewText: We had a great time. SUPER breakfast. Location was great and you can watch the planes at the airport while walking on the paved walking trail. My wife and I were very pleased.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and walking trail. SUPER breakfast!
review.negativeRemarks: Minor updating.
review.locationRemarks: Airport close, shopping and dining within a few kilometers.

review.title: I liked the walk by the water.
review.reviewText: It was nice looking out and the walk was nice. The toilet wasn't working but as soon as I called they came up to fix it. We also had to call for toilet paper. It's an old building but the staff is great they are very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The price it was high plus parking is not included.

review.title: Stay Here Night Before Flight
review.reviewText: Right on waterfront, beautiful grounds and atrium, well appointed 2-room suite for $200. Includes made-to-order omelet breakfast with a buffet (everything!) in the atrium. We skipped the free cocktail hour for meet and greet with manager on check-in, but what a nice idea. Front desk very helpful, especially Elizabeth. Wonderful place. Walking distance to Leann's a diner that had breakfast to Japanese food well done (restaurant at hotel a bit fancy for our teen).
review.negativeRemarks: There was one cabinet door over fridge that had a missing screw but the staff made a note to fix it. Also, the mini-kitchen needs silverware
review.locationRemarks: Leann's diner a block away was versatile and had excellent food. Close to Niners games and the airport.

review.title: Nice hotel easy and convenient to city attractions
review.reviewText: Hotel very nice, however, carpets need replacing. Enjoyed the walking trail by the bay.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size, free breakfast, comfortable bed, views.
review.negativeRemarks: New carpets in room.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel was just outside of the city. It was easy to drive to various locations or take public transportation. Definitely needed a car.

review.title: Nice relaxing place near the water.
review.reviewText:
It is a nice place, unfortunately the power went out during my stay and that cause a little inconvenient, other than
that was good. Pool close early for kids. parking a little tough during late nights, but it is free so that's ok unlike near hotels where is paid parking. Over all was a great stay nice place to stay, to enjoy the walk and near by restaurants. Also a nice place to come after long day trip and sight seeing in the bay and the city of San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, the water and convenient to free way and airport
review.negativeRemarks: Better customer services
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, very nice and safe area. nice walking trail by the water shopping and Dining in Burlingame Downtown and Millbrae.

review.title: Convenient location, great breakfast, great atrium
review.reviewText: Our room was overlooking the bay & was just beautiful. The staff was friendly & very helpful. Suites were spacious and the beds & pillows were soooo comfortable - made for a great night's sleep. Even though the electricity had to be turned off due to some repairs, we had ample notification & even got a glow stick to help light up the room! We had to get up early the day of the "electricity outage" & the elevators were still working & it really didn't cause any inconvenience. The hot breakfast was always a treat to look forward to & it was so enjoyable to look out over the bay or relax in the atrium. The complimentary snacks & drinks at "happy hour" was a surprise & sure help us wind down after a day's worth of touring the city. Our week's stay was a very enjoyable one & we'll be sure to book this hotel again when we return to San Fran :)
review.negativeRemarks: Really can't think of any!
review.locationRemarks: We had a rental car which came in handy since only 1 of our tour groups offered hotel pick-up for the airport hotels. Lots to do at the wharf!!!

review.title: Disappointment
review.reviewText: Paid for a Bay View room, received a parking lot view that they called a lagoon view. Expressed my displeasure and they accommodated me with room service. The bathroom smelled like a locker room, very stale.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were comfortable. It was close to the airport.

review.title: As always Embassy Suites are top notch
review.reviewText: My son needed medical help and the staff was right there with the ambulance. Anything we needed was available. Great place and fun time.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport and not far from San Francisco

review.title: Excelent place to stay
review.reviewText: very nice hotel, big rooms, nice pool, breakfast not so good, but it helps to start the day.
review.negativeRemarks: cleaness of dining room
review.locationRemarks: next to airport

review.title: convenient for hotel to airport travel
review.reviewText: we stayed one night prior to taking a flight out of San Francisco it was a convenient location and comfortable hotel and room. We were able to walk on the in front of the hotel which is on the water so very nice
review.positiveRemarks: the manager's reception was average to the mediocre however people being series nice. We left too early to participate in free food so come on come on
review.negativeRemarks: The pool was very cold.
review.locationRemarks: there is not many restaurants nearby but about 5 minutes drive there is a cute area full of restaurantd on Broadway. There is also a nice walking path

review.title: Wonderful hotel great staff very helpful .
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff lovely surroundings would really consider stay out there instead of the city
review.negativeRemarks: A little updating perhaps
review.locationRemarks: Atrium lovely great restaurant a short walk away happy hour and great breakfast.

review.title: Great location, nice water views, near airport
review.reviewText: We were only there for hours, literally, as it was the last stop on our trip and we had an early flight. The view across the water to the airport was very pretty, with a waterfront walking path and benches. The shuttle stops here last, so it goes directly to the airport from this hotel (probably has more stops in the other direction, but we didn't take it from the airport). My main complaint was that the room smelled like a combination of smoke and cleaning products trying to mask the smoke. We left the AC on and window open while we were out to dinner, which helped only a little. Because it was a short stay, I didn't ask for a room change, so I don't know how they would have handled that.
review.positiveRemarks: Views, nice size room, pleasant staff, convenient and fast shuttle to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Smoky room, internet has a fee.

review.title: Dissapointed by an old standby
review.reviewText: We've stayed at this Embassy Suites before and enjoyed it.The room layout , inclusive breakfast and Happy Hours suited our family well. Unfortunately it has taken a turn for the worse. We arrived late, and although my weeklong stay was prepaid, I called ahead so they would keep our room for us. They didn't. Our choice was to stare at a parking lot for the week or move again the next day. After lugging our bags coast to coast we chose the parking lot even though we booked a room with a view of the lagoon. They did compensate with free parking. The room was dirty. There were popcorn kernels on the floor and the walls and corners were really grimy. The pullout couch was worn out. My 90lb son could feel the springs poking in his back.The pool was supposed to be operational again after repairs but it was freezing.The breakfast created a lot of anger for us. No matter what time you went down, it was overcrowded. It was literally impossible to get your hot food, toast, coffee and a seat at the same time. We ended up leaving behind over half of our vouchers because we just couldn't get in. Often, the coffee and/or cream had run out and the staff just didn't seem on top of it.So if we went down for just a coffee even, we were left waiting.I felt really disappointed. We did not book this at a deep discount either, in fact it was the most expensive room of our time in California, but the worst accomodation. I feel this hotel charges 3 to 4 star rates for 2 star service.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is perfect for access to the greater San Francisco area.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast service and general room cleanliness need to be addressed.
review.locationRemarks: Just outside of SanFrancisco, and very close to the airport, many attractions and great shopping is less than 30 minutes away

review.title: Pleasant 4 day stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was more then I expected when I first booked.beautiful plac!! The price is ok out took us twenty minutes to get to downtown San Francisco.we loved our ocean view room and the kids loved watching the airplanes land constantly through out the day. The hotel is in a beautiful area great for pictures. They have complimentary breakfast that they cook in front of you and complimentary alcohol beverages in the evening! The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because the jacuzzi was down and the power was shut down for 8hrs due to scheduled maintenance.but other than that its an amazing place I will definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Scenery and bay view is breath taking
review.negativeRemarks: Jacuzzi, parking is $20 a night and so is wifi
review.locationRemarks: Nice evening walk by the bay or nice morning jogs.

review.title: Great View of the Bay toward Oakland.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and had a great view. The staff was helpful and the stay was exactly what we expected. We were not in the hotel very much, but it met all our needs.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and view. It was a nice hotel

review.title: Great for pets!
review.reviewText: Brought my puppy and the staff was super friendly. Some "pet-friendly" hotels are not really that pet-friendly. Very low key hotel while still maintaining a very clean and quiet environment.
review.positiveRemarks: pet-friendly but still very clean. Staff went above and beyond to be helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-Fi is an additional charge, most hotels include that these days.
review.locationRemarks: Had a bay-view and we could see the airplane landing of SFO (it was far away enough that we didn't hear them). Took a great 2 hour walk with my puppy.

review.title: convenient to airport
review.reviewText:
great location and great breakfast. Offered huge selection of breakfast options from made to order omelets to pancakes, hot buffet, cereal, fresh fruit and the list goes on and on.

room was really clean and comfortable. Shuttle to airport every 20 minutes and ON TIME.
Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Beautiful lobby and atrium. Helpful, friendly staff. Spacious room. Excellent experience
review.locationRemarks: Easy 30 minute drive into San Fran

review.title: Nice hotel but....
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel. I had a hard time finding a hotel that offered both a refrigerator & a microwave. They do offer a full cooked breakfast in the morning instead of your normal choosing over muffins, fruit & etc. A very nice atmosphere in the middle of the hotel, which is the lounge/breakfast area. Nice and relaxing just as pictured.
The one thing that is not mentioned is that there a $20 parking fee on top of your hotel reservation or else you will be towed. I even asked where else could I park without having to pay the $20, the front desk clerk said no where.
For the price that you pay, I was disappointed that the pool was not heated and the spa was basically out of order.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location, I recommend the lagoon view.

review.title: 4 day Stay
review.reviewText: The Hotel was great. Great hot breakfast, clean rooms and safe area. Pool heater and Hot Tub were Not working properly and that did Not sit well with my children. Other than that the Place was Great.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the Hot Tub and Pool Heater.
review.locationRemarks: 20 minutes from Downtown and an Easy ride to get there.

review.title: Wonderful hotel at reasonable price.
review.reviewText: A restful respite after 3000 miles of driving. My family enjoyed our time there.
review.negativeRemarks: Preparations for breakfast buffet.
review.locationRemarks: We were there to visit family.

review.title: Beautiful view of the bay
review.reviewText: Booked this hotel for my family. They absolutely loved it. It's a beautiful location, especially since we live on the Penninsula. If you are wanting to explore the city, this hotel is out of the way. However for those with family on the Penninsula, you can't beat this loaction.

review.title: Short stay catching flight out on end of vacation.
review.reviewText: Only negative was the counter personnel told us breakfast started at 6AM and when we went down at 6, the staff said it started at 7AM. So had to get something at the airport. Great short stay.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Great hotel and easy access to freeway and airport.
review.positiveRemarks: The departure and arrival schedules near the elevator. The 3 tier timed breakfast and view of bay.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco and all the attractions.

review.title: Right on the water
review.reviewText: I liked having a 2 room suite. Although I would have preferred to have an adult room and a kid room. This hotel had a living room kitchenette and a room with two beds. Two TVs came in handy. However one of our TVs was not working properly and I was frustrated with Maintenance because the guy pretended to fix it, left the room and it went out again. When I called the front desk again, the guy never came back. I finally called after an hour and told them we were going to bed and to replace the TV the next day while we were gone. The room had a mini fridge and microwave. I don't know if this was just our room or not, but I have never seen this before - a hole cut into the ceiling in the shower area with a pipe coming out of it. We were nervous that either a camera would poke out of it while we were bathing or some kind of nasty water would leak out. Neither happened, but it seemed like a lazy way to fix a problem and I didn't like it. Long lines at breakfast and they frequently ran out of plates, bowl, trays, and silverware. The food was decent. Right outside the hotel is a nice greenway next to the water. We took a nice stroll. The hot tubs were closed for maintenance and the pool was not heated because of that. Needless to say the water was probably only 70 degrees. And they close the pool 8-8:30 which is pretty much the exact time you want to use it- after sightseeing and before bed. The atrium was pretty. They advertised a movie night. But cancelled it
review.negativeRemarks: Lots of maintenance issues - tv, hole in shower with pipe sticking out, pool/hot tubs not working.
review.locationRemarks: South of airport in San Francisco. Nice greenway outside and right on the water.

review.title: Relaxing Experience
review.reviewText: It was very relaxing to be able to walk along the bay. We also enjoyed the view from our room, which was bayside. The breakfast was very well organized! There were many choices each day for breakfast. We also enjoyed the Manager's reception several evenings. We stayed at the hotel six nights. I would recommend this hotel if you want to be away from the crowds of the city. It would not be convenient if you do not have your own transportation. We stayed with the hotel at the peak of the summer tourist season (last week of July into first week of August).
review.positiveRemarks: The view from our room, the breakfasts and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: The quality of the mattress on the pull out sofa.
review.locationRemarks: It is close to the airport. There is easy access to Hwy 101. You must drive about 30 minutes to most of the San Francisco attractions.

review.title: Not the Embassy Suites we hoped for
review.reviewText:
We've stayed at a number of Embassy Suites hotels in the past, and this one was disappointing. We have a larger family and look forward to the breakfasts, but this one more resembled an assembly line to feed the animals. The food wasn't horrible, but it wasn't great either, and it was NOT made to order. The staff tried to keep up, but the herd was relentless. It seemed to be a staffing issue.

The breakfast hours were not made clear to us, so while we had breakfast Sunday morning, we missed it Monday morning because the hours changed from weekend to weekday. A sentence or two from the registration staff could have told us what to expect.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was decent, the beds were comfortable, and we appreciate the two-room suite to accommodate our family.
review.negativeRemarks: Either increase staffing to handle the breakfast demands, or do a better job of setting customer expectations.
review.locationRemarks: Burlingame is a nice town with plenty of good food, and San Francisco is a short, pleasant drive up the 101.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The service was amazing!!! I just had a problem with the elevators. They were really slow and there was no staircase to take (unless there was an emergency) we were only on the second floor but it felt like we were waiting forever) the view was beautiful and the complimentary breakfast was the best I've ever had!
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators
review.locationRemarks: Beautiful

review.title: Unidentified Organic matter on our curtains!!
review.reviewText: This place has so much potential and I am sure was a beautiful property when built but it needs a complete deep cleaning. We had organic matter on our curtains (poo) and I was treated like it was no big deal....well for my family it is. The carpets everywhere they are visible on the entire property are stained and filthy. We were moved to another room at my request after I was told there was nothing they could do about the curtains, a little 409 and a rag would have worked. Our new room had just as filthy carpets and a stained couch but at least there was no obvious fecal matter. The TV's and bedding are nice but leave you wondering how clean they are with all the other questionable cleaning issues. This place allows pets which I now understand means they don't mind Fido doing his business on the carpet. If you like laying on the floor in a public restroom this place will be perfect. The location is amazing and close to everything. It's a shame it could be really nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The Beds, bedding, TV's and breakfast are all good. The location is amazing.
review.negativeRemarks: They need to clean this place it's filthy.
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to Bart and the airport sitting right on the bay. Nice location.

review.title: Some improvement needed
review.reviewText: The room was small. There were no stairs that could be used. There were only emergency stairways that were dirty. There was a long wait for the elevator at times. The location is great. The breakfast was very good. The carpets in the breakfast hall need to be cleaned or taken out and just a floor put in. A floor would be easier to clean every day when people spill their food.
review.negativeRemarks: queen instead of double beds
review.locationRemarks: close enough to SF activities.

review.title: Nice hotel fun to watch planes land nice path
review.reviewText: All was good except our room was not ready until five and the pool was freezing cold.
review.positiveRemarks: Air port shuttle was very convenient. Awesome to watch planes land at sfo. Nice trail to walk right outside hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Make pool warmer. Repair hot tub. Have room ready by promised check in time.
review.locationRemarks: Sfo is minutes away. We loved spending the day at coyote point five minutes away. Had awesome playground, trails and kids museum/zoo. My kids loved it

review.title: Great view
review.reviewText: Great breakfast it was excellent. Great views. It wasab enjoyable experience
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: All great

review.title: Comfortable hotel but far from downtown.
review.reviewText: Hotel is great, just far from downtown if planning to use as a base to explore the San Francisco tourist sights.
review.negativeRemarks: far from downtown
review.locationRemarks: great location on bay but far from most downtown sights

review.title: Nice hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located to the downtown area and airport. The staff was helpful and pleasant. The room was clean, however the pull out bed in the living space was extremely uncomfortable. During our stay the pool heater and jacuzzis were not operational. Breakfast was good and provided us with a lot of options. Overall, our experience was good. We would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the convenience of the location, breakfast options, and room comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: Pull out beds need better mattresses.
review.locationRemarks: Great view over the water. Convenient to all the tourist attractions in downtown San Francisco, Alcatraz, and Muir Woods.

review.title: No swimming pool
review.reviewText: We booked the Waterfront hotel because of the view and swimming pool. When we arrived, we found out by ourselves, we werent told upon check-in, that the pool was not heated. Having four kids, this was not acceptable. We called South San Francisco Embassy Suites, and was able to get a room there, but 2 days after we checked in. So checked out, and went to the other Embassy Suites
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was friendly, but i still was upset that we werent told about the pool not working when we checked in.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the swimming pool.
review.locationRemarks: Its close by to San Francisco, about a 30 minute drive with traffic. tyhe Waterfron view is nice.

review.title: Great location, but hotel rooms need renovation
review.reviewText: Stayed one night. We love Embassy Suites hotels and have been to a number of them. The location on the bay is really sweet. Unfortunately the hotel itself is in need of renovation. The breakfast dining area was already in the process of being upgraded - it looked nice so far. Our kids went for a swim. The heating system for the pool and jacuzzi was broken so the water temp was frigid!! The 2 room suite is out-dated. The carpets were so dirty that our feet or socks were blackened after a couple of hours. The mattresses were too soft and lumpy.
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness. Mattress quality.

review.title: Hotel stay between Alaska and Texas
review.reviewText: Great! Staff was very accomodating and happy to help. Complimentary breakfastwas a real breakfast! Bravo. Not rolls, buns, and coffee!
review.negativeRemarks: WIFI and cell tower connections!!!!!!!!!!!! Very bad.
review.locationRemarks: did not have time to do on our own. Met friend who provided the tour.

review.title: a haven for the night
review.reviewText: We arrived at San Francisco Airport having had 2 hour delays, so that we got in well after midnight. The hotel had been informed that we would likely get in late, and everything was ready for us. The room was very comfortable, with lots of space, which was exactly what we needed then. The one issue we had (airport shuttle does not run during the late hours, even though a previous call had told us that it did) was easily handled.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds were comfortable, shower worked perfectly, the room was quiet. The hot breakfast included enough of a variety so that all of us were pleased.
review.negativeRemarks: Have the shuttle run all night, or provide alternatives so that late-night travelers could arrange ahead of time.
review.locationRemarks: We only stayed one night. We did make use of the lovely bayside walk, glorious in the early morning, and probably more so at sunset.

review.title: beautiful view
review.reviewText: Overall, this was a very positive experience. We were disappointed that the indoor pool was not heated. Breakfast was great with a beautiful view!

review.title: Excellent location & great staff.
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful 3-day stay- hotel had nice decors.
review.positiveRemarks: LOCATION & free shuttle to & from the airport & free breakfasts.
review.negativeRemarks: Sofa bed - mattress too thin- can feel the springs!!!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent view of the bay... although located near the airport, did not hear the planes coming & going.

review.title: Not great
review.reviewText: The hotel is very used. The carpets stained, walls patched and painted over, wall paper peeling - very dated feel. There was what looked like chipped drywall on the floor, dust bunnies in the bathroom and the furniture is well worn. I went down to the restaurant around 8:30 for a drink and desert and most of the tables had drop cloths over them. I went to the bar and there was such a ruckus I couldn't talk to the waiter.

review.title: Top notch hotel and staff!
review.reviewText: I absolutely loved my stay. The personnel was always very courteous and helpful. They remembered our name for the rest of our stay....amazing!:) They were all about their guests. Loved, loved, loved the breakfast! The food was absolutely fabulous and the view was spectacular. Rooms are so big and clean!! I would definitely recommend this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is by the ocean with a beautiful view.

review.title: One night Airport stay
review.reviewText:
One night stay for wife and two grown children after cross country flight.
This was a very good choice. Nice room with two beds and a sleeper couch
review.positiveRemarks: Nice walk way along bay shore. Included buffet breakfast is one of the best we've had. Hotel atrium close to being remodeled. Already looks goo
review.negativeRemarks: Little challenging GPS directions to hotel. Likely more an issue with 'smart' phone

review.title: Construction going on inside hotel, but nice
review.reviewText: They are currently under construction to make the courtyard better, it was half done and was very nice so far. Breakfast is always the same, so after a week of the same thing it got a little old, but free is good. The evening reception is nice with free drinks and some chips/salsa. Rooms were nice, but have a little age. All in all a good stay.
review.locationRemarks: Not too close or too far from San Fran, just be prepared for a lot of traffic. Close to airport.

review.title: Mixed feelings.
review.reviewText: Unfortunately the hotel was in the process of being remodeled. The pool was not heated, and the jacuzzi was out of service. Apparently they were trying to make up by offering certain special perks at no or low cost, but it was unclear what those things were. It was convenient since it was the host hotel for my workshop.
review.negativeRemarks: Hot tub out of order.
review.locationRemarks: A bit out of the way which is both bad and good.

review.title: Fantastic Water location and SFO Flight Path. Nice
review.reviewText: Major renovation -- it was FINE as it was! That's why we kept coming back for over 15 years. Oh well..... It's a great location.
review.positiveRemarks: Views of the Bay..... And planes landing
review.negativeRemarks: Noise renovation.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect. One of the best for Embassy.

review.title: Liked location on the water & breakfast selection
review.reviewText: Got in very late & left next morning. Quiet, pleasant, staff was very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: location on the water, close to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: New carpet in the hallways
review.locationRemarks: Location good for waling/ exercising. Other than that I was not there long enough to figure out what to do in the area

review.title: Good breakfast buffet despite ongoing renovations!
review.reviewText: This hotel is undergoing major renovations to the main atrium, pool, etc., so at the moment it's not the most inviting place to stay, but the free buffet breakfast more than made up for the one night's stay during construction. I'm sure this hotel will be very nice once the remodeling is complete.

review.title: Remodeling and sneaky fees.
review.reviewText: If I had known in advance that it was being remodeled I would not have stayed there. I also did not appreciate being charged $20 for parking without being notified in advance. The parking is not fenced or protected and is just an additional way to jack up the price with hidden fees.
review.negativeRemarks: The onset lady at the desk and the surprise parking fee.

review.title: Great stay right by San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at this hotel just one night of a 6 day vacation before a flight back home (after visiting Sonoma and arriving late in the evening). It fit our needs very well and the location was ideal. While obviously designed with a business traveller in mind, this hotel accommodated us for a personal trip quite well with good space to spread out and to charge and use electronics and the staff quickly checked us in. The full free breakfast was a big bonus and one of the reasons we selected the hotel in addition to the free shuttle to the airport. Staff and service were the best qualities of this hotel. The location can be a bit noisy and we also had trouble controlling the heat in the room and needed to open the balcony door overnight, this was the only downside of the stay. Watching the planes land at the airport nearby right from the breakfast room was a fun perk, you don't see that everyday.
review.positiveRemarks: Size of the suite and staff
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for close to airport

review.title: Outstanding value for the price
review.reviewText: They were doing a major renovation inside the hotel in the open area inside the hotel (look at pictures to understand what I'm referring to) but you would not know that if you weren't in the area. Noise was never an issue and no other aspect was affected negatively. The room was huge and clean, and the free breakfast was very good. I honestly don't have anything to complain about except that it was not nearly as easy to get into downtown San Fran as one would think it should be.
review.negativeRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Not good for those looking to get to the city. You can do it but it will take time/money. BART from airport or Caltrain from Burlingame are best bets

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: Great location, complimentary buffet, room size, excellent food.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, right on waterfront,

review.title: nice for business travelers
review.reviewText: nice staff, good services. currently under renovation, a bit noisy during the day if you plan to stay inside your room, and sleep late in the morning.

review.title: Our stay at Embassy Suites San Francisco
review.reviewText: Would stay here again! Great location, food quality, and room size was great! Enjoyed the complimentary airport shuttle, buffet breakfasts' and happy hour each night!
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom could use some updating
review.locationRemarks: Fabulous, right along the waterfront.

review.title: Great hotel close to rental cars and 24 hour diner
review.reviewText: Eas great staff was friendly and allways ready to assit.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: You can hike, ride bikesn eat fresh seafoodn and fish.

review.title: Hotel stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was under remodeling. There was a lot of dust and noise. Worker did their best to keep the hotel as clean as posible and stay was enjoyable. Would come back.
review.positiveRemarks: Service was great . Enjoyed breakfast managers reception. Enjoyed the whole experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Had none.
review.locationRemarks: Loved the view and the area. Enjoyed the places to walk. Close enought to the city but also far enougth away.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: bar/restaurant staff not as friendly as other Embassy Suites we have visited.

review.title: Excellent for families
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at this embassy suites. Renovations were underway to improve the pool and foyer which will be fabulous when finished. We stayed with young children on a recent trip from Australia and found this hotel very quiet, well maintained and friendly staff. Would highly recommend staying here.

review.title: Easy access to Diva Half Marathon
review.reviewText: The entire center area was under construction. Dusty and a noisy racket all morning and afternoon. Drills, pounding and saw blades going off continuously. The room had the smell of stale cigars. Access to the lobby was only available from far end elevators. To access lobby from my location if you took closest elevators you could only go to second floor then proceed all the way across length of hotel then take stairs or other elevator down to first floor. Definitely not worth the price paid considering the mess and constant noise.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to walking paths and very close to the start of the half marathon I was entered in. Bed was quite comfortable and room was good sized.

review.title: Embassy hotel, somewhat disappointing
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the middle of renovations. This should have been told to us. No pool, no facilities. Kitchen at minimal quality and staffing. The location right on the water is very good and beautiful and when they complete the renovations, we are sure it will be fine. Expedia should have let us know.
review.negativeRemarks: renovation and pre-cooked breakfast.

review.title: Nice hotel. Would return again!
review.reviewText: Nice room with a separate bedroom. Clean with comfy beds. Nice view of the bay. Nice breakfast selections. Lobby staff was average.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast ended 1 hour before scheduled time.
review.locationRemarks: Nice bay views. Far from downtown.

review.title: a good hotel with friendly staff
review.reviewText: although there were some miscommunications between what was told to me over the telephone, versus what was actually reserved upon check in (I had confirmed a reservation for a wheelchair accessible room 2 days prior to check-in, but upon check-in they had not reserved an accessible room) the staff did everything they could to make up for the miscommunication, and ultimately gave us the room type we had requested. In addition, we also got free parking. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. We will definitely use this hotel again if we visit the San Francisco area.
review.positiveRemarks: the location, and the continental breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: they were doing construction while we were there, and the pool was closed
review.locationRemarks: absolutely beautiful location on the southern San Francisco Bay waterfront. Convenient trails for walking.

review.title: Beware of Renovation thru June 2013
review.reviewText: It was unfortunate that we stayed at the hotel during a major renovation. The entire atrium/courtyard was torn up and there was no pool or fitness area. If you are booked closer to June, you should have a better experience. The staff was very helpful and the complimentary full breakfast, WiFi and cocktail hours prevented our stay from being a total letdown.

review.title: Vacation in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean, staff very courteous and as expected excellent breakfast and managers reception. Excellent location right on the bay.

review.title: I had a great time.
review.reviewText: Even though construction was going on I had a great experience. Everyone was nice. I loved the shuttle into the town of Burlingame where I could go shopping. Everything was clean and in great shape.

review.title: Great Hotel "Under Construction"
review.reviewText: We booked this room a few months in advance of our travels to the USA as it was near to San Fransico airport, offered bay views, free airport shuttle and a breakfast buffet all within the rate. What we were not told, until we discovered it upon our arrival, was that the hotel was undergoing major refurbishments. This meant no use of the pool (although we could walk over to the neighbouring Hilton.... and walk back soaking wet !!). The main central part of the hotel which should have been full of exotic plants and fish was a building site. There was scaffolding up almost everywhere with plastic sheeting covering certain areas. I do understand why this hotel is under refurbishment .... it needs it. The parts we were allowed access to were old.The room where breakfast is served had a "sticky" carpet and the bar where free drinks and snacks were available had a bad smell about it. This put us off going in there for our free refreshments. The room itself was spacious. The bed linen and towels were clean, in fact the room as a whole was clean ..... just old. The toilet wasn't fixed to the wall properly and moved when sat on. The balcony door was dirty which spoiled the view of the bay a little. They gave out sweets to the children and offered all guests free wifi as compensation. It would have been better to have been informed about it so that we as a family could make a decision wether to stay there or not during that time. I think this will be a great hotel once completed.
review.positiveRemarks: Great Bay Views - Wonderful views of planes landing right in front of the bay.
review.negativeRemarks: Old fashioned but currently undergoing construction / upgrading works.
review.locationRemarks: Ideally situated near San Fransico Airport .... with free shuttle to and from airport - hotel

review.title: Good service
review.reviewText: The time we stayed the hotel is under renovation. But overall ,the service was pretty good. The continental breakfast was awesome.
review.negativeRemarks: The place needs better ventilation

review.title: love Embassy Suites
review.reviewText: Cannot give all 5s because the hotel is old, and is undergoing a complete renovation - the staff was awesome, and we love Embassy Suites, and when the renovation is complete it will be great! Then all 5s
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Great location and room quality
review.reviewText:
No complaint at all.
Room is clean and breakfast is good.
Enjoyed watching airplanes taking off and loading from far.
review.negativeRemarks: parking cost $20
review.locationRemarks: close to airport and 30min to SF and San Jose.

review.title: Not Satisfied
review.reviewText: The hotel is under construction. I did not see anything about this on their website. The pool/hotub is closed, guests are told they can use the pool area at the Hyatt.... across the street. Embassy usually has made to order breakfast, however this was not. They have three options for eggs and they were served cold. Could not make toast becuase the outlet kept tripping due to the extension cords were overloaded. I have never had this experience at any other Embassy Hotel I have ever stayed at.
review.negativeRemarks: The Breakfast was horrible.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel looks like it would be nice because of the location, however the inside doesn't match the outside.

review.title: Hotel under renovations
review.reviewText: Hotel is currently undergoing renovations of the atrium. Access is limited indoors. No pool or gum access. The room was nice and clean except for a torn sheer curtain at the window. Breakfast was good but the omelette were premade and not cooked to order. I have stayed here in the past and will continue to book here in the future. Looking forward to the renovated hotel. The staff were all nice and attentive.

review.title: Great Room !
review.reviewText:
My room was wonderful !. I loved my view of the water! The staff was great. I was disappointed that the pool,jacuzzi and atrium was not available due to construction, but they did offer guest to use the nearby Hilton's pool etc. I'm sure there is never a good time for construction, but I'm sure it will be beautiful. I would love to stay here again one day.!
I loved the courtesy Airport shuttle !!! ( I used it everyday) Thank you !!

review.title: room was nice but hotel was a mess
review.reviewText: The hotel was under construction so it was dissapointing to not be able to use the atrium and the pool. The hotel should offer free parking or lower prices to offset the mess and loss of ammenities. The room was confortable and had a nice view and also I liked the walkway running alongside the hotel and waterway. The free breakfast was also a plus but you need to get there by 7:30 or the line is really long.
review.positiveRemarks: waterway walkway and view plus free breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: messy construction and no use of atrium and pool. also $17 to park per day.
review.locationRemarks: nice, right along the waterway and near the airport.

review.title: March 2013 - In the middle of renovations
review.reviewText: I was a little surprised to arrive for my trip to find this hotel in the middle of a major renovation. On the upside, I'm glad this place is working to upgrade. On the downside, they were doing it in the middle of my vacation. I was looking forward to their usual great breakfast and made-to-order omelets. During the renovation premade omelets were coming out of the kitchen. It was obvious the staff was working hard to make the whole thing work considering the situation and everything being in a different place. The hot tub was not available due to the construction, and although the gal at the desk said we could use the hot tub at their sister property (Doubletree) nearby, that doesn't really work with kids and crossing a busy street (especially in the evening). And who wants to get in a car with a wet swimsuit and get everything wet. It was the same situation with the workout facility. if I had known about the construction, I would have stayed elsewhere. With what little vacation time we had, I just wished we could have used those little luxuries that make staying in a hotel a little more fun.
review.negativeRemarks: Construction..... in the middle of my vacation :(
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport with a reliable shuttle

review.title: The bad management!
review.reviewText: This particular hotel is baldly manage. They show very little concern of pleasing their clientele.

review.title: Wait for redo
review.reviewText: Did not know the entire lobby shut down for complete redo...very disappointing as the water and plants are what I look forward to at Embassy.
review.negativeRemarks: Chaos of construction...few elevators
review.locationRemarks: Ok for airport...prompt shuttle

review.title: More information please!!
review.reviewText: I was unaware that the hotel was undergoing a re-model at the time. Although I would not have changed my reservation it would have been really nice to know in advance.

review.title: Renovation Inn
review.reviewText:
I have stayed at this hotel several times in the past. On this visit I was surprised to find the entire Atrium was under renovation. The management and staff tried to make the best of the situation for the guests. However, I would not have chosen to stay there if I knew about the renovation ahead of time. From my past visits; I didn't think the Atrium had a problem. The guest rooms could use a bit of a spruce.
I was told the renovation of the Atrium will last until May 2013.

review.title: OK to stay for a few days on business trip
review.reviewText: Very convenient location, free shuttle service from and to the SFO. Spacious room with a great view. You can spot airplanes landing into the airport, although get a noise of that. The hotel is under reformation so cannot say if you get the value for money. Breakfast was not great but room service was. One of the phones was broken and the cleaner did not hoover the bathroom, leaving hair on the floor.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO

review.title: very very bad experience !
review.reviewText: very nasty ,the hotel smells real bad , rooms are very old and nasty ,and beds are old and falling apart . i will never stay in any of the embassy suites hotel again and im gonna make sure to tell all of my friends about that.NOT WORTH WHAT I PAID FOR THE ROOMS PER DAY .
review.negativeRemarks: the bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: good location by the bay but they need to fix that hotel from bottom up.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was being renovated so it was a little noisy for our meeting but they did their best to keep the noise to a minimum. A good choice for both location and service.

review.title: Business traveler
review.reviewText: The hotel is under renovation. The website only stated the pool was under renovation and I would not have booked here if I had known. My room was very hot and difficult to sleep in. The location is great and so are the staff. I would recommend this hotel once construction is finished.
review.negativeRemarks: Hot room.
review.locationRemarks: Near the water with a walking/running path. Restraurants within walking distance.

review.title: Great stay near SFO
review.reviewText: The lobby and atrium were undergoing extensive renovation while I was there so it's really not possible to rate the condition and upkeep fairly. I think it's a positive sign any time property owners invest in their buildings however - and I'm sure when it's finished the results will be good. The heavy wood accents made the place a bit dark - but the location being so close to SFO and the really nice restaurant make this a winner for me.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet - good quality free breakfast - better than average restaurant with a nice selection. Great jogging path, nice views of the Bay and happy hour.
review.negativeRemarks: Limo bus makes about 4 stops - in traffic this means 25 minutes for a 2 mile trip
review.locationRemarks: This is very convenient to SFO - my business takes me to the Bay Area so getting to BART, Cal-Train or (infrequently) rental cars is very easy.

review.title: Stay away from Embassy Suites SanFrancisco Bay
review.reviewText:
I flew my oldest daughter from New York to Phoenix, to
spend spring break with my other two teenagers and myself.
I booked a "package" via Expedia, however the nightmare began
at the airport, when the flight to San Francisco was delayed for 2 hours.
We finally arrived at the hotel and more bad news :
It is under construction until May 2013; we were greeted with noisy jack hammers and
could not find the lobby (under construction)
No pool, no work out room...all under construction.
With nothing to do, I spend $200 in cab fares to venture into the city
that was 30 minutes away ( no transportation from the hotel as guest service or compensation)
I wish I had known that the hotel is unlivable ..I would have
chosen a different one...my kids were really nice about it and love San Francisco, however
breakfeast until 9 am is totally unreasonable for teenagers, do I had to fish out more money
for food; in the evening, there was an open "free" bar, my oldest is 21 and was tricked into paying for "double drinks" that she is very naive about and should not have been offered to her. Not my kind of family fun.

review.title: Heating and Cooling are MAJOR PROBLEM
review.reviewText: Major problem was with heating and cooling. Hotel has installed a system that does not allow you to heat your room until the temp reaches a low of 55 F. I haven't ever stayed somewhere with such an uncomfortable default system. You can request in room space heaters, which are noisy and then heat the room to excessive heats waking you up at night. Numerous other small difficulties (only decaf coffee provided in room for example). But the heating and cooling are major problems, and completely unworkable if you are traveling with small children.

review.title: Under Construction
review.reviewText: One reason we selected this hotel was for it's indoor heated pool, which was not available due to 'renovations'. If we had been informed of these renovations we would have chosen another hotel. Safe deposit box not available for the same reason. Staff did not give us the requested wakeup call, nearly missed our flight. Sofabed worst I have ever slept on #and I wasn't expecting much out of it# broken springs, threadbare cushions. Noisey from slamming doors, loud people stocking up on free booze in the atrium during Happy Hour.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel
review.locationRemarks: Great for airport access

review.title: Great Location but Very Noisy
review.reviewText: This is a very large 9-story hotel with an impressive grand atrium in the middle filled with plants, tall trees, and fish ponds. The main problem is all sound is amplified and echoes upward to all the rooms. They serve a very good hot buffet breakfast in the atrium for several hours, so the noise begins early in the morning. The suites have the living room with sofabed in the front room facing the atrium, so the unlucky person who sleeps on the sofabed can't sleep past 6:30am. In addition, the sofabed mattress was the worst I've ever experienced. I had to request a 2nd mattress to use on top of the bad one to cover the metal bars. The staff is very friendly and accomodating, but they need to replace the terrible sofabed mattresses. The beds in the quiet back bedroom were fine, but there were 3 of us, so one had to use the sofabed.
review.positiveRemarks: Good value with suites so 3 or 4 can stay in one room. Very attractive central atrium filled with plants, trees and fish ponds. Great hot breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Very noisy atrium with sound carrying upward to all the rooms. Terrible broken down sofabed mattress needs replacement.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location near SFO airport, great restaurants, and Highways 101, 92 and 280. Beautiful walking trail right outside along the bay.

review.title: Hotel Needs A Face Lift
review.reviewText:
Embassy Suites are usually a good place for business meetings and I enjoy staying there. This hotel was very old and dirty. The drapes were ripped and the bed leaned to one side. The carpet was old and dirty. The pool and spa were out of service.

The good and bad news is that the hotel has started construction (downstairs). There was no lobby or check in rather than computers and fold up chairs.

The parking was a distance away and unprotected. I do not see why they would charge additional money to park your car in a "parking lot" that can be enetered by anyone.

I was very disappointed and certainly will not stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location to San Francisco Airport is convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Older dark dirty rooms, construction and paid parking for an unsecured parking lot
review.locationRemarks: Industrial businesses surround the hotel, not convenient to any stores or places to eat without driving. Nothing in walking distance.

review.title: View and location awesome.
review.reviewText: Great view, great location. the board with flight times is very useful.
review.positiveRemarks: excellent view of the bay and lagoon. excellent hot breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: they charge $13.95 for internet! ridiculous.
review.locationRemarks: very convenient location close to the airport.

review.title: "Just fine"
review.reviewText: I stayed at the hotel for a course that was held there, and I'd flown in so I was there without a car. The hotel was fine, if slightly soulless, but I guess what did I expect? The breakfast was nice enough, staff all pretty friendly, but the location is really cut off, so I ended up relying on their courtesy shuttle back to the airport to take the BART into the city for dinner. They claim that the shuttle comes every 20 minutes, but I waited close to 30 minutes 2 out of the 3 times I took it, so it's a bit of an inconvenient way to get around.
review.negativeRemarks: The shuttle was too infrequent
review.locationRemarks: Pretty unexciting

review.title: Great for families.
review.reviewText: Excelent service, superclean overall worth the price
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location.

review.title: Great Lay Over
review.reviewText: Location is great for access to SFO, the local town has lots of great ethnic resteraunts. View from room across water was really nice. The free Happy hour and Breakfast were really good.
review.locationRemarks: very convenient to SFO and good central location for day trips

review.title: Family vacation
review.reviewText: Breakfast is divine, the view incredible, love the jungle theme in the atrium and the Happy Hour. We will be back (so please fix the jacuzzi).
review.negativeRemarks: Cold pool and jacuzzi out of service
review.locationRemarks: Couldn't ask for a better view and BART can take you anywhere you want without having to battle with traffic

review.title: Dirty and expensive!
review.reviewText:
We chose this hotel because of the location but the condition of the room was disappointing. The lighting in the bedroom and bathroom was poor, making it very hard to apply make-up. The bathroom was too small and the faucet leaked all over the vanity. The sliding glass door was so dirty on the outside that you couldn't enjoy the view of the bay. The last night of our stay we couldn't even find a parking space. They had several Christmas parties going on at the hotel and had allowed all the guests to park in the lot instead of the overflow event lot. We had to park across the street even though we were being charged $18 per night for parking. They also charged for wi-fi access. The only way to access the internet was to pay a huge fee or to use their business center, which had no air. They also didn't allow you to control the air in your room.
We will never stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Not as convenient as expected.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL VERY CLEAN AND PERFECT SEVICE!!
review.reviewText: ROOMS VERY CLEAN EXCELLENT SERVICE AND GOOD FOOD OVERALL CLEANLESS VERY NICE VIEWS

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I always stay at this hotel when I have to leave the next morning out of SFO. It's great and convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom door is facing the bed.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, close to the airport.

review.title: great hotel for family
review.reviewText: great location with bay view, free parking, and good foof
review.negativeRemarks: cleaness
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Very nice.
review.reviewText: It was overall a nice place to stay-a little old but had all Embassy Suite qualities.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast was very good-lots of choices every day
review.negativeRemarks: Preferred a larger choice in evening snacks. Would have liked some fruit and more snack choices.
review.locationRemarks: Location south of airport right on waterfront--no other restaurants close by that we could see, but that wasn't critical to us.

review.title: Better than ever expected from an airport hotel!!!
review.reviewText: Not the most high-end stay of our vacation, but the experience was fantastic & room layout perfect for traveling with a child. Great service & staff. Lovely mature growth atrium & fantastic waterfront location.

review.title: pleasant hotel and very good for the family.
review.reviewText: Great hotel, wonderful view,personal bilingual staff.
review.positiveRemarks: The center building ,where We took breakfast, and even breakfast was delicious.
review.negativeRemarks: The pool, the water was too cold.
review.locationRemarks: near the airport ,

review.title: San Francisco visit
review.reviewText:
Nice view of the bay. I always like the water features in Embassy Suites. This one had a complete jungle theme.

Easy to get back onto 101, but sometimes a little tricky exiting the highway to get to the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: could hear traffic noise, even though far away
review.locationRemarks: right by the Bay. a walking path is just alongside.

review.title: Broken Jacuzzi
review.reviewText: The breakfast was great. The room was spacious. The sofa bed was very uncomfortable. During my stay the pool was not heated and the jacuzzi was broken. Hopefully that was just a maintenance issue. The cocktails were good but the appetizers consisted of goldfish and chexmix. Overall I was a bit disappointed with my stay because I was really looking forward to the jacuzzi. The staff was great and location convenient for the airport, conferences
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast was delicious! Travelled with someone who was gluten free and there was plenty to choose from.
review.negativeRemarks: Unheated pool and broken jacuzzi
review.locationRemarks: Close to freeway with water views and next to a recreational trail

review.title: Relaxing get away
review.reviewText:
Beautiful hotel, SUPER Breakfast, clean, quiet and comfortable. Only draw back was the distance from the city and the cost of taxis.

Would stay there again and recommend it to others!
review.negativeRemarks: distance from San Francisco

review.title: One Fatal Flaw
review.reviewText:
Suites all share one fatal flaw. The only bathroom in the suite is in the bedroom. This requires the person on the sofa bed to come into the bedroom to use the facility. It also provides the harmony of bathroom noices( air vents, shower etc) to those in bedroom and a view of the facility from both beds if the door is left open.
