The bay view is quite nice and would recommend this hotel but for the fatal flaw. Other Embassy Suites do not suffer this drawback.
review.negativeRemarks: Restroom location in bedroom and complimentary breakfast closed down 30 minutes early.

review.title: Beautiful Bay Views - No Public Trans Included
review.reviewText: I had contacted the hotel 2 times via phone regarding the public transportation options for myself and the other guests as we were not planning on renting a car for our stay in San Francisco. I was informed both times by two separate people that transportation to the city from our hotel was included in the room reservation and no additional costs would be incurred for that public transportation - trolley or BART. Instead we waited 25+ mins for the hotel shuttle to pick us up at the airport and we finally got to the hotel to find out that although I was informed that transportation was included that it actually was NOT. My husbands and the other couple then had to make a decision about how we would get around for the length of our stay. We decided to rent a car and we ended up paying a much higher price to rent a vehicle once we arrived instead of the price we saw online beforehand. In Sept I had decided not to reserve a car based on the information provided to me on 2 separate occassions by hotel representatives. To rectify the situation the staff did upgrade us at no cost to a bayview room which was beautiful and much appreciated, however I was still very disappointed in the incorrect information I received which resulted in us having to spend extra money not budgetted for. Ultimately I LOVE Embassy Suites - whenever I travel I always look to see if there is an Embassy Suites in the area that I can stay at - I prefer it over any other hotel I have ever stayed in.

review.title: Great hotel for a family getaway to the Bay Area
review.reviewText:
Great hotel for a weekend trip to the Bay Area. A few miles south of the airport, so you don't have to fight traffic to get there, but still close enough to the city (and BART) to make getting around easy. The girls loved the indoor pool, and the included cook to order breakfast was way better than expected.

The room was nice, but the sleeper sofa was just adequate.

But all in all, a good price for a quality hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The all suites concept meant we could put the girls to bed without having to go to sleep with them.

review.title: Embassy Suites SFO
review.reviewText: Buffet breakfast excellent. Pool and hottubs great.

review.title: Clean, but dissappointing
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel..but...only had warm water for a shower, internet is not free, breakfast starts at 7am (which is too late for a early flight from SFO).
review.negativeRemarks: warm shower, costly internet, late start on breakfast
review.locationRemarks: nice location

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: This place is great for a quiet hotel to stay in the SF area. Its literally 5 minutes from the airport and about 25 minutes from downtown (without traffic). The atrium is beautiful, and it has wonderful views of the coast. For being so close to the airport, there is little to no airplane noise heard in the rooms. Theyve got a great evening reception with complimentary cocktails and snacks, and a solid breakfast buffet with made to order omelettes, pancakes, and french toast.
review.positiveRemarks: Quick check in, beautiful atrium, great evening cocktail reception, great breakfast, wonderful views of the coast.
review.negativeRemarks: They should close the only restaurant in the hotel for a "private party" on a Saturday night. Definitely dissapointed with that.

review.title: Great before a trip
review.reviewText: It was great. We had to get up very early for a flight.

review.title: Clean, big rooms, 2 awesome days.
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel 3 friends. It was a wonderful experience for us, room was so clean and big. Staff were really friendly and the breakfast in the morning was good. The best experience for me was the pool and spa, I was not expecting a heated one but when we went down to pool around 10, we were just surprised and enjoyed the pool. Wonderful two days spent in this one, strongly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: Charge on water
review.locationRemarks: Location was not that good but if you dont try to leave and get back to hotel in rush hours you should be fine.

review.title: Overdue for updating
review.reviewText: I believe the hotel is a little overdue for updating. The staff was pleasant and the location was good, but the overall condition left a little to be desired.

review.title: Great hotel for anyone
review.reviewText:
Great! Easy nice and convenient.
Worth the price.
Recommend to anyone or family. Great breakfast and beautiful rooms
review.negativeRemarks: They wouldn't let us stay longer
review.locationRemarks: Easy

review.title: Great hotel for family
review.reviewText: Stayed here last weekend with my husband, my parents, brother, his wife and baby. We book 2 suites with double beds which were super spacious. My parents were very impressed. The hotel and staff were both very nice and the complimentary breakfast was a plus especially their cook to order breakfast. They gave us breakfast vouchers when we checked in but never needed them. The hotel has their own bar/ lounge which is another plus especially the batender, he really hooks it up with the alcohol so remember to tip him good. The only downside was that it was super cold in our rooms and we couldnt switch the heater on since the hotel has an automatic thermostat so the only option was to turn it off and even then it was cold. Overall we enjoyed our stay and will definitely return.

review.title: Great hotel stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel, very comfortable spacious room. It's a little older, but amenities are very nice. Breakfast and evening reception were great. Very convenient, and a nice setting. I would go back - shuttle service was comfortable and on time!
review.locationRemarks: very convenient to SFO

review.title: OH HOW I WANT TO GO BACK TO SF ALREADY
review.reviewText: It was nice to be able to stay somewhere this beautiful and it not break my bank!
review.negativeRemarks: PARKING
review.locationRemarks: BREATHTAKING

review.title: No such thing as a "free" breakfast
review.reviewText: One thing we like is the proximity to SFO. In this visit this location suited every place we needed to get to. One thing we always forget is this hotel caters to parents and kids on the weekends which means a morning workout has to be at 5:30 and kept short in order to beat the long lines at the breakfast counter. Each of the last times we have stayed here, there has been some athletic or dance event or both being held nearby which means there are many hungry children and their parents. Forget about the included breakfast if you have places to be in the AM.
review.positiveRemarks: location to SFO and San Francisco surrounding communities
review.negativeRemarks: Not a hotel for couples
review.locationRemarks: Good location - clean and pleasant surroundings

review.title: Excellent hotel for a family of five
review.reviewText:
We chose this hotel mainly based on the experience with Embassy Suites, specifically the one at Chevy Chase MD. As a five person party (2/3 kids), we fit perfectly in one room. Also, we chose this hotel because of the price, it was the most economical in all San Francisco Bay area, using Expedia and other research materials.

Close to the SFO airport (and car rentals), free breakfast for all the party and free internet at the Business Center, also add to the equation.

Far from the city, must rent a car. That is the best and easiest way. Only a 20-minute drive (without traffic, avoiding traffic rush hour).

But the best was Room Service. We ordered 4 out of 6 nights that we stayed. It was good and the kids can enjoyed while watching TV and resting after a long day touring the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Room service. We stayed six nights and we ordered room service on 4 nights because we found the price reasonable and the quality was very good.
review.negativeRemarks: We were under the impression that there was a Shuttle to the city on weekends based on one of the travel guide books (Fodors). There was none.
review.locationRemarks: Far from the city, close to the airport, close to the mall, and in the middle of places we wanted to go. We travel to SFO, Marin County and Monterey.

review.title: Free stuff while feeling rich!
review.reviewText: We always try to find an Embassy, free happy hour, yes, drinks too and free full breakfast and free airport shuttle and park and fly too all the time feeling like you are rich and living in style

review.title: Great stay and awesome breakfast!
review.reviewText: We stayed here to be close to the airport before flying home the next morning. We had a one bedroom suite which was very spacious and nice. The complimentary breakfast was one of the best ever! It more than made up for the parking fee. The staff at the front desk were very courteous and helpful. Thye only negative was that the sofa bed was not very comfortable for the teenager.
review.positiveRemarks: Complimentary breakfast was the best ever!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee and uncomfortable sofa bed.
review.locationRemarks: Super location close to airport, and nice walking path along the bay.

review.title: Great family stopover.
review.reviewText: We were three adults and a 9 and 6 year old and were very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was amazing. Breakfast was wonderful.
review.negativeRemarks: We stayed two nights, beginning and end of trip to eastern SF suburbs and were not there long enough to have any problems.
review.locationRemarks: Great - close to SFO which is exactly what we were looking for.

review.title: Not Recommended
review.reviewText:
To be honest our family hotel experience was poor. The first issue was not enough staff for the amount of guests staying in the hotel. Breakfast was good overall however the wait was upwards of 30-45 minutes and several times they were out of food before breakfast time was over. We never had enough towels (although we requested several times to have more) one day we had to go to the front desk to retrieve our towel because there were none in our room. The noise in the Hotel was ridiculous. from 6am to 3am you could here people running through the halls, doors slamming, and general noise coming from the main area. (we were on the 6th floor). The Bathroom was not well kept. The fan did not work and overall cleanliness was poor. 3 TV channels did not work until our last night in the hotel. And finally I know we were in the San Francisco area (actually Burlingame) but having to pay $18 per night for parking is a bit much especially when the parking lot was empty quite often. This hotel did not understand "it's all in the Details"

This is my first hotel review and in my opinion this is not a 4.2 star hotel and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of real cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: 20 minutes south of San Francisco right on the water.

review.title: Good for Airport overnites
review.reviewText: This hotel works well for flight layovers, and access to the S.F. airport. It worked for two couples, which we had for one of the nites. The overall condition of the hotel was in need of renovation, looking worn, and not maintained to the usual standards.
review.positiveRemarks: The buffet breakfast is always a hit here.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall condition
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport of S.F.

review.title: Great hotel and location.
review.reviewText: Room was clean and quiet despite the closeness to the airport. Great walking path along the bay to walk off those extra calories eaten while in San Francisco.

review.title: Highly recommend it!
review.reviewText: This is a first class hotel from the customer service, to the beautiful atrium, to the great breakfast. I just wish that I could have spent more time at the hotel before catching my shuttle to SFO. The only downside was they did not offer free Wi-Fi. For the price I was paying for the room and the overall service - it seemed a little cheap. But that is a minor point to the overall experience which was first class. Highly recommend it!
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful atrium with trees, a waterfall, pond and river with fish. A great place to eat an equally great cooked to order breakfast. Amazing!
review.negativeRemarks: Charging for Wi-Fi
review.locationRemarks: Great view of the bay and watching the aircraft land at SFO.

review.title: Great Experience!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. The staff was wonderful, and the free breakfast was great. Very quiet and comfortable!

review.title: Good breakfasts but quite a distance from downtown
review.reviewText: Didn't like the fact that we were 30 minutes from downtown San Francisco. It's a hassle to take the airport shuttle to the airport to pick up Bart, and it was quite expensive for our family of six ($49 each way). We ended up taking a taxi back and forth most of the time. The breakfasts were delicious and well stocked. Rooms were mostly quiet. Was surprised by the room design with bathroom only accessible to bedroom. Made it kind of awkward for those who slept in front room. We found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: distance from San Francisco, room design with bathroom only accessible to back bedroom

review.title: early departure in morning
review.reviewText: Beautifull atrium setting. Great location, close to airport but great bay views. In the evenings they have complimentary cocktails, wine, beer, and food (food consisted of chex mix and goldfish).

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: It was a fine hotel with a great number of amenaties that made for a comfortable stay.

review.title: Ideal location/value for overnight airport stay
review.reviewText: Excellent location only 5-10 mins drive in the free shuttle bus to/from SFO which runs every 20 mins from 4 am by the hotel. Good selection at breakfast buffet included in the price. If you arrive late and are hungry go to lee-anns red roof cafe which is only a couple of mins walk from the hotel which is open till late. Hotel decor quite dated but rooms spacious and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Free shuttle bus to and from the airport and free breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Quite dated
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for stopovers while you are travelling

review.title: Hotel experience
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Breakfast was very good. Air conditioning for the room we got could have worked better. We were on the 7th floor in May and it was going full blast and was still a little too warm.

review.title: Don't bother
review.reviewText: I could NOT sleep on the bed. I had to sleep on the hide a bed, which was lumpy but at least didn't give me a pounding headache. They also charge for WiFi and parking.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed and having to pay for parking!

review.title: wonderful
review.reviewText: wonderful experience. Staff was winderful. I would definitly stay again
review.positiveRemarks: Happy Hour and Breakfast and the staff
review.locationRemarks: in the perfect area. Close to everything but away from all the hustle and bustle

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: I was there with not only my family, but with a large choir group. We loved the all inclusive breakfast, and the amenities in the rooms. We had trouble with our family's room door keys having to be "fixed" on a daily basis, and I personally don't like having to use my door key to operate the elevator on weekends, but I understand the reasoning behind it.
review.negativeRemarks: Having to fix our door keys on a daily basis and having to use them to operate the elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Great Location - great view.

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: HHad a great stay....my only complaint is having the fitness center next to the pool. it is way too hot with no cool air or even a fan. great otherwise !

review.title: Noisy party spolied stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but stay was spoiled by a noisy birthday party/disco below our room. Music finished at midnight but the noise of drunken people continued for much longer.
review.negativeRemarks: Paying extra for parking and internet

review.title: Spacious Resort
review.reviewText:
Embassy Suites Hotel is overlooking the San Francisco Bay on the South, within the city of Burlingame. It is about 45 minutes from downtown San Francisco and 5 minutes to the San Francisco International Airport.

The interior of the hotel is designed like a summer resort. There is an indoor pool and the inside area has small pools with Japanese fish. Breakfast is buffet style and the make-to-order omelets are delicious.

If you arrive late, I advise Leanne's, just across the road (you can walk there). It is an unpretentious restaurant which is open 24x7 and has burgers and the like.

The hotel is obviously targeting business visitors with its many meeting rooms.

The rooms are quite spacious and have separate sitting areas with a desk and separate TV, so ideal for business stays. The only negative point I had was that they charge $13.95 for wireless Internet per 24 hours, and that is for each device. I think this is pretty outrageous in this day and age and also at a location like San Francisco so close to Silicon Valley.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms are quite spacious. Breakfast is superb (but ends at 9, so clearly designed for business visitors in mind)
review.negativeRemarks: Internet charged at 13.95 per day for each device separately.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the SFO International airport close to I-101, 45 minutes to downtown San Francisco

review.title: Pleasantly surprised.
review.reviewText: Pleasantly surprised at the spaciousness of the rooms. Breakfast buffet was impressive in its variety and offering. Great location for early or late airport departures. Would have liked to have been able to walk the path along the bay...seemed pleasant and scenic...unfortunately we stayed only a few hours because we arrived on a very late flight.
review.locationRemarks: Great for early or late air departures.

review.title: Nice place - Beware the elevators
review.reviewText:
Very nice facility, good breakfast, nice view of the planes landing over the bay.

One nit: elevator was broken, staff told us to wait for it, but we could see it was stuck on the first floor. We waited 10 minutes and then carried luggage down flights of stairs. Several families were doing this in a row, they should have sent up someone to carry luggage and fixed the elevator.

review.title: Great hotel, good value.
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel!! the rooms are all built around a central nine story atrium with large trees waterfalls and streams full of colorful fish. A wonderful buffet breakfast including made to order omlets is included in the price of the hotel. The rooms are very clean and the beds very comfortable. On the down side the heating and cooling are centrally controled so if you would like your room cooler on a night when they are heating the only option you have is to turn the fan off and heat less. Internet is a little pricy at $13.95 per day considering that many hotels now provide it for free. Parking is $17.00 per day which is way cheaper than the $50+ they charge downtown. Getting downtown from this hotel is easy as taking a free shuttle to the airport and then hopping on the bart train which cost about $8.00 per person each way. Still cheaper and less hassle than driving in and paying for parking . This hotel offers great value for the price and i would not hesitate to recommend it .
review.positiveRemarks: The central atrium and buffet breakfast are no doubt the main attraction of this hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Centrally controlled heating and cooling make it impossible to customize your room temp.
review.locationRemarks: Although the location is a little ways from the downtown core transportation is as easy as taking a shuttle to the airtport and then a train ride.

review.title: Elevator Door Problem
review.reviewText: Hotel shown its aged. One of the elevator door closes very fast . It close on my arm before I could get in the door. I told the front desk about it . I hope they get it fix. Someone will get hurt.

review.title: Embassy stay
review.reviewText: Very helpful and friendly staff. The shuttle was most convenient

review.title: San Francisco Trip
review.reviewText: Had to wait over an hour to get our room. I complaint to the Asst Supervisor to get assigned a room. The furniture in the room had seen better days. Everything else was ok.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel had a very large parking lot and they charge the guests to park there.
review.locationRemarks: Too far removed from everything

review.title: A great find
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our suite. The bedroom has it's own door so My husband could work while I slept in. There is a charge for internet per device. Too steep with the amount of gadgets people carry around these days. I rated upkeep a 3 because our toilet water kept running. We did request repair, but did not receive it. My husband did a temperary adjustment. Our sink also had a slow drain. The hotel is aging. But nothig that would keep us away in the future. The atrium is wonderful. Trees, bridges, waterfalls, fish ponds, with seating scattered throughout. Lovely. Cook to order breakfast is served there each day. I think every food option was offered. Mmm. There was even a family movie there on Sat. night. Our kids are out on their own now. But we thought of how great this place would be for families. We were on the top floor. At times when activities were offered, the top 3 floors were only accessable with a room key. At no time did we feel it was noisy. Not even with the plane traffic so close by. You will want to rent a car if you plan on going anywhere other than the airport. There is nothing much around except for other hotels. The paths around the area encourage an afternoon stroll by the water though. We will be back when in San Francisco again.

review.title: Reasonable room price, expensive parking
review.reviewText: Huge rooms were great. Free breakfast was very good, much more than a continental breakfast. However, $17 a night for parking is ridiculous. I should have just parked out on the street. In that area, space is NOT at a premium. And that they charge for WiFi was unexpected, and just added to that final bill. The food at the restaurant was so-so, and the drinks at the bar were expensive, $11.50 for a mixed drink. If I were to return, I'd stay away from the bar and restaurant, park on the street, and tell my son to go cold turkey on the Internet. Otherwise, great room, great location and a reasonable price.

review.title: Horible room
review.reviewText: I went here for a pharmacy meeting and the room they put me in was 923-top floor. I thought it would be a good view but the noise from the roof was so loud that the floor was vibrating. We got them to switch rooms but heard them put the next guest in the dreadful room. They also require 14$ a day for internet, 17$ a day for parking and 12$ for a pot of coffee in your room. All these come complimentary even at the cheepest hotel. Not worth the cost at this place for sure.

review.title: Perfect airport hotel
review.reviewText: Great place to stay, though more $$$ than some others in the area, rooms are suites with separate living room, wonderfully comfortable beds in the bedroom. Pleasant evening drinks at the lobby bar, great hot breakfast (complementary) and reliable airport shuttle. It was perfect for our needs.

review.title: Embassy Experience
review.reviewText: We all enjoyed our stay. The kids liked the indoor swimming. i enoyed the complimentry evening and breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee!
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect.

review.title: Not again, not recomended
review.reviewText: We checked in late 9:30. Plan was late. Person at check in desk was putout. We received no help and he barely answered our questions. The resturant was closed. We did receive good service at the bar and could order food. Bathroom door faced the beds and everytime the door opened the other person got flashed lights in the face. We were traveling the next morning to Frankfurt, Germany and needed some sleep which was almost impossiable with very bad insolation from the outside noise, planes landing and taking off the whole night.
review.negativeRemarks: position of bathroom

review.title: Sanfo Vacation
review.reviewText: Awesome view! Great breakfast!!! My kids love the indoor pool.
review.locationRemarks: good accessibility

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
Everything was great cleaniliness service, upkeep of hotel but the comfort of the room was that there was not heating until 11:00pm. So if you wanted to put on the heater you had to wait until 11:00pm. When it was around 11:45pm i turned on the thermostat and there was no heat it was still cold, but there was one good thing i called the front desk and they sent up blankets and a portable heater. which after that we were nice and warm.

The breakfast buffet is great.
review.positiveRemarks: the breakfast buffet and friendlines of staff
review.negativeRemarks: heating
review.locationRemarks: Great view, room nice and clearn, has washer and dryer,

review.title: Nice hotel to stay in; too much for parking/wifi
review.reviewText: The hotel was decent overall. The rooms were clean, the lobby was nice and the breakfast was very good. My biggest complaint was that the sofa bed was very worn out and almost unusable. We had rented two rooms and both rooms had the same issue. We also had to pay $17 per day for parking and another $14 for wifi access. It just seems that the hotel is trying to nickel and dime for extra money.
review.negativeRemarks: Extra fee for parking and wifi

review.title: 49ers/Steelers Game---49ers fan
review.reviewText: Great hotel! The Embassy Suites never fails to impress.

review.title: Good for reaching SF and San Jose
review.reviewText: Pleasant and very convenient for business if going between SF and San Jose. Has a pool and gym, good breakfast selection. Nice park by the bay right outside.

review.title: san Fran get away
review.reviewText: had a wonderful time in San Fran. This hotel worked out perfect for our family of four. Two rooms, two TVS. Great breakfast and close to everywhere we needed to go! Bed could have been a little softer but not bad.

review.title: Has some good points....
review.reviewText:
The center of the hotel is really unique and very well done. It is covered in foliage and gives you the feeling of being outdoors in a resort. I enjoyed the free cocktails in the afternoon and the atmosphere was definitely something to remember.

I also thought the free shuttle to the SF airport was extremely convenient. The hotel will allow you to keep your car there for a reasonable daily fee, taking the free shuttle to and from the airport. This was a very big benefit and one reason why I would return.

I didn't like the fact that I was stuck with a smoking room that had a very thick smell of smoke. The hotel was full which prevented them from moving me and my kids. The furniture was very old but the beds were comfortable. The bedroom had a sliding door that allowed for ventilation and had a great view of the bay.

review.title: Would not return to this hotel
review.reviewText: Would not come back to this hotel. Very dirty, can't sleep due to airplane noise. Bed sheets are dirty.

review.title: We're very impressed...
review.reviewText: I am very satisfied and can't wait to go back, nice people and I love the hotel location...

review.title: NWM 2011
review.reviewText: Offered wondereful amenities aqnd views. However, it is challenging to commute into the city.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown San Francisco and Fisherman's warf.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: This hotel is not bad, just not what it is advertised. We were spending our last night in California near the airport because of an early flight. We selected this hotel because it advertised a heavy snack evening event. Since there are no restaurants around the hotel, we had counted on this for an evening meal. The snacks turned out to be a big bowl of pretzels and a big bowl of potato chips. When we tried to go to the hotel restaurant or lounge, both were not available because the hotel had scheduled events. We then tried to go to their small store to purchase some snacks and it was closed. To be fair the restaurant offered to set us up a table in the courtyard, but it was too busy for us as the hotel had events scheduled there also.

review.title: Poor service
review.reviewText: I am a frequent traveler who had a gauranteed/confirmed non-smoking king bed reservation and when I arrive I was given the choice of a smoking room that had been de-smoked(?) or a handcap room with shower that did not reach my shoulder. The manager blamed expedia for booking a smoking room but when I showed her the printed reservation from expedia was for a non-smoking room she still refused to make any other rooms available. It was too late to go anywhere else but needless to say, with that kind of service and management, I will not be going back. Expedia was very responsive and made up for this poor hotel experience.

review.title: I stay here 4to 8 times a year
review.reviewText:
Everything about the hotel is great. Location is perfect, View and scenery is awesome, room kept clean, courteous and professional staff always, and delicious breakfast every morning. I travel for various conferences and seminars four to eight times a year. Although the meetings are other hotels, I seek out Embassy Suites and when in the Bay Area, this is the hotel I stay at each time.
I love everything about this hotel.

review.title: would revisit this hotel
review.reviewText:
flight arrived early,so we made early to the hotel. front desk check us to our room early that was a bouns for us . cassandra front desk clerk so helpful with information and very friendly. the buffet breakfast was awesome ,great starter to the day. overall would revist this hotel again.
free shuttle to and from airport bouns,catch the bart train from airport to go to fishermans wharf and pier 39.

review.title: wow
review.reviewText: Our trip to this Embassy Suits did not start out well. Upon arrive we were told our room was not available but another room was. Unfortunately it was a smoking room and had one less bed than what we had reserved. This was not acceptable to me!! The manager asked if it would be OK to be put up in the hotel down the street for the evening. We accepted and were put up in connecting rooms in another hotel. The following day we moved into our room at The Embassy Suits to find gifts and thank you note for our understanding from the the manager and staff for the inconvenience of the previous day. This is a beautiful hotel with great views of the bay. The made to order breakfast was great and the shuttle proved to be most convenient on a trip into the city. While the trip did not start as we had hoped, I would certainly return to this hotel.

review.title: Will visit again.
review.reviewText:
Embassy Suites San Francisco Airport - Burlingame

Fantastic service, very happy to have breakfast included each morning, would recommend to anyone spending time in the Bay area.

review.title: EXCITING BY THE OCEAN AND THE AIRPORT
review.reviewText: We were completely satisified and everything was beautiful and wonderful. This hotel is outstanding as so is the staff. We are happy and glad that we chose this hotel.

review.title: Service was aweful!!!!!
review.reviewText: the place was nice and i would give that 1-star. The service was poor and I was not happy about it. I live in the city and I booked a suite for my son's 1st birthday and had invited a couple of people for swimming. Went to the pool area and we were told we need to have a wristband to get in. then guest arrived and i was told that i had signed for a party of 4 which is us and that should only be the only people allowed in the room which i give -2 pts, then i was told to get rid of my guest in 10mins another -2pts or leave the premices. I didnt get a 2room suite for me, my husband, daughter and toddler for just us..i rented 2room suite so i can have some guest over. all around points minus 4star.. Management/service was not as i expected to be.. ....... I will never go back to this place. Left same day i booked the place and went some place else that is more lenient and had a better pool and service with a better review.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText:
We hadn't been to this hotel in several years. The visit was wonderful.
The location of the hotel is fantastic...right on the Bay. The walking trail
along the Bay is perfect and we took advantage of it both days we were there.
The breakfast buffet and manager's reception are a wonderful touch. The
suite was clean and nicely furnished, though the "living room" area was a bit
dark. Our room had a wonderful view and excellent location. Thank you!

review.title: One night stay
review.reviewText: The pool was over crowded and too many kids were unsupervised. Room service was quick and the food was tasty. We were told that there was a restaurant in the hotel so my husband and I planned on having a late dinner there just us. But the staff didn’t inform us that the restaurant becomes a sort of club late at night. So our plans failed. The room was clean and the view was nice. Overall my family and I had a nice time at the hotel.

review.title: Beautiful, but loud!
review.reviewText: It's a beautiful place, but loud! You can hear the sounds of the nearby airport all night long. Plus, there was some drunk idiots at the bar fighting for a while. Then, there was all the crazy kids in the pool having a good time at nearly midnight! If you have a morning flight out of SFO, forget getting breakfast at the hotel. They don't serve breakfast til after 7am (when all the travelers heading out for morning flights are gone.) The shuttle to SFO was a pain as well. The seats are worse than flying coach and they pack them full!!! It was not pleasant! I didn't care for the snotty clerks at the front desk either. It wasn't worth the price. There are so many nicer choices in SF!

review.title: Great hotel but horrible heating and a/c problems
review.reviewText: great room, great room service and food in the hotel, nice breakfast and nice pool area, but overwhelmed with heat at night. called the manager and never got a return call. called the front desk in the middle of the night about the extreme heat and was told i could change rooms or wait for someone to come in the morning. i didn't want to change rooms while in pajamas at 3am so i stayed. in the morning, no one came, so i called again. finally an a/c tech came and said the entire hotel went to 72 degrees at night no matter what, and i could have a fan. this did not help. it turns out that another guest in another room had 64 degree a/c on and couldn't turn it off, so it seems this information was inaccurate. i will be there for a week again in september and won't be staying due to the uncomfortable sleep conditions.

review.title: Amazing Value/Great Service
review.reviewText: Please see above. Azazing value, great staff, large room, extremely satisfied customer.

review.title: Wish to go back
review.reviewText: Hotel is beautiful. Location is perfect. Althouht it is a bit out of city, it is possible to take a shuttle to airport and then BART to downtown. Breakfast was very good. Crew was very friendly.

review.title: Overall great experience.
review.reviewText: The only faults I found with this hotel are: the sleeper-sofas need replacing. They are very uncomfortable to sit on due to cushions sagging in the front and the frame cuts into one's thighs. It was apparent the item was long past the stage where it could be cleaned and remove spots and stains. An otherwise upscale hotel should not allow such a central item to fall below the level achieved in the rest of the room's furnishings. Also, the way the hotel is built--around a central atrium--lends itself to kids and teens racing around the perimeter of the walkways at all hours of the day and night. This is, of course, a parental guidance issue, but it also should be obvious to security personnel on any of the 9 levels of this hotel.

review.title: dated dirty hotel
review.reviewText: This is the worst hotel that I have ever stayed. I typically pick hotels are 3 stars or above to ensure the quality of hotels. However, this one really disappointed me because it is old and dated. Stains on carpets and furniture, can see them in every rooms. I had to request to change rooms (twice) because the carpet did not get vacuuming and the sofa bed wasn't cleaned and still had garbage inside (such as a lighter, crumbs, and dirty sheets). In my point of view, it does not meet the quality of its brand as Embassy Suite. The front desk even said to me" WHAT DID YOU EXPECT FOR A HOTEL IS OVER 20 SOME YEARS OLD?" Hey, hotels have to do update and keep normal maintenance as a standard. I don't mind the furniture is old but they need to be clean. If the carpet did not get vacuuming, it is the management's issue, not because of the age of the hotel. There are many hotels in SF area, and I will never go back to this, especially its price was relatively high due to its brand.

review.title: Hotel and locale was good, breakfast was a bust
review.reviewText: Accommodations were clean and as advertised. Facilities were the same. The hot breakfast line was swamped -- we saw lines of over 30 people at one point (about 20 minute wait for an omelet). Cold breakfast was decent. Locale was convenient to SFO with free shuttle.

review.title: Best place to stay, park, and fly.
review.reviewText: The money I saved in flying out of San Francisco instead of Sacramento and leaving my car at Embassy Suites instead of paying for parking, more than paid for my one night stay in the hotel. Free evening snacks and drinks along with the full free breakfast makes this nice hotel a great bargain.

review.title: Good choice for family
review.reviewText: Great indoor pool for kids. We also enjoy the breakfast buffet despite the crowds. Always good service. Definitely one of the better choices among the airport hotels.

review.title: I Will Stay There Again
review.reviewText: The hotel was excellent......

review.title: No Thank You!
review.reviewText: Everything was great until we got into the room. It was dirty, the trash in the bathroom had not been removed, leaving gross used items on the floor! We complained, they came up and cleaned the bathroom, but the next morning when I told the person on duty about my experience, he were rude and very non apologetic. NO THANKS, not staying there ever again!

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: Suites are great for traveling with an adult child - everyone can have their own space. Loved the bay view. Price was good for a suite. Morning breakfast & evening reception were great. Only complaint was having to pay for in-room internet access.

review.title: I'll be back!!
review.reviewText: The room was clean and very comfortable. We really enjoyed having a sitting room off the bedroom. The staff is very helpful. The free breakfast was convenient. Was a great value for your money.

review.title: Our Great San Francisco Holiday
review.reviewText: Jeannine our check in representative was very gracious and efficient. She greeted us warmly and got us set up in our suite with ease. The hotel had a good overall feel. Our suite was clean and comfortable. Our breakfast buffet was well made and tasty. The airport shuttle made our travel to and from the hotel simple. All of the staff we came in contact with offered us their best. I was pleased with all of the services. We had a great time.

review.title: Loved our stay here!!
review.reviewText: My husband and I just stayed here and everything was amazing. The staff was very helpful, lobby and rooms are beautiful. The bed in our room was the most comfortable bed that I have ever found in a hotel. My only complaint about the room would be that the slidding glass door was hard to open. The FREE breakfast was way better then I expected and no line at all. Although we did not bring our kids this trip we feel that this hotel would also be perfect for a family and are already planning our next trip with the kids. Cant wait to go back!!

review.title: Lots of room...lots of extras
review.reviewText: Hadn't stayed at this Embassy Suites for a while. I was pleased with upgrades to the furniture in the room. Very comfortable and lots of room to move around. Atrium is very attractive and breakfast - custom omelets - was wonderful. It was very close to a function we were attending. Parking was a challenge. There was a huge wedding celebration in the ballroom and I had to go to the back of the hotel to finally find a spot. Great value for the money though!

review.title: Would stay there again with no hesitation.
review.reviewText: Great price and great hotel.

review.title: Great value, safe neighborhood, beautiful surroundings. Will stay again if going to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Great hotel. Our room has partial view of the lagoon, which is very beautiful. It was sunny and warm when we arrived, so we walked on the trail beside the lagoon, really enjoyed it.

Room is big and clean, both the double-beds are very comfortable, so are the pillows. Bathroom is spacious, with enough counter spaces.
Consider the proximity to the airport, surprisingly we didn't hear any airplane noises. But we do hear railway noises (not sure late at night or early in the morning since I didn't check the time), I believe it is from Caltrain.

Hotel needs touch up work on those wood panels especially the wooden frame of the elevator. It is not run-down, they just need to make the appearance inline with the hotel brand.

Complimentary breakfast is great, lots of varieties.
When we checked-in, we were given incorrect breakfast service ending time. The first morning when we came to the breakfast area, service staffs told us that breakfast just ended. But they were very helpful, since there were some food from the cook-to-order counter, they asked us if we would like them, of course, we took them. It was very nice of the staffs working in the breakfast service area and they worked hard to clean-up tables for the next guests. Thank you!

Will definitely stay in this hotel when visit SF again, hopefully in the very near future!

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: The breakfast was off the hook.

review.title: Don't stay in this room
review.reviewText: Make sure not to accept the rooms next to the stairs

review.title: Nothing to write home about.
review.reviewText: The room was dated and smelled like a locker room sprayed with fabric softner. The hallways were dark and not inviting. My son's sofa bed sheets had not been changed from the previous guest... he noted this after finding hairs. Overall a somewhat gross experience. The breckfast was very good.

review.title: Love It
review.reviewText: I always look forward to staying at this Embassy Suites. I enjoy the nicely furnished spacious suites, the beautiful atrium with koi ponds, the cooked-to-order breakfasts. Staff is friendly and helpful.

review.title: A quiet hotel near San Fancisco airport.
review.reviewText: Far enough away from the airport and freeway to be quiet but close enough to the airport to get there quickly.

review.title: Great place to day for a big family
review.reviewText: If you have a family that does not fit anymore to a standard 2 Queen bedroom configuration it's a great hotel to say - 2 isolated spacios rooms for a resonable price.

review.title: Not close to any attractions. Take Bart from the airport.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Personal were very helpful. Breakfast in the morning was awesome (get there early). If you want a hotel away from the confusion of SF this is the place (if you don't mind the sound of airplanes landing). Now, you can catch a free ride from the hotel back to the airport and take Bart into the city. Do all you want till about 10:30pm then take Bart back to the airport, catch the last shuttle back to the hotel by 12:00 and avoid renting a car. Then rent a car and go back to the places for a longer visit on the last day of your stay. Beware the hotel will charge 25.00 to park over night. Hotel rooms are a little dated but clean. Again, not much to do around the hotel, took us about 10 min. to walk the grounds. Tip the ladies at breakfast they do a great job! Oh, Tower tours will pick you up from the hotel....no charge for that tip.

review.title: Best of the airport hotels.
review.reviewText: Overall great value and experience. Pool clean and well-kept, room spacious and clean, managers reception was good. Breakfast was good but started a little late for us (we took a 7:11 am shuttle bus and breakfast started at 7:00 am).

review.title: "Very nice hotel, great breakfast! "
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, great breakfast!

review.title: Great service, beautiful room with great bay view and a wonderful happy hour.
review.reviewText: We had a great Bay view room and really enjoyed the atrium, manager happy hour and free shuttle into town. It truly was a great pick and we would stay there again happily. San Francisco was great !

review.title: Try the Other Embassy Suites by the Airport
review.reviewText: We picked the hotel due to its proximity to the airport and the free shuttle. We were 3 friends leaving on different flights early the following morning. We inquired about what time the shuttle started and were told. "The information and schedule are at the end of the counter." Upon review of this information we discovered that you needed to request the shuttle for early morning pick-up (prior to 4:30am). We were then told we needed to "call" and request it despite standing at the desk. We also inquired about where to catch the shuttle back as we wanted to return our car that night and take the shuttle back to save time in the morning. We were told, "exit the airport, go to the curtesy shuttle lane and look for the Embassy Suites shuttle." We did this only to discover that there are 2 Embassy Suites with airport shuttles and we ended up at the wrong Embassy Suites (which seemed much nicer and had very helpful front desk personnel). The front desk called our hotel and asked if they woul pay for our cab back to the correct hotel. Although they paid the cab fare, they did not provide the driver a tip, so we paid that out of our pockets. Additionally the computers in the business center were down and our hotel room had horrible cell reception (for muliple carriers). When we asked for a reccommendation for a local shopping mall, we were told, "I don't know" by the unfriendly front desk personnel. Thankfully another nice guest was able to point us in the correct direction.

review.title: would not stay their again.......
review.reviewText: did not enjoy our stay. will not go back. expected more from an Embassy Suite.

review.title: NIce but not great.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was nice. I love the interior. Very peaceful with the inner atrium. The room was as I remember from previous stays although a bit older and worn.
The breakfast wasn't worth the extra 10 dollars. It was great for a hotel breakfast but I could have gotten the same thing at Dennys for 5.99 and I would have been waited on...the line was long and full of kids being kids(noisy)
Overall it was a nice visit at a decent price and I would stay there again(Clean and comfortable)
On a side note the fold out bed was horrible. 2 support bars in your back all night. This didn't ruin the trip as I didn't have to sleep on it.

review.title: Hotel great, San Francisco too stressful.
review.reviewText: The hotel was eveything I had hoped for, beautiful location close to everything we had planned. The staff (everyone from maid to recepetion) were courteous and friendly. Little glitches we ran into were taken care of within a reasonable amount of time.The morning breakfast offered such a variety that I never had to eat lunch. Although I didn't get a chance to use the pool, it looked very inviting. The exercise room offered a number of different machines and free weights. I'm an at home exerciser and not familier with all the machines. It would be nice to have someone available to show how they work. I did enjoy the walking path along the lagoon. We were in California for a funneral and our stay at the Embassy Suites was relaxing and comforting. San Francisco, on the other hand was too stressful. I'm not sure I would revisit the city again but I would definitely recommend Embassy Suited as a place to stay.

review.title: Good airport access
review.reviewText:
Love the atrium environment and the full breakfast in the morning, plus cocktails in the pm.

The hotel was generally quite clean. However, they need to check the details in cleaning the rooms: the sheets were stiff and bunched up when one rolled over. Higher quality sheets needed. The cleaning staff would do well to sit on the toilet seat and get a birds-eye view of the gross splatters on the bathroom doors and walls...a definite negative.

Overall, would stay there again.

review.title: Nice Hotel and great breakfast
review.reviewText: The Hotel is very pleasant, with a beautiful inside patio. The breakfast was excellent!

review.title: ca trip
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and the free breakfast was awesome very nice clean place would stay there again

review.title: Hotel has seen better days
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel in the early 90's and it was very nice then. But it is showing the wear and tears of time. My guest room had areas of carpeting very worn. The public areas need updating. The breakfast in the morning had such a long line. It is a nice location to get to and from different areas, but for the price, I will look for something different next time.

review.title: Great lobby, phenomenal breakfast, and convenient location, overall very solid hotel for price
review.reviewText:
I was surprised at how beautifully the main hotel lobby had been constructed. There was dense foliage with a very pretty walkway overlooking ponds with fish. It was also the site for breakfast, which included made to order omelettes, french toast (only served on the first day), pancakes, eggs, potatoes, and also an array of continental breakfast offerings including oatmeal and cereal.

We were on the 7th floor with a great view of the whole hotel. The room itself was relatively standard, but adequate and with well-thought out amenities. Very appropriate for the price I paid.

The pool had really warm water and the work out room, though small, was nice and adequate and attached to the pool area.

The hotel was right next to the hotel, within 5 minutes driving time, and had a free shuttle. Unfortunately, the day one of my family members left for the airport the shuttle was very behind and there was a situation where the driver was refusing to take passengers. It was unfortunate and caused some panic among our family members, and may have caused others to miss flights. Would recommend caution for anyone relying on the shuttle to go to the airport.

Overall, a very convenient and well-priced hotel w/ a great view of the bay and a beautiful lobby with a full service breakfast. Would definitely go back again.

review.title: needs some repairs, but comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: took a while to get service, however the front desk was very helpful

review.title: Embassy Suites Burlingame "Very Pleased"
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here for our 19th wedding annivesary Jan 16th. after a 4 hour delay from LAX we arrived at the hotel the pictures really did not do the hotel justice it was really more than we expected very nice and pleasant the hotel staff were so helpful,,Ms Vivian gets A star although it was rainy that weekend the hotel has a very good restaurant and the breakfast was also fabulous..if you have a opportunity to sightsee ask for Roy the cab in front of the hotel gave us a really good tour

review.title: Embassy Suites are always awesome
review.reviewText: Embassy Suites in conjunction with Expedia are extremely complimentary. Have booked several weekend trips with them and will continue!

review.title: A very pleasant stay at Embassy Suites
review.reviewText: My daughter and I stayed the night at Embassy Suites because she had an early flight from San Francisco Airport. We had a very pleasant stay and a wonderful, although somewhat expensive meal in the hotel restaurant. I had an excellent, free breakfast in the hotel that morning. I'll be staying at this same hotel again this coming weekend. Nice location by the water!

review.title: SFO Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. It was dissapointing that WiFi was not free and Disney channel was not free. We were traveling with a 5 year old and both of those items would have helped our stay be more enjoyable. The Food was good and nice to have.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel was even nicer than I expected. The room was very large and we were able to fit 2 adults and 4 children in comfort with no problems. The 2 TV's made it easy to keep the kids content for the time we spent in the room. The indoor pool was a big hit as well. The walking/jogging path that runs along the bay was great and the bay view was beautiful.
The area surrounding the hotel is tranquil and safe, but it is mostly commercial. The drive in to San Francisco only took about 15 minutes.

review.title: "CANT WAIT TO GO BACK"
review.reviewText: The rooms,food,service,staff was just great

review.title: Christmas Trip
review.reviewText: Enjoyable Time

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: Everything was great. The breakfast was the best we ever had at any other hotel/motel. And we we able to invite our family living in the area to join us.

review.title: 49ers Game
review.reviewText: Excellent.

review.title: A little disappointed this time.....
review.reviewText: This was my second stay @ the Embassy & we continued to get lost everytime we returned to the hotel from an outting. There is no exit from the highway to take you anywhere near the hotel..............annoying! Our livingroom t.v. was disconnected so it was a while before the kids could watch it & our bathroom sink had a HUGE section of countertop missing. Not to mention when we called restaraunts & theatres, we were charged for the local calls! The complimentary breakfast buffet almost made up for the inconveniences. The outside ambiance is breathtaking as well as the lobby, courtyard & indoor waterfall.

review.title: not what we wanted
review.reviewText: we payed for two king bed bayview rooms and got one the room was atwin bed we accepted it as long it was a bayview already alittle upset we walk in the king bed room and they give us a twin bed room overlooking the rooftop not the bay so we finally get the room we wanted but it was a handicap room oh well.

review.title: Will never stay anywhere else
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel. Awesome made to order breakfast and managers reception. I was not expecting the atrium in the middle of the hotel. I will look for an Embassy Suites everytime I travel.

review.title: I would love to go back, and this hotel was a great stay,
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with the quality of this hotel. The rooms were very clean and in tip top shape. I enjoyed the comfort of the room, and I would love to go back. The location is very nice as well, right on the water.

review.title: Dirty & Smelly
review.reviewText: The hotel was dirty & smelled of cigarette smoke. The pull out bed was broken & lumpy. I've stayed in Embassy Suites on other occasions and my stay was enjoyable not this time.

review.title: A Noisy Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed over on a Friday. There was a loud party downstairs, until late. Also, a group of school kids kept us up until late. Security took care of them (Somebody else must have complained)Nice breakfast setting

review.title: Nice Family Hotel
review.reviewText: Room was spacious and comfortable. Pull out mattress lumpy but to be expected. Had some air conditioning issues but we could deal with it. Free cook to order breakfast was great...but go early or at least expect a line. Atrium area was beautiful but can get a little noisy. Speaking of noise, we were a little worried about the airplane noise being by the airport, it was never an issue. Pool nice and clean. Workout area looked good. Front desk very friendly and helpful. Overall, nice hotel to stay with a family.

review.title: Always enjoy an Embassy Suites. Good breakfast too!
review.reviewText: Very nice stay and very quiet room with a view of the water.

review.title: Would go back...
review.reviewText: With a family of four, this hotel met most of our expectations. The proximity to SF and airport is wonderful. The fact that there is a full complimentary breakfast makes staying there an easy choice. My only complaint is that housekeeping didn't do a great job cleaning the room prior to our first day. There was items left behind under sofa bed and they did not vacuum that area under sofa bed. All in all, it was a great place to stay.

review.title: Very Full for the Weekend
review.reviewText: The hotel was a near capacity for the time we were there. Despite the crowd the service was very good and the staff friendly and very capable.

review.title: Pleasant
review.reviewText: Overall very nice and easy access to the airport and interstate.

review.title: Good breakfast but not so good pool
review.reviewText: I have stayed at other Embassy Suites and this is not one of the better ones. The room was clean and comfortabel for the most part, but the sofa bed was in very poor conditions. A note to the hotel managers: Please understand the major reason I chose this hotel was because I was traveling with children and therefore needed the sofa bed. Also, the temperature control in the room did not work. (Yes, I know I could have called the front desk, but it was very late and we were just too tired!) The front desk staff was nice and friendly, but I am afraid I cannot say the same for the staff at the breakfast stations. The breakfast was good and convenient, though. Lastly, the pool and the zaccuzi were a disappointment. It smelled and the water did not look clean at all. I also had to go tell the front desk that there were no clean towels although there were plenty used towels scattered on the floor. Embassy Suites are usually good choices for families, which makes having a clean pool even more important.

review.title: Mix review.
review.reviewText: It has a great location and if you get a room with view to the airport is great. You get to watch the planes take off. We stayed twice that week the first time no view and it was above the ballroom and there was a wedding and it was hard to sleep. Second time we got the view to the lagoon (Beautiful). The breakfast was not as complete as other Embassy. That part was dissapointing. Service at the breakfast was excellent.

review.title: Very disappointed!!
review.reviewText: We booked a room for 3days. When we got there at about 1:00, they said there were no clean rooms at the time with a bay view which we requested. If we wanted a bay view we had to come back at about 2:30. When we returned and finally checked into our room, our view was a parking lot with very little bay view. The room was very dusty- tv, tables, head boards, etc. The bed stood on a pedestal. Around the pedestal were crumbs, candies, dirt, old vomit or spilled food- didn't want to examine. Everyday, room service did not replace some used towels with new ones. Rooms were not vacuumed everyday. Our room/rate included a full breakfast. That was good.

review.title: very convenient to airport
review.reviewText: This hotel is very convenient to the San Fran airport. The lobby/atrium is pretty grand with full size trees, cook to order breakfast too. The suite seems like it's seen better days. The couch is a sofa bed and NOT comfortable to sit on to watch television as the cushion sinks into the frame and your legs rest on the hard frame. Bathroom is adequate but small. My guess is that they get a huge volume of travelers who are there for one night only just preceding a flight out, that they don't have to replace furniture to keep longer term visitors happy.

review.title: Good hotel for the money
review.reviewText: Our stay was nice. If you are staying on a weekend, this is definitely suitable for families. Our first night was a Thursday, and the pool was not crowded. Friday and Saturday night, my count was between 27 & 32 kids...YIKES! Parking rates extremely reasonable, but this was a bit further from the city that we thought it would be (my fault). We love Embassy Suites and will always return to others, but probably not this one just because of the proximity to downtown.

review.title: Not very nice
review.reviewText: Rooms are big but the hotel is run down and dingy.

review.title: Too noisy!
review.reviewText: When we checked in I could hear the music from the bar. I specifically asked to be as far away as possible. Didn't work. We heard that trash until 2, and then people running up and down the halls for the next hour. For whatever reason, there were a million kids in the hotel. There must have been 50 of them in the pool so obviously we didn't partake. Again, kids running up and down the halls all night. I liek this hotel because of the size of the rooms and the sliding doors that open, but I can't say I slept well either night I was there.

review.title: Very nice place, but...
review.reviewText: When we woke up on Sunday morning, we went downstairs for the free breakfast. It would've been very nice except that the entire atrium and breakfast area was totally packed with teenagers, presumably from some kind of large group outing. I was not happy to be paying top dollar for a nice room at a nice hotel, only to have the place overrun with youngsters. The situation was the same the night before in the pool area. Luckily, I was at a wedding and not affected. Still, if I was just looking for a nice quiet place to relax, I would not have found it.

review.title: Can't wait to bring my husband.
review.reviewText: I will be bringing my husband to the Hotel. It was clean, had wonderful views. Great breakfast. Beautiful lobby. Can't wait to go back.

review.title: parking fee
review.reviewText: the hotel itself was wonderful. the continential breakfast was amazing, but when we found out that there was a $15.00 a day parking fee we were NOT impressed.

review.title: Wonderful Experience
review.reviewText: Great views of San Francisco.

review.title: Will stay there again!
review.reviewText: The ambiance, personnel, and food were fantastic! Brunch was out of this world.

review.title: Really Impressed
review.reviewText: The Embassy Suites in Burlingame is defintely a gem in the hotel industry. Conveniently located to SFO and major highways travel is a snap. The hotel itself is located on the bay and the views are wonderful. There is also a paved walk along the bay of the shore which we used for morning walks. The rooms are clean and comfortable, but we had trouble regulating the room temperature. The service is first class and if you choose to eat at the hotels restaurant, The Ring, it is comparatively priced to other upscale restaurants in the area. The free breakfast in the morning is well worth the wait and the manager's reception at night should be added to your "must attend" list. You can bet we will be staying here in our future trips to the San Francisco area.

review.title: Things have changed since we were last here!
review.reviewText: This was one of our favorit hotels to stay in while visiting SF. But things are not the same. Now they charge for parking, breakfast was less, not enough employee's to handle the load of people that showed up for breakfast. Room was never vacuumed the whole week we were there. Awful, not a happy visit this time.

review.title: Good accommodations
review.reviewText: The location was great - easy on and off Hwy. 101. The restaurant was superb - a little pricing especially for children, but excellent food. The hotel staff could spend a little more time on cleanliness. I noticed little garbage and debris on the floors throughout the common areas and the pool area was a mess. The towels were not stocked and the sauna didn't work. When I worked out early in the morning, the area was still a mess. Also there was a wedding reception that kept everyone up with pounding music until after 12:30 p.m. Front desk should forewarn customers if their room is near/over an event that will be loud.

review.title: Great hotel outside the bay area
review.reviewText: Just 10 minutes from Candlestick Park, we loved the atrium in the center of the hotel. Fabulous breakfast every day and Manager's meet and greet parties were great. The swimming pool is very small but just the right size for kids. The restaurant was fantastic and excellent service.

review.title: Will consider staying there again on SFO overnight stays
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, but no bell man or luggage carts where available when we checked in.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed from Friday-Monday, and was satisfied with the hotel. Breakfast was good, the rooms were clean and roomy. One negative, parking lot was a little small, they had extra parking across the street-not a big deal, but a little inconvenient at times. We were on the second floor, and there were functions within the hotel on Friday and Saturday nights, which were a little noisy (this is what contributed to the lack of parking).

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The way the hotel is designed makes it very noisy no matter what room you have (won't go back) went down for some drinks with clients at 11:00pm and the police are chasing guys threw the hotel wanted to leave that night...

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Offered nice relaxing breakfast with beautiful surroundings.

review.title: Awful.
review.reviewText: The 1st room smelled horrible - obviously had been a smoking room when we had requested a non-smoking room. Requested a 2nd room - 2nd room had 2 double beds when we had requested a king. Requested a 3rd room - got the kind bed but it was a handicapped room; the shower was horrible - water took forever to warm up, never got hot & temperature control was not working; water all over the floor. It was not good at all...

review.title: Great business hotel
review.reviewText: Useful room set up. Great complimentary breakfast and cocktail hour. Very pleasant and accommodating staff. Easy to use (and complimentary) business services.

review.title: Love to stay here!!
review.reviewText: It is like coming home. This was our second time to stay at this Embassy Suites. The facility is wonderful and the breakfast is delicious! I love taking a morning walk on the trial overlooking the beautiful Bay. There is even a pier to walk. The indoor atrium is absolutely is soothing. Don't miss the social time at the Managers evening event. My family can hardly wait to visit this area again. There is sooooo much to see and do.

review.title: GREAT Place to stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for one week, make sure you get a bay view room. The service by the hotel staff was excellant. The "Free" morning breakfast was a real plus, great selection and good food cooked to order. The eveing reception was very nice. The one negative...DON'T eat at the hotel restaurant for dinner. Terrible service and mediocre food. We found out that the hotel does not manage the restaurant. For a great meal close by go to Kincaid's 1/2 mile south on Airport Road....Great food and service. This hotel is a great place to stay to visit San Francisco and the bay area. Avoid the BART during rush hours, drive to SF and Fisherman's Wharf is easy after 9:30 in the AM. Make sure to take a day to go to Yosemite and another day to Peeble Beach and Carmel. We took the AMTAK out and flew back. Total 12 day trip a great vaction.

review.title: better than i thought
review.reviewText: my only complaint is the amount of facilities for breakfast at weekends.when the hotel is full there are not enough tables or staff available, apart from that the food, gym and pool, quietness of rooms, shuttle to BART etc was first class.yes i would use the hotel again.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: I just came to the embassy for my birthday because I used to live on the coast, anyway, I am pretty high maintenance when it comes to hotels and this one was perfect! The beds are extremely cozy, the views for the lagoon and bay are gorgeous! They have 32-inch flat screen HD Tv with an HDMI cable for good quality and its easy to set up the XBOX 360 with the cable if you bring one, like my boyfriend did. The free cooked to order breakfasts are EXCELLENT Omelets, bagels, waffles, pancakes...DEE-LISH! Book this one, it's worth it if your looking to cruise the bay.
review.userLocation: From the Bay Area, CA now in Sacto, CA

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I like this hotel a lot. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. The room is nice and clean.

review.title: Embassy Suites - Burlingame, CA
review.reviewText: Embassy Suites are always wonderful to stay out. The complementary breakfasts are wonderful. The only thing we didn't like at this particular Embassy Suites was that the rooms are very dark with dark furniture and accessories. Otherwise, our stay was great.

review.title: E Suites
review.reviewText: Distinctly average hotel - front desk staff not too competent. Room service food was awful. Fine for an overnight stay which this was before leaving SF.

review.title: Family Friendly
review.reviewText: Very convenient for a family of five! The two beds and the sofa bed, really works for us. Not to mention, the complementary made to order full breakfast, was ecxellent! Room service took longer than normal.

review.title: Embassy
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel and staff was really nice. They upgraded my room to lagoon view for no added charge...and the managers' reception and made to order breakfast are always a nice bonus. Free parking is great too.

review.title: A great location to relax after any time spent in downtown San francisco.
review.reviewText: I felt that I made a good choice staying here for the last few days of my holiday,to unwind and relax after all the hustle and bustle of the city.

review.title: Great value for money
review.reviewText: Very pleased with the hotel. Very large suites (ideal for families) with two separate sleeping areas (although only grumble would be that the sofa bed was not the most comfy). Great views over the Bay. Excellent breakfasts included in the price. Free drinks 5:30 - 7:00pm every day! No problem with parking (although they do charge $10 a day - perhaps that goes to pay for the free drinks?!). Very convenient for the City - only about 25 mins drive to the centre. Tried the food in the bar and the restaurant and had decent meals in both. Also swam in the pool. For the money, we were very impressed.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The bay view is worth the extra price. Great cooked to order breakfast. The atrium is very nice. It's not a relatively new hotel but it feels comfy. Will go back there whenever I am up in the bay area again. It's worth to stay in Burlingame and drive into San Francisco.

review.title: Loved this hotel
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. Very nice hotel and the atrium is gorgeous! The room was clean with a beautiful view of the bay. The service was great and the staff was very friendly and courteous. The kids loved the indoor pool and spa. Breakfast was delicious and had lots of variety.

review.title: Just okay
review.reviewText: none

review.title: Great bay view
review.reviewText: Excellent view of the bay, great location. Free breakfast can be crowded but well worth it with full kitchen staff serving cook to order items.

review.title: better than expected
review.reviewText: Wow, our daughter had a soccer tournament in SF. We were just looking for a nice place to rest. We were pleasantly suprised when we got to the hotel. I wished we had more time there. We will be back!!

review.title: I'll be back
review.reviewText: all i can say is that my stay at the Embassy Suits in Bulingame was great. The lady with the German accent at the counter was extremely helpful.

review.title: would stay there again
review.reviewText: great location. excellent breakfast. loved the atrium and being on the bay. the only complaint is the lack of pillows. we were not able to get more. there were 6 in the room for 5 people and some wanted more than one pillow. otherwise enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Great Spot
review.reviewText: Family of 5 stayed here on the final night of a week-long trip to SF and Sequoia National Park. The hotel was beautiful and our room was very nice with plenty of space. It was great. The only negative was that one of the 2 TVs in our room wasn't working. Otherwise, the room was great and the hotel served a very nice breakfast with lots of things to chose from. The managers reception was a really nice touch. Kids and adults both enjoyed the snacks and beverages in the 'garden' setting of the atrium after a swim.

review.title: Brilliant Hotel can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Very decent Hotel and in hindsight the best we stayed in on our trip to the USA. Get to breakfast early and then no queues, but with patience they don't last long and their breakfasts were worth it, excellent in quality and choice of food. The plants inside and out were brilliant and their lifts again were very good and fun to watch!

review.title: Great for families!
review.reviewText: This is our 3rd time in San Francisco and we always stay at this Embassy suites. We love the fact it's close to the airport and getting around, but away from the heavy traffic. The free breakfasts are great for families,also having the micro & fridge in your room,is great for keeping extra snacks and drinks. The girls also loved watching the fish in the mornings.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Excellent breakfast, Clean room, Shuttle to Airport, Nice atrium garden.

review.title: Could be a great hotel....
review.reviewText: We stayed 6 nights in Aug 08'. When we arrived I thought the grounds and lobby area were very nice. We went to our room. I found they did a terrible job at cleaning. I wondered if it was because I had called to see if we could check in a bit earlier, but that is no excuse. I'd rather they told me no then go into a room not cleaned well. My son was going to be sleeping on the sofabed. It looked like they didn't change the sheets, the nightstand next to our bed was dirty,looked like someone had drinks on it and left round dryed stains on it. I also found hair in the tub which really was bad. I called down to the front desk to tell them what I had found and they apologized and sent housekeeping right up to clean everything. They also told me I could switch rooms if I wanted to but we decided to stay as long as they took care of everything. I have to say that the remaining nights our room was cleaned very well. Everyone from the front desk to housekeeping were very nice. The grounds are beautiful as well as the lobby and breakfast areas. The breakfast was great. You will not find a better one anywhere. We did have the bay view which was very nice and fun to watch the planes flying in and out. We never really heard the planes when we were sleeping. Our bed was really confortable. Really all this hotel needs is alittle updating in the rooms and it would be perfect. If we were to go back to SF we would possibly stay here again.

review.title: Night club...
review.reviewText: Improve quality of music (DJ)... lots of business lost do to the music... and service...

review.title: Nice hotel near SFO
review.reviewText: Stayed here with the wife during our trip to San Francisco. Very nice property, nice location to SFO and easy to get to. The comped breakfast was much more than your average danish and coffee - plenty to choose from. The only complaint we had was when we went to use the pool / jacuz in the evening (after 10p when it's adults only) and there were kids jumping and diving into the pool. So much for a nice quiet soak before bedtime. Other than that, it was a nice place.

review.title: Would stay again.
review.reviewText: Our room was clean and comfortable. There were many choices for the included breakfast and the hotel atrium was a relaxing, beautiful place to eat. The mananger's reception in the early evenings, with complimentary drinks and munchies, was another plus. The service was excellent, with pleasant, helpful staff who were trained to make our stay enjoyable. We also used the free shuttle to the airport. We highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: The hotel is very comfortable, and the service is fine. The interior garden is lovely, as is the nearby walk along the bay.

review.title: Good for families
review.reviewText: Staff was nice, but wouldn't let us check in an hour early. Price was a little high for it's location. Breakfast area was really crowded, no clean bowls for 30 min. Everything else was good. Kids loved it.

review.title: Great location. Lots of extras. Free Breakfast, Mangers social. Love it.
review.reviewText: We stayed here with our children on a family vacation. The hotel was beautiful with very friendly staff. My kids loved the pool area. They had a great free cook to order breakfast daily and a nightly managers social. The atrium area has a beautiful tropical feeling with koi swimming in the stream. Would stay here again if in the area. We loved it!

review.title: Beautiful renovation
review.reviewText: Everything was wonderful. This is an older hotel (I used it in the 1980's). It has a magnificent, landscaped interior courtyard that has only gotten better with maturity. The rooms are totally renovated with pretty dark wood and granite surfaces. It is very clean, pretty and functional. Complementary breakfast was top notch with stations for made to order omelets and waffles. Other than having to pay for internet connection in my room, I was very impressed and pleased. Will definitely return again when I need to be near the airport.

review.title: Disappointed in Overall Hotel Condition and Housekeeping
review.reviewText: My family and I routinely stay at Embassy Suites on our vacations. This was by far the worst experience we've had with this name brand. Opportunities: When we arrived in our room the fans in both the suite area and bedroom were extremely loud. Also the bedspread and blankets were dirty. When they replaced the blanket they brought one with burn holes in it. They eventually repaired the loud noises from the fan by unpugging it.
