This happened after several phone calls and visits to the front desk. Housekeeping was terrible as they didn't change out the drinking glasses in our room during our entire 4 day stay. After day one we went to a local store and bought plastic cups. Housekeeping did not replenish the tiolet tissue. They didn't remove the trash that was left on the floor. We had to sit this outside the room each day. The refrigerators in the rooms need replacing as they are outdated and dirty. Strengths: The views are extraordinary and the location is great. We moved throughout the San Frncisco Bay area without any issues and the freeway both north and south is easy to access. Great shopping areas and restaurants within 10 minutes of the hotel to either the north or south. Flat screen TV's were a plus. The bartender from the Manager's reception should win an award for her personality. She was outstanding.

review.title: Good choice near SFO
review.reviewText: This is a great place to stay near SFO. The full breakfast was good, but there were not enough tables for all the guests to be seated on arrival at the breakfast area.

review.title: Convenient Hotel
review.reviewText: Overall, nice place to stay, it was convenient for us because we were visiting places north and south of San Francisco. The hotel offers a great breakfast buffet in the morning, but it could be a little more organized.

review.title: Too noisy
review.reviewText: Hotel accomodations were nice however, the hotel was extremely noisy. They had a noisy party going on with people that weren't even staying at the hotel which affected the guests of the hotel. We had to get up the next morning early and needed to rest early in the evening but could not because of the noise. I think the parties should be kept to a minumun if they are not guest paying for this service.

review.title: Love the view
review.reviewText: I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The Bay view was wonderful, the complimentary breakfast was hot and fresh. It was a great experience.

review.title: Wonderful hotel for families with a great breakfast!
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with this hotel. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. They offered complimentary cooked to order breakfast in the atrium. We will definitely stay here again when we return to the S.F. area.

review.title: Staff at this hotel is top rate
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel with our 4 month old baby for 4 nights. Crib was fantastic. First night we were on the 4th floor above the "disco" Friday and Saturday nights. It was loud for me, but baby slept fine. They were very kind and moved us to the 9th floor. (Hilton Honors member) and the rest of the stay was very peaceful. Will definitely stay at this and other embassy suites in the future!

review.title: would stay there again
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and large rooms. Loved the two flat screen TVs. Very quiet. Nice view of bay from lounge. Good food in lounge. Enjoyed the complimentary happy hour and wonderful breakfast buffet.

review.title: Great pool, sauna and hot tubs.
review.reviewText: Great made to order breakfast - omelets, pancakes, bacon, cereals, fruit, breads!

review.title: Great place for families
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay again! We have two young children so I prefer a hotel with a separate bedroom and living area. This had that and the hotel over all was very family friendly! The only two things were - I had requested two double beds but instead got a king and a pull-out and my husband complained that he heard the elevator all night so had a hard time sleeping (the night we slept on the pull-out). But I slept fine and thought the hotel was great! On top of it all our room had a beautiful view of the bay and we took a nice walk along the bay the first night...great place!

review.title: Embassy Suites in Burlingame is A OK
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable rooms with kitchenette and adequate work space made the stay both productive and relaxing. But the hotel's courtyard and full service breakfasts are top notch and would have been worth the stay alone. Add to all that a bay view suite and nice shoreline trails and I can safely say that we will be back.

review.title: Could have been better considering they seemed to have a manpower shortage
review.reviewText: Have been to the resturant of this hotel before and was very happy. This time we stayed in "a Logoon Suite" and at first was given the wrong room which was dirty and the refrigerator was broken plus the main telephone did not work. We finally got the room situation straightened away and were pleased with our room and service. The resturant "Rings" were short of help both times we ate there and I had to send my food back the 2nd time I would not recomend the resturant. Our room was fine

review.title: Great value - not so great guests
review.reviewText: We stayed during the weekend when the hotel uses weddings, sports parties, and other social gatherings to fill its rooms. Unfortunately, some of the guests can be on the loud side even into the wee hours of the morning. The rudeness of guests marred what was an otherwise nice stay.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel room itself was clean, bed was comfortable, suite was well set up for our family stay. However, noise from the atrium set up outside of all the hotel rooms was rather loud and carried even though we were 5 floors up.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: My stay at the Embassy Suites was wonderful for the whole family. We especially enjoyed the breakfast and the walk along the shore.

review.title: I'll be staying here the next time I travel to San Francisco....
review.reviewText: What a value. The free breakfast buffet was delicious and was served in an atrium that reminded me of the rainforest! The hotel is on the bay which gave it a peaceful and calming effect. The service was great. The only complaint I had is that someone was smoking in their room and I could smell the smoke in my room as well.

review.title: Impressively great for a reasonable price
review.reviewText: We experienced an impressively great service for such a reasonable price! The complimentary breakfast with an omelet station saved us a lot of money. They're obviously saving on towels, toilet paper, etc so you'd have to ask them for a replacement. They were very accommodating tho.

review.title: Love it....but not all the people.
review.reviewText: Any time we're in SF we stay here. Love the breakfast and happy hour. Will definitely return...just wish not so many people knew about it, it can be crowded at times.

review.title: Very NICE
review.reviewText: very beautiful, a generous hotel, it's greatly appreciaited- free parking, happy hour, breakfast

review.title: Stress Free
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a hotel that you can relax and not worry about searching for food this is the place for you. They not only have a fabulous cook to order breakfast but in our room were menus from various close by resturants that deliver. After traveling all day with our 2 year old it was nice to have everything there.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Absolutely outstanding for families with kids. The suites nicely accomodate a large family. The included full breakfast served in the beautiful atrium is the perfect way to get every day of the holiday started.

review.title: Will Return
review.reviewText: Crowded but nice. Breakfast was good but had to stand in line to be served. Ran out of some food Items.

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: I love staying at Embassy Suites and this one in Burlingame is no exception. The room was super clean and comfortable as was the rest of the hotel. The bed was really comfortable, though I would recommend bringing your own pillows as they were too soft for me. The breakfast was wonderful and there was something for everyone from eggs, meat and potatoes, to muffins, fruit and oat meal. I will definately stay here again.

review.title: Not very impressed
review.reviewText: this hotel was extremely noisy as there was 3 weddings all the same day.Had to wait a long time to get breakfast in the morning, and there wasn't anywhere to sit. Bathroom light was not working when we arrived, took about 2 hours to fix.

review.title: Anyone who wishes to complain about this hotel has to make stuff up!
review.reviewText: The Embassy Suites in Burlingame, CA (just South of SF) was wonderful! Our suite had two very high quality and comfortable beds in the main bedroom plus a pull out in the living room. There was internet hook-up, a refridgerator and a microwave in our room as well as two flat screen TV's. All of the rooms faced the lush foilage of the atrium which was absolutely beautiful. Our room faced the East so we watched the sun rise over the San Francisco Bay as the airplanes flew into the city. The grounds were manicured in a spectacular manner. The hotel lay right on the bay so just walking outdoors meant you were almost "on" the water. A beautiful paved path for walking or running was between the hotel and the water. A complimentary made-to-order breakfast was served each morning and a "happy hour" was offered each night. The staff was helpful, courteous and friendly. My only complaint was that one elevator was out-of-order and the dryer's heat element was damaged but hey, I was just glad there was a coin washer/dryer on site as a family of five for five days goes through a lot of laundry! Highly recommended hotel!

review.title: Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: The Embassy Suites in Burlingame, CA is a great stay. The staff was very helpful. The rooms were way more than what we expected and very accomdating. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. The facility, as a whole, was very pleasing and enjoyable. Even though the hotel is located close to San Fran International, which by the way we found very convenient, the rooms were very quiet and comfortable.

review.title: Big room
review.reviewText: Great room, perfect for a family. We had two very comfortable beds with a seperate room that had a tv and a sofa bed. We only stayed our last night in San Francisco to be by the airport, but we wished we had been there all week. The breakfast that was include was great, not just a continential.

review.title: My stay at the hotel
review.reviewText: I'm looking forward my next visit I was a very good experience

review.title: Great Deal!!!!
review.reviewText: We go to SF at least once a year and this is the hotel we will be staying on from now on. The room was very spacious, comfortable, and most importantly clean. I couldn't believe the free breakfast they offer is made to order. It saved us time and money.

review.title: Place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel service was fabulous! Any thing we needed they had it before we asked! Loved it! Free shuttle to airport and free shuttle to the BART make everything accessible if you like to be away from the city. Scenery of the bay was fantastic!

review.title: Great Hotel for Good Price
review.reviewText: Wes stayed in a 6th-floor bay-view room with a kind be and a separate suite with a large desk. The room had two flat-panel TVs and other amenities as well. They served cook-to-order complementary breakfast (omelets and pancakes were cooked in front of us). The access to SFO was very easy and only 5 minutes (I think it would take you only 10 minutes to get SFO even during rush hours). You don't have to take US101 if you want to use local streets. No worry with getting lost on the way. Two disappointments about the hotel. 1) The lobby was a little unorganized and noisy for this class of hotel. When we arrived, some children were running around. I personally don't like a hotel to where parents take their children, but nothing annoyed us in our own room, so it was OK. 2) The hotel has a bar named Ring(if I remember right). Some attendants were rude and didn't know how to treat their customers. The bar itself has nice bay view with SFO and Bay Bridge in the background. Overall, we enjoyed our stay there and will go back again if we have a chance.

review.title: Great Stay....will stay here again
review.reviewText: Very nice stay..clean rooms and very comfy beds. Room was a bit hot, but easily controlled by AC and you can open the balcony doors. Suite was very nicely sized, plenty of room to spread out. Housekeeping was very helpful if you forgot something. Made to order hot or cold breakfast was great...Someother reviews stated that it was over crowded or the hotel ran out of food. We did not experience anything like that. It's worth going back just for the breakfast. Heated pool was great for the children and nice workout room. We could not have asked for a better stay. Would tell anyone to stay here. Very ,very please with this hotel.

review.title: Amazing Stay
review.reviewText: Everyone was VERY helpful and made accommodations wonderful. Also, it was very sweet that the hotel acknowledged my anniversary by giving us the complimentary champagne! Breakfast was amazing and very filling and comfort level was high! Thank You!!!!

review.title: Good with the bad...
review.reviewText: When we were there, it was the big storm that happened right after new years 2008 (January 5th-ish?). The power was out when we arrived, and we did not get it back until about 3 hours after check-in. They had free food and drinks in the lobby, and were doing pretty well with a bad situation. They also told us about local pizza places that were delivering as well, which we used. They gave us about 10 chem-lights to light the room while we waited. Once the lights came on WOW! Big rooms! It was hard to tell in the dark. Overall a very nice place, and our check-in went surprisingly smooth even thought there were obvious hardships they were dealing with no power. I would stay there if I had to be near the airport, but not if I were vacationing and wanted to go downtown every day. BUT... The room was a lot cheaper than the downtown hotel we had, and a lot bigger. So one might be willing to sacrifice a larger room for the inconvenience of driving into town each day.

review.title: The hotel is in need of refurbishing and repair not impressed
review.reviewText: Embassy Suites is a favorite for me when we travel. This facility was overcrowded and did not have the support staff to make breakfast happen for the guests. Long lines, no place to sit, ran out of supplies and the experience was more like a battle than breakfast. The hotel needs updating - refurbishing of rooms, carpet, wall covering. The pullout sofa bed in our room fell apart every night - very uncomfortable. The heating was very noisy and not level in the two rooms - over hot in one, cold in the other. Since we stayed in the days after Christmas I would think the staff would have been increased to facilitate a very crowded hotel.

review.title: Very good family hotel
review.reviewText: Overall hotel services were very good. But too many guests stayed,and accordingly breakfast services were not satisfactory. Long line ,no plates were available, no tables were available.

review.title: Not impressed with this particular Embassy Suites Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel based on convenience to the airport and based on Expedia's reviews. We stayed here upon our arrival to SF and upon our departure from SF. SF was not our final destination. Our first night, we had problems with the heat. The room was so hot you couldn't breathe. It wouldn't turn off nor could we cool the room. The heat was being controlled by the hotel and we were told it would be taken care of. I don't believe it was because we left our window opened all night and it was still hot. Needless to say, we didn't sleep soundly. The next day, after returning from breakfast, the door would not open with our key card. We had to go downstairs for a new key card. That didn't work and had to go back downstairs to have the desk clerk try her key card. That didn't work. Then we had to wait on maintenance to come and fish underneath the door to pull the handle from inside, which took forever. Upon checkout, the desk clerk promised a room with a view upon our return later in the week. We returned and did get the promised room. However, later that night the toilet stopped up and no we didn't put anything that is not suppose to be in there. The next morning we went down for breakfast and the courtyard was full of people. There was no where to sit or stand. Most of the bread and fruits were almost gone and hadn't be restocked and there wasn't even a tray to put your food on. It was ridulous. I left without breakfast and ate at the airport.

review.title: Not a bad deal
review.reviewText: The hotel is pretty nice and we had pretty good service. I didn't like the fact that we had to pay for internet in our rooms but I believe that was the only down side of it. The breakfast was decent, the rooms were clean and we had a great view of the bay. It is also a good location for plane spotters. You can see all the planes coming in to land at SFO.

review.title: Best Hotel I've Stayed In
review.reviewText: Very professional and kind hotel staff

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel because of a seminar that I was taking. I usually don't stay at Embassy Suites chains but I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the room and set up (great feather pillows and bedding). There was no valet service which always surprises me and the staff didn't seem to be too knowledgeable of where every thing was (but it could be b/c it was recently renovated)....It's near the airport which is good if you want something close to the airport. I'd stay again if I had to be in the area...Great for business travelers.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: I know we were close to the airport, but the soundproofing in the room was far from adequate. We hardly slept all night because of the constant airplane noise overhead.

review.title: Not luxurious but comfortable...
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our recent stay at the Embassy Suites. The rooms were nice, clean, and the service was good. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was amazing, and the restaurant downstairs had a nice Thanksgiving buffet.

review.title: front desk service is poor
review.reviewText: front desk service is really poor, however, service for the remainder was fine. overall, the hotel fit my purpose of giving me a place to crash at night. the rooms are large and the beds are comfortable. all and all, my stay was alright and i'd stay there again despite the sad service.

review.title: Awesome place to stay
review.reviewText: This was a great place for a weekend getaway, not to far from the city, but beautiful atmosphere in and out of the hotel. We received a nice surprise with the Manager's reception on Sat. night with complimentary cocktails.

review.title: Good comfort hotel with indoor swimming pool
review.reviewText: This hotel is conventiently located close to the SFO airport and the city of San Francisco. The lobby area is tranquil and they have a fabulous free breakfast feast and Happy Hour. Their hotel restaurant is good. It is a good place to rest and relax. We especially enjoyed the indoor pool with their jacuzzi.

review.title: Great Breakfast buffet!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great! The only problem is the check-in was not satisfying. We were advised that are room will be ready in a minute so we sat down on the couch to wait. The lady who was helping us at San FRancisco Airport was busy talking to another employee in the check-in counter. It was over a minute and maybe we thought she will call us. Well after 30min she checked-in a new person and forgot about us. So, if you are staying here make sure you ask, What do you mean when you say a minute? Overall the stay was great! People are very friendly

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Stayed here on a stop over between flights. Very clean, I think it has been recently refurbished. Very large rooms with bedroom and sitting room. Good size bathroom with decent shower. Comfy bed. Breakfast was 7am - 9.30am with cooked breakfast, omelettes, cereals, etc. They shut up at 9.30am so don't be late! Free internet access in lobby. Late check out at 1pm was good for us and free shuttle bus as well. Highly recommended!

review.title: beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: beautiful hotel surrounded by the ocen we had a wonderful stay and it was very reasonable. with even free internet which was a big plus as all hotels we had to pay heavily.

review.title: 5 star hotel without the price tag!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: the staff was absolutely wonderful, especially Danny from the front desk. room was very comfortable, had that homey feeling. room service food was hot and delicious and very fast. i am partially disable and found the hotel very handicap friendly. i would definitely stay again and have already recommended it to friends that have booked it next week, after their trip to vegas.

review.title: Report
review.reviewText: Excellent accommodation

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: beautiful hotel

review.title: Impressive Location
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel in convenient location. Refurbishing done well.

review.title: Happy customer
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for one night only. I wish we stayed here for our entire visit of five days. The atmosphere is very kid friendly and the breakfast was out of the world. Very good service and friendly staff. From now on every time we go to SF we will stay in this hotel.

review.title: Extraordinary Hotel Experience
review.reviewText: Our recent stay at the Embassy Suites San Francisco-Burlingame was a very exceptional and extraordinary experience. The accommodations and room service were above standards. The top of the benefits package was the breakfast serving, and pleasant surroundings with staff. We will make certain that on the next pleasure trip we undertake we will definitely be booking with the Embassy Suites folks. Thank you all for your warm and caring service. You made us think we were special, and made our visit to San Francisco an everlasting joy filled memory. A special "Thank You" to Danny at the front desk. He was instrumental in providing us with directions and documents during our travel.

review.title: South Bay Perfection
review.reviewText: Great hotel and service, directly on the bay very close to the airport. It is very peaceful and quite.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Embassy Suites San Francisco Airport was wonderful. We had a corner room with a view of SF bay and the planes landing at SFO (but we could not hear them inside the room). The shuttle service worked out great for us. The breakfast was extensive and the food was only slightly better than average (but it came with the room so it worked out well for us).

review.title: Wonderful for Business or pleasure
review.reviewText: Have you ever found yourself going to the nearest store within minutes of checking in because the hotel doesnt have what you need, me too, but not on this trip. This hotel had many things that you others either dont have or charge you more for. Internet access is free, yet not in your room but rather in a centralized location downstairs in the business area which has 3 PCs and another 2 located outside of the office and you can print items to the front desk. Breakfast was quickly served, hot and plentiful. The pool was great and included a sauna, hot tub and kiddie pool (adult swim in the evening) all along side a rather large fitness/workout area. The gift shop a number of items including OTC medication, diapers, drinks, books, magazines and, just in case you forgot to pickup that toy cable car for you kids, a nice assortment of souvenirs that you can buy with or without the San Francisco name on them. The staff was very nice and the room was more than enough to take my family of five. There is room service from their own restaurant with meals starting around $18 or several local places that will deliver which are listed on your room info cards. The hotel is located about 5 minutes from SFO (depending on traffic) and is located close enough to freeway for easy access but far enough that you dont need to blast the TV to drum out the sounds of traffic. Rooms include many amenities and if you dont find it, ask for it, they even had fans available at no charge.

review.title: Would definitely go back!!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites - rooms were comfortable/clean, breakfast included was very good. Enjoyed the pool and the walking paths by the water/hotel. If we had to ask the staff for anything, they were polite and prompt to help you out. At the end of the day, we were pleasantly surprised by the open bar service and relaxing atmosphere. If we go back, we would definitely stay there again.

review.title: What a breakfast!
review.reviewText: I think my daughter gained several pounds because of the free breakfast (especially cooked to order eggs). We loved the coffee-espresso/chocolate machines. The breakfast ambiance was great - eating in an indoor garden! Consider bringing your breakfast outside and watch the planes take off and land amidst SFO bay/beach. What a sight! The suite we had was large and complete. But the refrigerator did not work well. My daughter's ice cream melted ... freezer was not working well. I always consider hotels with pools and spas. But this hotel did maintenance on its spa during the day. Why not do it when it is off time. Overall, I would still choose this hotel when visiting SFO again. We really enjoyed our stay there.

review.title: beware of parking
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and service but the parking was a nightmare to say the least!!! The hotel was booked for a convention and several events the weekend we stayed and parking was not available, even though they arranged to have backup lots for guests, they too were filled to the brim with double parked guests and partiers.

review.title: Very good choice
review.reviewText: The Hotel is very nice, the breakfast is great, the rooms are vey confortable. Nobody clean my kids room for two days

review.title: Great Hotel for Families
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Embassy Suites Hotel San Francisco was just great. We were treated courteously and the service was good. A nice feature of our stay was the wonderful complimentary breakfast and happy hour each day hosted in the hotel's beautiful atrium. The rooms were clean and well appointed with a pull out couch which allowed the room to sleep up to 5 people. Ammenities included a nice pool / hot tubs and a great trail outside the hotel for walking, running or biking.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, breakfast was fantastic

review.title: Central location that makes travel convenient
review.reviewText: Accommodated my early check in request. Hotel seemed well maintained and clean. Front office staff should smile to make them approachable rather than "stuffy". Otherwise, staff at the breakfast buffet and afternoon cocktails seemed happy at what they are doing. Would be nice to have more than one washer and dryer on each floor.

review.title: Beautiful place to stay
review.reviewText: Scenery is beautiful... on the bay. Atrium courtyard inside is beautiful. Very relaxing. Near airport, right off of Rt 101 so it is easy to get anywhere you want, North to San Franciso or south to San Jose, Santa Cruz, or into the mountains. Very easy drive, not too far. Great central location if you want to vary where you sightsee. Highly recommend this hotel!

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: As close to the Bay and still on land as possible. Beautiful parklike grounds on the water. We had a near perfect vacation in July '07.

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: We received outstanding service, advice, driving directions, and much "typical tourist assistance" from the personnel at this hotel. Breakfast is outstanding. Beautiful, clean room. I highly recommend this hotel, and will choose the Embassy Suites chain for future vacations at other locations.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The Embassy Suite was very nice. If you don't mind catching the BART to get downtown it's worth it. The shuttle from the hotel takes you to the airport so that you can catch the BART. One of the best things that I liked about the hotel was free breakfast every morning.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: I was not as impressed with this Embassy as I had hoped. They promised a corner suite, which we did not get. We stayed for a week and housekeeping missed quite a few days. Hotel is a bit older. Beautiful location.

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: Great hotel, only 15 minutes drive into San Fran on the 101, ideal if you have a hire car. We found the suited accommodation far superior to normal hotel room only- it was extremely spacious and accommodated four adults comfortably - complimentary breakfast and evening drinks make this high standard accommodation excellent value. If ever visiting San Fran again would return to this hotel.

review.title: Okay, but could improve
review.reviewText: We like the location and have stayed there before. The hotel was recently renovated, a good thing. Meals via room service were excellent. The complimentary breakfast service is much improved. The daily cleanliness of our room was less than satisfactory. Maid service was inconsistent, poor at best. Better QC on the part of management would likely correct this problem.

review.title: Work in progress
review.reviewText: Beautiful view, courteous employees, excellent food. Malfunctioning toilet, loud fan, old furniture, and small t.v.s.

review.title: Rooms are hot
review.reviewText: Even with the thermostat that you actually have control of, the room never got cooler. Also, the free continental breakfast setup is a zoo!!! You don't have actual access to the foods, they serve it to you from behind a kitchen counter. It is not worth having breakfast there. Convenience to the airport is a good thing because of the shuttle service.

review.title: Love the hotel not the hassle to get breakfast!
review.reviewText: The complimentary breakfast was a big hassle.

review.title: Good Stay Overall - Could use some improvements
review.reviewText: Positives: Good price when booked through Expedia, especially since breakfast was included. Convenient location Friendly, helpful Staff Nightly cocktail hour Atrium area very lovely for relaxing Negatives: *Sofa bed extremely uncomfortable *Breakfast not well streamlined for so many guests, often no silverware or napkins, had to go to different locations for eggs, toast, fruit, etc. Not enough tables and chairs to accommodate everyone. Availability of foods declined daily from the first day we arrived to the day we left. *Maid service not timely - came back one day at 4:00 to find the maid just getting to our room. When she saw us, she left and never did the room. We had to call the front desk to request she come back. *No remote for second TV - not good when traveling with teenagers. We never got another even though we requested one.

review.title: Embassy Suites San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the hotel after we were moved from our first room. We had a non-smoking room that smelled strong of smoke. We discovered that someone had put a glass with a cigar butt out on the balcony. When my husband took the glass down to the front dest, they apologized and put us in a different room. The hotel is beautful and everything was very nice. Sincerely, Judy N

review.title: Comfortable and quiet
review.reviewText: The rooms are off balconies surrounding the atrium. I was worried about the noise from kids, but it was actually very quiet and the bed was really comfortable. Everything was great, except there isn't enough seating for the complementary breakfast in the atrium and my husband and I had to make a few laps before we got a table. Also, the signs aren't very big, so quite a few people didn't know that you have to use your room key to access the upper floors. We figured it out pretty quickly, but one woman we talked to stood in the elevator a while before someone helped her.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Very nice rooms. There was a children's party going on at the pool all day, so we couldn't use those facilities which was kind of a bummer.

review.title: Food was great
review.reviewText: Good place to stay with the kids. Nice size rooms, only problem was they have no roll away beds. Rooms where large and the food was GREAT.We would stay there again.

review.title: Great room and service
review.reviewText: We, a family of four, stayed at this hotel for four nights. The room, standard double queen bed room, was large and clean enough for us to relax after the long flight. As others say, free breakfast and evening Happy Hour (free drinking) were really good. Cheffs cook tasty omlette for us and servers provide great cocktails. We will definitely stay here again at our next travel to SFC. One negative point is the WiFi internet service wasn't free and the access speed was terribly slow. I recommend you use the free internet service, which is fast enough, at the business center located near the front desk.

review.title: Amazing Hotel
review.reviewText: I must say that the Embassy Suites have to be one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. The hotel is huge, the rooms are big and have everything you could imagen, incredible views of the bay and the San Francisco skyline depending on the side of the hotel your staying in. The restaurant in the hotel is a little expensive, which is to be expected for a 4 star hotel, price aside they offer some great steaks.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: My family and I really enjoyed the Embassy Suites. The breakfast cooked to order was delicious. All of the Staff from the Front Desk to the Housekeeping people were very professional and polite. And to have Cocktail hour for free, was fun when we could be there. Overall we wish we would had more time to spend in our Hotel because it was so pleasant.

review.title: Nice atmosphere and great breakfast
review.reviewText: The Atrium is great, the view is very nice and the breakfast is good except it was very crowded. Enjoy your stay...great for families

review.title: Very pleased to stay there.
review.reviewText: Good hotel, good location. Liked the free WIFI internet service.

review.title: Went 1st time, went 2nd time
review.reviewText: We went once as a family last year, went back just my husband and I this time. Loved the service, especially at the Free Breakfast, it is busy, but they move everyone through very quickly, which is a bonus with kids. You ask for something, you get it immediately.

review.title: Avoid
review.reviewText: Hotel had a "function" going on my first night. Music was played loud until midnight PT (3 am my time). Couldn't sleep and as a result went 24 hours without sleep. Also, complimentary breakfast had very little selection when I got there. Everything had been picked over. Also, for some reason, you have to hold down the toilet lever for at least 30 seconds to get it to flush. There are other hotels close to the airport. They have to be better than this.

review.title: eh
review.reviewText: If you are a late sleeper, this is not the hotel for you. If you miss the housekeeping rounds, don't try calling them, they probably wont pickup. Also, the room looked like it was involved in a raid just before us. broken deadbolt-broken internal door, etc..

review.title: The Hotel was great
review.reviewText: It was better than expected, the stay was great the shuttle to the airport was ontime

review.title: San Francisco excelent option
review.reviewText: It is an excelent option visiting San Francisco. The complementary breakfast is excelent.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff and a beuatiful atmosphere.

review.title: impressive airport hotel
review.reviewText: Lots of space, get for short stay near the airport

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Guest service was horrible, most employees were rude. Constant mechanical problems with the elevators. A lot of children and teens running around unsupervised. Pool closed several times throughout our stay. All suites are advertised as having views of the bay or lagoon and this is not true. Our first room didn't have a view of anything except the parking lot. After making the front desk aware of their advertisement of bay views, we were moved to a room with a view of the lagoon. Then the next night we finally got our room with a view of the bay. Breakfast buffet was a nice idea, but very busy. Food selection was very basic and was about the same every day. Be aware of the hours of operation of the breakfast buffet because they close down so quickly and if you show up a minute late, they will not make you anything to eat!!

review.title: Ideal for Family travel
review.reviewText: We travelled with 2 teenagers so the two room suite plus fold out couch worked great. The BayView Suite was definitely a plus as we looked out over the water and could watch the planes land and takeoff(it was amazingly quiet in the room). Excellent walking, running, biking trail runs through the property. The location worked great as we spent 2 days touring San Francisco and 2 days touring the Silicon Valley area (San Jose, Santa Clara, Stanford campus) and the Monterey Peninsula. We had a rental car so the free parking worked out great and it was only 15 minutes to the airport rental car return. Can't say enough good things about the friendly staff and the great buffet breakfast int the atrium included in your room--eggs,bacon,pancakes, cereals, fruit, beverages. We also enjoyed the snacks at the afternoon reception. It was a nice break while we decided on dinner.

review.title: Nice Hotel.
review.reviewText: A very comfortable Hotel. Got nice breakfast and free parking, but still want to charge you Internet access. If it has a free internet, this hotel will be perfect for traveler to San Francisco.

review.title: Great free breakfast, shuttle to & from airport, would recommend this to anyone.
review.reviewText: I was very disappointed the sofa bed had dirty sheets on it. Arriving late @ night didn't allow for maid service to replace w/clean sheets & blankets.

review.title: Comfortable and cosy
review.reviewText: Embassy Suites Burlingame provides guests with a nice view. The room is large enough and quite comfortable and cosy for a family of 4.

review.title: upgrades in progress
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with the embasy suites ammenities. Good breakfast service. They were in the process of doing some upgrades to the hotel so the construction work detracted from the stay, but in the long run it will be nicer. This hotel is on the bay and has a long walkway along the bay and is next to a park. If you are a walker or jogger this is the perfect location for you.

review.title: you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Hotel was rated 4 stars. Are they kidding? I needed a room after my flight was cancelled. Airport proximate hotels are always a gamble- the wear and tear makes them undesireable but to a business traveler, a necesssry evil. My only recourse is to always look for 4 -5 stars, this hotel had a nice location on the Bay, space, and a free breakfast, but the staff was not guest friendly, the rooms looked shabby, the free breakfast while a lot of food had a lot of people was disorganized and not very good ( McDonalds would have been an improvement) and the excercise area and pool was a mess with splashed water and kids screaming. I was able to jog on the outside paths, but I hated the noise level, slow elevators, and crowds. Rate this place 2 stars at the most- and that's a gift!!!

review.title: A great option around the airport
review.reviewText: The hotel has recently undergone a renovation. The result is good. The rooms are typical of the Suites, clean spacious and well maintained. The breakfast area looked to be clean and well utilized. This is by far the best deal around the airport for business travelers. I will stay again.

review.title: We were impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel was in the process of renovation. Our room was already remodeled--very nice..only exception, bathroom could have used some updating also--Overall very pleased, 2 room suite, pool, made to order breakfast and complimentary cocktails were much appreciated..

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Our first room had air conditioning issues, but the staff was very accomodating and moved us to another room. The happy hour and breakfast were wonderful! The view by the bay is incredible.

review.title: Embassy Suites - Burlingame, CA
review.reviewText: The breakfast was great, however the phone by the bed was not working and the bathroom faucet leaked. Had a bit of difficulty getting the room to a comfortable temperature, but did manage to do that.

review.title: Very relaxing place to be
review.reviewText: Execilent and quick services. The sorounding outside and inside the hotel was amazingly peacepul and relaxing. Me and my wife enjoy the walking in the path next to the breeze of the ocean bay side.

review.title: Great Features for reasonable price in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: Great location; close to airport, city attractions; private setting; great walking path on SF Bay. Complete breakfast service provides almost every possible breakfast entre in a convienent and pleasant setting in atrium, at no extra charge. Our family would have preferred option of 2 Queen size beds instead of 2 double beds. Furnishings are somewhat dated. Hotel in process of remodeling rooms - some already being done. We saw the new furnishings and they will definitely update hotel appearance. Hopefully, beds will be replaced with 2 Queens. We very much liked the 2 separate rooms, each with own TV; 2nd room has hide-a-bed couch so 5 can sleep in suite without any special arrangements Enjoyed having refridgerator, micorwave, coffemaker. Atrium with waterfall, fish is beautiful. Hotel restaurant is excellent but expensive (especially for a family where all order the best entrees; prices consistant with typical SF fine dining though. Easy access to area attractions.

review.title: room rundown
review.reviewText: Embassy Suites has a very high reputation to live up to. On my stay at the Burlingame Hotel, the hotel service personnel, the atrium area, and the complimentary breakfast totally lived up to that reputation. My room, however, was a let down. While the hotel was in the process of remodeling, as of yet they have not down anything to the rooms. My sofa was sagging in the middle from too much use and very uncomfortable to sit on, the drapes were not hung properly, the TV in the bedroom did not work (I asked the desk to have it fixed - and they did immediately, however it still kept going out because the problem was in the wiring and in order to work I had to keep moving them - which is probably what they did in the first place), the room had a musty smell, and the ice machine on my floor was broken. All things that I would expect from a Motel 6 but not the Embassy Suites!

review.title: Easy access to everything we wanted to do...
review.reviewText: The food and service were great! Right on the Bay, the location was beautiful and provided easy access to all the area attractions. I'd definitely stay there again.

review.title: will go there again!
review.reviewText: We have stayed at other ES before, but this one seemed to have the best to offer. Front desk went above an beyond to help our stay and touring be as easy as possible. Plan to stay there again if I ever go back to visit the area.

review.title: quite good
review.reviewText: having breakfast downstairs with our 3 kids was a bit difficult.The place was crowded, people were waiting in line.. They should review the organization to make breakfast time more enjoyable for all the family !

review.title: Would return
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine, the location was a little out of the way.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We thought the hotel was very nice. We stayed in a room not facing the bay and moved to a room facing the bay. The room facing the bay was in a little better condition. The view was fabulous, we could see the bay bridge, Oakland and downtown San francisco. The hotel is on the waterfront with a nice walking path right out the door. The complimentary breakfast is always nice.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Noisey & crowded. No handicapped parking (or any other parking for that matter). Extremely hard to find. Way too expensive for the quality!

review.title: I will stay at this Hotel again!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Great breckfast, good happy hour,very friendly staff.

review.title: Great Hotel if you have kids
review.reviewText: I had four children including an infant and the room was spacious and very comfortable. The continantal breakfast was awesome. This is our new Hotel for future trips up North.

review.title: Best space
review.reviewText: Air conditioner didn't worked properly. But everythings was good.

review.title: Great for Kids!
review.reviewText: This is definitely a 4 star hotel. The location was fantastic with a lovely walking path along the bay. The free breakfast and evening reception was a tremendous value. The only areas less then perfect were the bathroom is outdated and there were parties and weddings on 2 of the 3 nights we were there, which created noise in the living room area until midnight. It was well worth the noise inconvenience in order to enjoy all of the great things the hotel had to offer.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: I have never stayed at a hotel where there are always people cleaning and working everywhere. This is an older building that is maintained superbly. The breaksfast and manager's reception was great.

review.title: Perfect for families
review.reviewText: We found this hotel to be perfect for families. We are a family of 6 who, when traveling, finds it difficult to find a hotel that can accomodate us comfortably without costing a fortune. The Embassy Suites chain fits our every need when traveling with our children. They even offer a complimentary, full breakfast every day of your stay which is a huge relief to us timewise and financially. If I had to chose one aspect of our stay that was slightly problematic it would be communicating with the housekeeping staff. Many of the housekeepers could not speak nor understand English which posed an inconvenience when trying to request additional towels or when trying to let them know that we were not ready for the room to be made up (one housekeeper stood in the doorway to our room as were still dressing for the day - slightly odd!). It would be more helpful if they were bilingual. Other than problems communicating with the housekeeping staff, we will definitely stay at another Embassy Suites.

review.title: Fair, not great, hotel
review.reviewText: The lobby & grounds were nice. Good view of bay but so close to airport we could smell jet fuel. Sofa bed very uncomfortable. Hotel employees were rude and constantly pushing carts through the lobby without consideration for guests. Very crowded & warm. Pool small. Rooms were spacious. Breakfast is good and convenient. Restaurant pricy.

review.title: Quality Comfort
review.reviewText: My four kids and I spent the night at this hotel prior to our flight. The accomodations, service and comfort of this hotel were very good. I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Quality has deteriorated in 6 months
review.reviewText: Last time we stayed at the Embassy Suites in Burlingame, CA, just 6 months ago, it was a better experience. This time the hotel was noisy all night and the water refilled the toilet in our bathroom at least once an hour. You still get a lot for your money.

review.title: A quality hotel
review.reviewText: We have always been happy with Embassy Suites. The size of the rooms and furnishings, especially. This particular hotel could have been closer to the airport.

review.title: Free breakfast and cocktails!
review.reviewText: This hotel was not near anything else so you need a car and energy to leave for meals and recreation. The suite was very roomy and well-kept. Two seperate rooms were great for traveling with the family. Lovely cooked-to-order breakfast and free "happy hour" (actually 2 hours) every evening. We had a corner suite that was very quiet as it was not right on the atrium. While we would have preferred a location closer to some activity in SF, the facilities of the hotel were great.

review.title: Real old property in need of a facelift
review.reviewText: This hotel I used to stay in when I was travelling in the late 80's, and I don't think they have done much to it since. Certainly NOT a 4 star hotel. Highly over rated The door frame to the outside had mold all over it, the bathroom door frame was rusted, the bath grout was extremely dirty/black/mold. No free Wi-FI, 10.00 per day charge for internet and only worked by the front door. The 2 jacuzzis did not work. Was supposed to get a bayside view room and were sold out when we checked it at 5pm. The good points, location to transportation/Bart was great, restaraunt was extremely high quality although expensive. Happy hour and breakfast haven't changed much throughout the years. Employees were great.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel. The staff was very attentive. I like the free breakfast and free happy hour. I would definetely stay at this chain of hotels again in the future.

review.title: Relaxation
review.reviewText: This was a great place to end our San Fran trip. Close to the airport and rental car return. Great size rooms for people with kids. Great breakfast to start our morning everything my child could want was there or cooked to order as part of our room rate. She loved the coy ponds around the hotel. We were disappointed at the pool. It was beautiful but was being repaired because of the boiler was broken. However I would highly recommend it for travelers with or without families.

review.title: Very impressed!
review.reviewText: The Embassy Suites Hotel was extraordinary! I was delighted with the service. The room was lovely, faced the water and was extremely private. The atrium in the center of the hotel was beautiful and relaxing. Happy hour was enjoyable and the hotel offered quick efficient room service.

review.title: It's ok-but don't count on going to sleep early
review.reviewText: Everything about the hotel is exactly as written, however all the rooms are built around a courtyard and there is a bar/dance place down stairs where they have weddings, etc. and on Saturday night the band did not finish until 1 a.m., then there was cleanup....not my idea of a restful night

review.title: Good standard, but too busy to clean properly
review.reviewText: The hotel was very busy, with many arrangements for several customers, and was fully booked. Unfortunally that showed on the cleaning. The room wasent cleaned properly, especially the floor. They didnt waccum for 5 days at all. Besides that, everything else was fine. Good service, shuttle transportation, happy hour, breakfast, morning paper, etc. A place worth going back to.

review.title: Dirty overshadowed View
review.reviewText: Room was large with a nice view, but a bit too loud and (at least my room) suprisingly dirty. I found it too far from the city but great proximity to airport.

review.title: Probably would stay again
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was a good one. Three sinks in the room, large refrigerator, real glasses and coffee cups. But little things irritated. Parking was difficult to almost impossible in the evenings because of other hotel functions (wedding receptions, etc.) Elevator on one side was broken for most of one day. Air conditioning quit one morning, complained when we called for a third time, telling us it was fixed but did not call room to check. Housekeeping failed to leave enough glasses and towels for all in the room. No towels at the pool in the middle of the day. Still breakfast buffet was excellent as was the coffee. Rooms were quiet but could have used better pillows, really flat. Convenient to San Francisco and Palo Alto.

review.title: OK for purpose of trip
review.reviewText: I stayed there for business and found the quality/upkeep of the room to be far less than i expected. The plumbing pipes in the bathroom sounded like they would explode when i turned on the faucets, wallpaper was coming off walls in the bathrooms, the bedroom cabinets were falling apart, and tv remotes didnt work. Since i did not spend a lot of time in the room, it didnt bother too much. If i were staying there for pleasure, i would have reconsidered.

review.title: Busy place
review.reviewText: Very busy and loud in the common areas, but WIFI was great and the place was beautiful

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, would definitely stay there again. The hotel staff were really friendly. Rooms need some renovation though. Overall, a great hotel in a great location.

review.title: review
review.reviewText: Service was very helpful, but we did not get our wake-up call.

review.title: Gorgeous San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: A great view, beautiful atrium, great breakfast.  Only negative was the loud music all night from a dance bar which one can feebly hear through the rooms but fun anyway.

review.title: Good value, good location
review.reviewText: We loved the inside, the way it was like an atrium. The breakfast buffet included with room was excellent! Large selection of food, hot and cold. The restaurant inside the hotel was a bit pricey. We opted for ordering pizza. The delivery of pizza to the room was a plus.

review.title: Great value.
review.reviewText: Decent room, decent service, free happy hour, free breakfast buffet.  For the price, you can't go wrong.  Not a five star accomodation, but you're not paying for one either!

review.title: Good place to stay near airport and bay
review.reviewText: The hotel has a beautiful setting on the San Francisco Bay and is right on the walking path along the Bay.  Near good restaurants and conventient too many attractions.  My biggest complaint would be the quality and quantity of equipment in the "fitness center."  The "center" was poorly maintained with old equipment, half of which was out of order during our stay.  There was also signs of significant water damage in the room, with buckets placed around to catch drips.

review.title: SF Airport
review.reviewText: Easy shuttle to and fro, comfortable bed, good breakfast.  Limited hours on room service if you get in late.

review.title: The best view
review.reviewText: Right on the bay with a view of planes landing at sfo

review.title: Loud Night Club Attatched to Hotel.
review.reviewText: This hotel has a night club whos doors open into the atrium.  Untill very late at night, any time that someone would go in or out of the hotel would just blast the whole hotel with loud music.  It woke my kids up more then once.  Breakfast was good. They are in the middle of renovating, some rooms had new beds, ours didn't.

review.title: Great place for familes
review.reviewText: Very comfortable accomodations. King bed in separate area and pull out sofa for our 4yrold and enough room for a crib in the adjacent area. But all for the price of one room. Lots of pool activity as it turns out local families come here to celebrate birthdays with the whole birthday party. Great gourmet type restaurant but also has kids menu!!! Nice courtyard with water attractions but a bit crowded for the free morning breakfast buffet. Good breakfast food but it was hard to find a table at 9am. Perhaps because there was a wedding the previous night. Nice walk along the bay the next morning. Highly recommend this one.

review.title: "Wireless Broadband?" Don't count on it.......
review.reviewText:
This hotel contracts their "wireless broadband" with vLINK, which they heavily tout and cost $10 a day.  But THREE days out of THREE that I was there, the service went limp in the morning (not dead, just limp), very frustrating if you are trying to do business.  If it is totally dead then you'd find a Starbucks or a Kinkos, but when it connects one minute and then not the next (after it takes your money) and then it crawls.....  AGHH!!!! 

Hotel is great except for that.

review.title: Would not recommend
review.reviewText: While the common areas are beautiful, the rooms leave much to be desired.  The furniture is quite used and the bathroom was in need of a much-needed facelift and mildew removal.  Also, I'm sure that my perception of the hotel was colored by the fact that it appeared that dirty sheets were left on the pullout couch, and given that there were old fast food wrappers left in the trash can in the bedroom.
